story:
Our Story

My name is Thomas Hauer Jr., and I am a recently discharged US Army veteran living in North Carolina. Throughout my military career, my wife Sarah and I have always dreamed of moving out of the country to Costa Rica and starting our own small business. Now, after 5 years on active duty and 2 combat deployments to Afghanistan, my service in the US military has come to an end. My wife and I are finally able to leave the rat race and a restrictive military lifestyle so we can follow our wildest dreams. We have sold everything that we own, except for our clothes, laptop and our two dogs Nala and Buddy. With that money and all of our savings, we will be taking the biggest step of our lives when we move to Costa Rica on April 22nd, 2015.

Since Sarah and I both love the outdoors and a laid back lifestyle, we not only want to live the Pura Vida (a Costa Rican expression, meaning Pure Life) in Costa Rica, but also want to promote the country's incredible ecosystem and array of outdoor activities. To do this, we purchased the franchise rights to begin publishing the Costa Rican edition of Coastal Angler Magazine. This magazine is a free bimonthly publication, dedicated to the fishing, boating and outdoor enthusiasts of Costa Rica. In addition, we will be starting Adventure Costa Rica, which will be a reputable source to book fishing trips and favorite outdoor activities. So not only will we be informing readers of all the amazing things Costa Rica has to offer, we will also be assisting them in experiencing the best outdoor adventures of their lives.

The Impacts

While Costa Rica is gaining popularity for its’ unbeatable fishing opportunities and pure natural beauty, there is no magazine dedicated to the fishing, boating and outdoor enthusiasts of this flourishing country. By publishing our magazine in Costa Rica, we will be giving this wonderful community the recognition and support it deserves. Coastal Angler Magazine will also allow businesses and organizations throughout Costa Rica to continue growing by offering a reliable platform to spread information and advertise. Lastly, the magazine will act as an advocate for the continued protection and preservation of the marine resources of Costa Rica.

Through Adventure Costa Rica , we will take part in the ever-growing tourism industry in a country that is quickly becoming a world famous destination.

What We Need & What You Get

To help us pursue our dream, we have set a goal to raise $8,000 to help us purchase a vehicle. In order for us to really grow our businesses and be successful a vehicle is a necessity. 

We have many great perks for those who want to help us out in our great adventure!

Risks & Challenges

As we start our businesses, we believe our most immediate risk and challenge is obtaining reliable transportation. Until we can purchase a vehicle we are going to have to rely on a long term rental car, which will get expensive quickly. Once we have our own vehicle, we will be able to network more effectively and gather magazine content throughout Costa Rica.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to donate, there are still ways to help! Please share our story and campaign via social media, email, and word of mouth with your friends and family. Thank you for your support and PURA VIDA!!!!!!

story:
After getting married in December 2015 in New Zealand we're planning on a Honeymoon in Japan and South Korea in Spring of 2016 (May). As we're living in the UK now, regular wedding presents just wouldn't work so we'd love anyone who feels inclined to instead gift us some money to help fund our trip.

Every gift will get you some reward. Some of these are related to our trip, others to the Wedding experience itself. For instance - not a fan of craft beer and want your old favourite served at the Wedding too? You can! Picky about what music you dance to - you can buy the right to request what the DJ plays (that one's sold out!).
How it works: You can donate anything you want, then pick a reward that is equal to or less than that. Or none, in which case you'll still get our eternal love and gratitude!
Got an idea for a reward that isn't there? Email Emily and we might add it. 
10% of the money we raise will go to UNICEF to help children in need around the world.

story:
Short Summary

Sea Scouts from Ship 564 operate the vessel Conquest from their base in Long Beach, CA. They are one of the most active Sea Scout Ships in the Long Beach Area Council. Sea Scouts is a B.S.A. program for young men and women ages 14-21.

Unfortunately, due to the economy and other factors, our fundraising this year has been below the normal levels. We had raised some money for haul-out but the yard that usually gives us a large discount is unable to do so. This has meant a dramatic increase in costs at a time when significant repairs are necessary. Over the past few months, we have spent much of the money doing the work that can be done in the water. Now, we need to haul out and finish the work under the boat.

Our funds are low and will not cover the cost of these repairs and maintenance projects.

This campaign is being run by The Pacific Youth Boating Association, a 501c3 non-profit organization dedicated to supporting Sea Scout Ship 564 and the M/V Conquest.

What We Need

Our repairs, which will be funded through this campaign, include:

  • Haul Out at a local shipyard.
  • Examination of the hull areas in need of repair.
  • Clean and paint the bottom.
  • Replace one thru-hull and install one new thru-hull and valve.
  • Replace strut bearing.
  • Replace propeller.
  • Replace shaft seal.
  • Strip, prep and paint hull and boot top.
  • Strip, prep and paint cabin, pilothouse and signal mast.
  • Replace sacrificial zincs.
  • Repair handrails.

To complete this project we will need to make several purchases, including:

  • Haul-out services at a local yard. (We have located only a couple of local yards that will allow us to do our own work.)
  • Bottom paint
  • Topside paint
  • Painting supplies
  • Resin
  • Cabosil (Powder fill)
  • Strut Bearing
  • Propeller
  • Zincs
  • Welding services
  • Name graphic

If this project does not reach full funding, any funds collected will be used entirely to support whatever work on the Conquest can be done. 

Conquest

Conquest is a former U.S. Navy Utility Boat. Built by the Harbor Boatbuilding Company in Long Beach, CA in 1965, she served aboard the USS Samuel Gompers (AD-37) from 1967 until 1989. Transferred to the Sea Scouts in Stockton, CA later, she was acquired by the Pacific Youth Boating Association in 1995 and transferred to Long Beach. Since then, the Sea Scouts, with help from industry professionals, have transformed the empty hull into a cruising boat that is one of the most active boats in the Long Beach Sea Scout Squadron. Since her launch in 2003, she has made many cruises to points like Catalina Island, San Diego and other Southern California ports. She has also carried her crew on annual summer long cruises to the Channel Islands and other, farther points. In July our summer cruise visited San Francisco and Sacramento, a cruise of 12 days and 957 miles.

The Impact

The Pacific Youth Boating Association supports Sea Scouting in Long Beach through its support of the Conquest and Sea Scout Ship 564.  The mission of Sea Scout Ship 564 is to provide a unique opportunity to local young men and women to teach good seamanship practices while preparing them to make good ethical and moral choices over their lifetime as they learn the values of the Sea Promise, Scout Oath and Scout Law.

Other Ways You Can Help

No matter if you are able to donate, or can't donate, please forward this campaign to everyone you know who supports Sea Scouting, or wants to ensure that our local youth continue to learn through boating. Thank You.

Additional information about the Ship 564 can be found at: www.ship564.com

story:
Owner/Operator - Kyle Dow

I've always been into sports but didn't discover climbing until my early 20's. Once I got a taste of climbing, I was hooked; it progressively became a passion of mine. I love everything about climbing; the physical and mental challenge, the incredible places you get to see and the amazing people you get to meet. 

I've been living in Western Canada for 9 years and am absolutely in love with these mountains! I've lived in Banff, Canmore, Revelstoke and Squamish, and have made yearly pilgrimages to Skaha Bluffs in Penticton. Each of these places are spectacular and unique, and I want to share them with climbers from all over the world! 

The Vision

I was inspired to start Hedon Rock Tours when I was travelling by myself in Europe to climb and recognized how difficult it is to coordinate a climbing trip - there are a lot of logistics to consider. 

  • Knowing the best places to climb
  • Organizing Tranportation
  • Organizing Accommodation
  • Food Preperation
  • Transporting Gear
  • Finding Partners 
Recognizing all these challenges I decided to start Hedon Rock Tours:                           An all-inclusive tour of Western Canada's premiere climbing destinations! 

                             


The climbing in Western Canada is outstanding; every location on our tour provides world class climbing in stunning natural settings. These are some of my favourite places in the world! 

The goal is less about starting a business and more about creating an incredible climbing trip. I want to bring together people from all over the world, share with them my favorite climbing spots, and create a rich and rewarding experience - that's my vision. 

                             


Contributions 

Currently we are entering the first year of operation. We need people to know about our incredible tours! All money raised through this campaign will be used to help further marketing efforts as well as purchase the required gear for this years operation. 

If you're not in a position to make a contribution, we understand. You can support us by following us on Instagram, liking our Facebook page, and spreading the word among your social network about Hedon Rock Tours.

Incentives 

We are incredibly grateful for your support and want to offer something in return! We have a variety of rewards ranging from custom Hedon Rock Tours bottle opener keychains, headlamps, bags, and even entire trips! It's a win-win situation! 

A huge thanks to our two partners, Mammut and Blackdiamond for helping out with these items and their ongoing support!

                            


All of us here at Hedon Rock Tours are incredibly psyched for what's to come and look forward to creating incredible experiences for our guests!

                         


Thank you so much for your time and support!

story:
Hello everyone!

My name is Steve Mešić. I'm 32 years old and I come from Zagreb, Croatia. Croatia is a small and beautiful country - you just have to come and see it for yourself! 


My father died when I was very little so from early age I had to become head of the house, taking care of my mother and grandmother. I am coming from a working class family and since I know for myself I was working all day almost everyday as a pizza delivery boy. At one point in life I got married and started my own business (you guessed it - pizza delivery store!), but after few years all fell apart: I got divorced, economic downturn in my country helped my business to collapse and now I am working again for the man as a pizza delivery boy to help support my mother and grandmother. Besides regular work I love making music and with help of my friends I started to publish some songs (I published 2 albums!!)..but that's another story because in my country you cannot live of making hip-hop music.


Boys and girls, as said in a song: "I think there's something more, life's worth living for". In that sense I decided: I will fulfill my life long dream of being free, doing what I love (biking) and traveling the world in pursuit of happiness. I will pedal the globe, with stops in different countries where I will look for a job so I can fund my quest and hopefully sent some money back home.


I will cycle 24,000 kilometers, sleep on the streets for all I care, but I want to work and make my mother proud and make something of myself now, while I'm still young, because if I don't I will regret it in old age. 


Sky is the limit if you believe in yourself.


It would be great if I could get some funds to get me off on this trip, but no matter what happens - I am going!


I have put 5000.00 $ as my flexible budget. That funds should be enough to cover all the expenses - new bike, bike equipment, visa costs (US please abolish visa requirements for Croatian citizens!!! :)), plane tickets (when I will travel across the ocean),  accommodations, phone bills, food, drinks. I will start with this trip at the end of May 2016 and will write about my adventures online (idea is to write a book about my trip!). Countries I will travel in my quest are as follows: starting point - Croatia, Slovenia, Italy, France, Spain, Portugal, US (plane tickets nr. 1), Japan (plane tickets nr. 2), Russia, Belarus, Poland, Slovakia, Hungary and if all else fails - back home - Croatia! 


Follow my Facebook page - Steve Mešić Ludin (facebook.com/steve.ludin) where I will also inform you about my trip. I'll be grateful for every penny that you fund me and will be one step closer to the goal.

story:
Short Summary

We are Dimitris (16 years old) and Nikos (18 years old) Karakostas , and we're from Athens, Greece.  We have been racing motorcycles with a lot of achievments since we were 5 and 7 years old,  with Dimitri winning the Mini GP Cup Greece 2014! After all the practice and competition over the years, we were invited  to represent Greece and competed in the World Superbike European Junior Cup for 2015.  It was a difficult championship with experienced and talented rivals. We enjoyed every race and gained massive experience.  Even though it was our first time racing outside Greece, and with no prior practice on the tracks, we finished in all the races and Dimitris scored points twice.  Our goal is to have a second chance in EJC / WSBK, and to do so we need to raise the entry fees and funds to cover some of the expenses for 2016.  This is our opportunity to learn and reach beyond local or regional motorcycle racing events and join the international circuit.

What We Need & What You Get

We are young and we have a long racing career in front of us.  In return for your investment we have both t-shirts and hats, and would ensure that you are visible as a sponsor.  If you are within Europe and attend the races you would have access to the racing paddocks. 

We will use any funds raised directly against expenses, and specifically airfare as we are both still in school and would have to return to Athens between races.  

The Impact

We have been racing since we were 5 and 7 years old, in local and regional events, both on dirt and asphalt.  This represents a lifetime opportunity for us to be in the world's largest motorcycle race association, and we have the chance of achieving our ultimate goal - to be on the WSBK/MotoGP grid.  As an investor you would be a sponsor and we would ensure that your company logo is visible.

Risks & Challenges

We live in Greece and with the severe economic and migrant crisis we have not been able to find local funding.  If our fellow countrymen are not using their own funds to survive, they are giving what they can to those who are less fortunate.   Motorcycle racing is far from their minds, even if it is an opportunity for us to represent Greece in a global competition and bring a little light and hope to an otherwise difficult situation.

Also, many of our competitors are better funded and/or live in mainland Europe and are able to practice frequently on the very racetracks on which we compete.  This gives them a competitive advantage.  However, this is our second year and we have spent the intervening time studying the racetracks and believe that we can overcome this challenge.

We believe we have the experience and talent to be competitors on the World Superbike circuit, that we can achieve regular podium finishes, and ultimately that we have a realistic chance to reach the Moto GP circuit.

Other Ways You Can Help

The World Superbike European Junior Cup schedule is:

- 01 April:  Aragon, Spain
- 15 April:  Assen, The Netherlands
- 29 May:  Donnington, England, UK
- 19 June:  Misano, Italy
- 24 July:  Monza, Italy
- 18 September:  Sachsenring, Germany
- 2 October:  Magny-Cours, France
- 16 October:  Jerez, Spain

Other ways in which you can help is by sponsoring any of our expenses (flights, hotels, etc) for any of the cities in the schedule.

story:
Hello folks, Henry Olaverri, founder and CEO of Hacienda Olaverri, talking.

My name as I already told you is Henry Olaverri, I live in the beautiful city of San Jose, Costa Rica. I´m 40 years old, married and father of two amazing kids. I love coffee (who don´t) and be able to provide a high quality coffee to the world is great.

                   

The coffee is a 100% pure and has no chemicals nor additives, it is baked and roasted directly, without extra steps, plus is planted at 1200 meters above sea level; all this gives the coffee an unique and pleasant taste and smell, this coffee is so good that can compete (with a little bit of help) with the top coffee brands in the world. This coffee is planted, baked,toasted and distributed here in Costa Rica, but i want to distribute it to the rest of the world, you just need to taste it and you will realize how good it is and when you realize how good it is you will be drinking it 24/7.
I have clients in the hotel sector and in gourmet coffee shops that normally buy big amounts, also a few bags are for friends and family and I´m also starting to get in the global market. The thing is that for me to get to the next level I need the equipment to do it, right now the company that toast and grind my coffee charge me $2 per 2 pounds (mistake in the video), this reduces my winnings, they also don´t toast me coffee for urgent orders and when they do it takes a while because the place is 2 hours away. With the equipment I´m asking for I would be able to be more efficient and to deliver the service and price the clients deserve. This coffee is already generating profit, but it need an impulse to get where it should be in the market, so you can taste an amazing coffee from Costa Rica in your own living room. 

                                                

For this project I need $25 000, with that I can buy the machines I need (listed in "what we need") and give the impulse it needs. I would be really glad and it would be a great motivation for me to get that money and I guarantee you that I will work hard and be responsible with the money you donate. I would literally cry for something like this because it would be a reward and gift for all my effort and work that I make  every day, it would be a blessing! So if you love coffee like me please donate, it would be really helpful.

What I Need & What You Get

I would use the money to buy a coffee toaster, specifically a bendig TD-10, a versatile machine that can toast 8kg (17.6 lbs) to 20kg (44 lbs) of coffee per batch; then I would buy a coffee grinder model M-10 with motor 10HP that can grind 600 kg/hr (1322.7 lbs/hr); also an industrial machine for sealing bags, because the one i have is too simple and finally a mini double toaster to toast small quantities to taste samples.

  


Of course I don´t forget about you, you can get mugs with different designs, french presses, coffee makers, paintings for coffee lovers, set of decorative barista stencils template strew pad duster spray tools and obviously one of the best coffees from Costa Rica (in different sizes).

Mugs: 

    


French press and mobile coffee machine:

 



Barista tools:


Paintings:

          


Coffee:

                                 


The Impact

The impact  for you is as simple as this: I love coffee, if you´re still reading this you probably love it too, so let me give you the coffee you deserve, so you can have a happier day at great cost. 

                                       

But lets think more worldwide, Hippocrates said, "let food be thy medicine and medicine be thy food" coffee is a great example of the antioxidants and beneficial nutrients that can improve your health. Some evidence-based health benefits of coffee are: it can improve energy levels, burn fat, improve physical performance, it may lower your risk of type ll diabetes and my personal favorite, it can make you happier; you can google it if you want.

http://authoritynutrition.com/top-13-evidence-based-health-benefits-of-coffee/

And what better way to get all this by drinking an amazing coffee, so help me give all this benefits to the world at an affordable price and with astonishing taste.

Risks & Challenges

The main risk on this is the wide market that coffee and drinks have, because competing against big name brands is not easy, but many of those brands don´t offer the quality of coffee I´m offering, with some marketing I can get to compete against this brands in no much time, because I´m sure my coffee is better than what they offer. This company is young, but in a few months I have done a lot, many people tell me how fast this has been, I did what many take a year or two to get in just a few months and way less money, imagine what I can do with having a good fund and a year, with just that I can do what it takes to get this coffee where it should be.

Other Ways You Can Help and Contact Info.

If you can´t help at the moment it would be great that you could spread the world with your friends and family, share it in social media, you can like the Facebook page: Cafe Hacienda Olaverri or when it grows buy some coffee.

If you want to contact me you can use the Facebook page or here is my e-mail: cafehaciendaolaverri@hotmail.com

Thank you for reading this and how we say here in Costa rica: Pura Vida.

story:
The What

Advntur is the travel platform athletes and adventurers have been waiting for. We connect athletes away from home with locals to share the sport they love. Host athletes earn money sharing any combo of gear, their local knowledge and time and even their home, earn money playing their sport. Visiting athletes play their sport easily anywhere they go and share a unique experience with a fellow athlete.

The Dream

Imagine surfing in South Africa, snowboarding in Norway, hiking in Hokkaido and mountain biking in Whistler, all without ever packing anything but your sense of adventure. Now imagine playing the sport you love where you live and getting paid to do it.

The Why

We founded Advntur because we believe people should be able to do what they love wherever they go and our belief that the best experiences in life are shared. We've traveled far and wide and seen some amazing things, and the best experiences have been the ones when we had someone to share in the moment.

Our founder, Matt Doran, is a rower - been doing it for 17 years. He wanted to be able to row wherever he went, and that's not always easy. He can't fit his boat on a plane; there isn't much of a rental market or it's crappy gear or way overpriced; he has no idea where to go, and even if he does the research, there's no guarantees it'll work out; and he'd be going it alone. He loves rowing. It's his passion. He wants to do it wherever he goes, and you should be able to enjoy your sport when you travel, too. What better way than to connect with a local?

The Origin

Matt was on his honeymoon in Japan this past November, and he got to row in their biggest Fall race outside Kyoto. He raced with the Yokohama Rowing Club, and it was incredible. 


It made his honeymoon that much more special and rich, and it was all thanks to a local whom Matt happened to know who hooked it up. We want to offer that immersive, connected experience to all athletes. 

The How

Only locals will have the gear you need and the inside info the play your sport on your terms. They know all the best spots to play and the best spots to relax. From the trail to the pub, they can help you live like a local and show you your new city on your terms.You live your day-to-day life as a surfer/cyclist/hiker/triathlete/etc. Don’t leave your passion behind when you travel. Connect with a local and share an adventure.

The Opportunity

We need your help reaching out to the athletic community. We need to spread the word and show athletes there’s a better way to travel. By supporting Advntur now, you’ll help us build our community from the ground up and change the way athletes travel.

The Ask

We’re raising $30,000 to prove Advntur is the platform athletes need and are excited about. We’re based in San Diego, so we’re starting by proving the model here with the ultimate goal of creating a global network to connect athletes everywhere. We will use these funds to recruit local highly qualified host athletes to lead visitors on the most incredible, thrilling sports adventures San Diego has to offer. Our intial target sports are Surfing, Cycling, Triathlon, Fitness, Running and Rowing. We’ll recruit athletes and adventurers who love what they do and love sharing it with others. Once they’re on the platform and anxious to lead adventures, we’ll start advertising to all the athletes coming to San Diego. Whether they’re coming for the Rock ‘n’ Roll marathon or a business trip or a family vacation or just want some time at the beach in America’s Finest City, we want to help them enjoy their sport and show them there’s a better way to travel: the Advntur way. Our robust platform is ready to help athletes enjoy their sport on their terms, sharing adventures that create indelible memories. Now we need your help recruiting them!

The Perks

Supporters of all contribution levels will be thanked with gifts ranging from swag to gift cards at the sport outlet of your choice to free adventures to a free weekend stay in founder Matt Doran’s castle that overlooks all of San Diego. (It’s just a one bedroom, but it has a tower, so it looks like a castle, but he ain’t rich.)

The Shortfall

If we don’t reach our goal, we will honor all perks and still use every last red cent to grow our community. Advntur’s lifeblood is the passion of our founders and our community, and that’ll never run out!

The History

Money we’ve previously raised has been from people the founders knew from their athletic experiences. We’ve used it to build our powerful platform. Now it’s time to swing the pendulum away from technical development and toward growin’ this damn thang!

The Risk

Advntur is a startup, and like any other entrepreneurial endeavor traffics in risk as much as it does noble pursuits. If we don’t raise sufficient capital, our chances for success decrease. Growing the local host athletes, the Supply side of our marketplace, costs time and human capital. We need to have the right people on our team to conduct our outreach and connect with the best athletes in San Diego to start and then branching out. Growing the visting athletes, the Demand side of our marketplace, costs advertising dollars. We’ll be utilizing Facebook ads, Instagram ads, display advertising on sport-specific sites, advertising at events, retargeting advertisements – a battery of digitial and grassroots efforts to connect with the athletes coming to San Diego who don’t yet know they need Advntur. We need to learn as quickly as possible what initiaves work and what don’t so we can scrap the ones that aren’t and pour gas on the ones catching fire. We need to grow as fast but as smart as possible. We have been very careful with our funding to date, and we will be with the support you show us.

The Solution

How do we overcome the risks? Simple: You. We have the tools. We have the passion. We just need the people who believe in us to help us spread the word. Even if you don’t have the means to make a financial contribution, you can help Advntur succeed just by joining our community and telling your athletic and adventurous friends to do the same. Advntur is as strong as its members. If you join and recruit just two athletes who then do the same, we’ll be surfing in South Africa, snowboarding in Norway, hiking in Hokkaido and mountain biking in Whistler in no time! Nothing beats the recommendation of a friend. If you believe in Advntur, if you want to see Advntur succeed so you can use it, recruit your friends. There’s even a way to earn money doing it!

When you sign up for Advntur, you get your own promo code. Share that promo code with your friends on Facebook, and when they sign up with your promo code, they’ll get $25 toward their first adventure. How generous of you, right?! Once they book their first adventure as a guest, you get $25. Once they book their first adventure as a host, you get $50. You can earn up to $75 per athlete you refer and give each one a gift of a discount toward their first adventure.

The Baton

If they’re athletic, tell your friends, tell your grandmother, tell your bus driver. Spread the word. Pass the baton. Help us grow Advntur so you can connect with people who love your sport as much as you do!

story:
MEET THE VANTOLA RUCKSACK 

 

 

HOW DID VANTOLA START?

VANTOLA is a cycling exploration brand started by Billy Homan. Aged 15, Billy embarked on his first long distance cycle ride to raise money for charity in memory of the death of his mother. This is now an annual event, to raise more money for charities through his adventurous bike tours. In 2016 he completed the ride from Vancouver to Los Angeles, some 2500km. Thus Vantola was formed. 

 

As a result of his travels, especially the wet and soggy moments, Billy spotted a gap in the market for a waterproof high quality rucksack specifically designed by an adventurer for adventurers. The rucksack combines modern aesthetics with hardwearing waterproof nylon fabric to create the ultimate companion.

 

 

THE RUCKSACK

Vantola have created a customisable rucksack that is designed for both use in urban and natural environments. The Vantola rucksack has a generous capacity of 25 litres, divided into 3 separate compartments each of which are accessed through a heavy-duty waterproof zip.

 

 

VANTOLA have created and extensively tested numerous prototypes over the last year. The rucksack has been put to the test in various situations and environments. From Vancouver to Los Angeles, a circumnavigation of Sardinia and a week trip to Milan, the bag has been thoroughly tested. Details such as the contrast orange webbing, grab handle and reflective strips make the VANTOLA rucksack stand out from the crowd.

 

 

FEATURES

The bag straps can be removed to alter how you wear the bag to better suit the situation. This also allows you to customise the colour in order to suit your style.The straps will be available in your choice of orange, aqua or grey. Custom carabiners attach  the bag straps to the VANTOLA rucksack. Choose your colour.

 

The spacious main compartment is lined with bright nylon allowing you to easily find objects quickly. The main compartment also has a security pocket that has been designed to prevent the theft of important items such as phones, wallets and passports. 

 

 

The front pocket has been designed to fit to a large bike lock or a standard sized map inside. The zip is hidden when shut making this pocket very secure. 

 

 

The laptop compartment has been securely designed to provide you with a safe state of mind while cycling the busy commute or the challenging mountain climb.

 

 

A smelly compartment at the bottom of the bag is accessible from the back. This separates any smelly clothes from travelling, commuting or going to the gym, from your valuables in the main compartment.

 

 

The handy side pocket has been designed to accommodate items that need to be accessed quickly. Whether it is your phone, sunglasses, snacks or bike repair kit, all without taking the bag off your back.

 

 

A water bottle pocket is located on the side of the bag, with reflective detailing to help protect you when commuting.

 

 

 

MADE IN BRITAIN

 

The VANTOLA rucksack is hand-made by our amazing manufactures in the Lake District, using high quality waterproof nylon. We have been working extremely closely to make sure that the rucksack is all set for you to buy right now.

 

VANTOLA are very proud to be making their products in the UK. And we are 100% sure that you will receive the best quality product on the market, hands down.

 

 

CHARITIES

Vantola are committed to a sustainable future and we believe that education is key to our future. That's why for every product sold, 5% of what you pay will be given to one of the Vantola charity partners;  Farms for City Children, YYY foundation or Etatu. Sending these children on education travel trips, allowing them to not only explore but inspire them to build a better future for them, is a key aim.

 

YYY Foundation:

Started by Sera & Sarah Gurung following the earthquake in Nepal April 2015, the charity expanded as fundraising grew. They aim to work in partnership with local communities, to help them to become self sustained and avoid the aid dependency trap.  We are currently working on building schools and social housing in deprived areas in Nepal.

 

Etatu:

Etatu believe in the transformative power of education. Etatu aim to raise standards of education and thereby to raise hope, aspiration and prospects. Vantola and Etatu both believe that education is vital to ending poverty. Each product sold helps reach this goal.

 

Farms for city children:

Farms for City Children offers urban children from all over the UK a unique opportunity to live and work together for a week at a time on a real farm in the heart of the countryside. It is an intense, ‘learning through doing’ experience of a different life – for children who may not know where their food comes from and have limited opportunities to explore the outside world.

 

VANTOLA TIMELINE

 

Timeline of the bike rides, development and testing of the rucksack.

 

 

WHAT DO YOU GET?

PRODUCTION TIMELINE

Vantola have been working closely with our British manufacturer in order to ensure production starts as soon as the funding is completed. Production of the rucksacks will take place in batches of 100 as seen below.

RISKS & CHALLENGES

We have been working closely with our manufacturers to ensure that we have finalised our rucksack and that production can be as smooth as possible. 

As with all new projects there may be a few minor issues along the way. This is why we have allowed a bit more time for the first batch of Vantola rucksacks. 

 

HOW CAN YOU HELP?

Please share our Indiegogo campaign on social media, with people who might be interested. Whilst this doesn't take long, it really helps us in achieving our goal of bringing you the Vantola rucksack. 

If you don't grab yourself one of our awesome bags, please support our cause.

FEATURES
The bag straps can be removed to alter how you wear the bag to better suit the situation. This also allows you to customise the colour in order to suit your style.The straps will be available in your choice of orange, aqua or grey. Custom carabiners attach  the bag straps to the VANTOLA rucksack. Choose your colour.


 
The spacious main compartment is lined with bright nylon allowing you to easily find objects quickly. The main compartment also has a security pocket that has been designed to prevent the theft of important items such as phones, wallets and passports. 
 

 
The front pocket has been designed to fit to a large bike lock or a standard sized map inside. The zip is hidden when shut making this pocket very secure. 
 

 
The laptop compartment has been securely designed to provide you with a safe state of mind while cycling the busy commute or the challenging mountain climb.
 

 
A smelly compartment at the bottom of the bag is accessible from the back. This separates any smelly clothes from travelling, commuting or going to the gym, from your valuables in the main compartment.
 

 
The handy side pocket has been designed to accommodate items that need to be accessed quickly. Whether it is your phone, sunglasses, snacks or bike repair kit, all without taking the bag off your back.
 

 
A water bottle pocket is located on the side of the bag, with reflective detailing to help protect you when commuting.
 

 

 
MADE IN BRITAIN
 
The VANTOLA rucksack is hand-made by our amazing manufactures in the Lake District, using high quality waterproof nylon. We have been working extremely closely to make sure that the rucksack is all set for you to buy right now.


 
VANTOLA are very proud to be making their products in the UK. And we are 100% sure that you will receive the best quality product on the market, hands down.
 

 
CHARITIES
Vantola are committed to a sustainable future and we believe that education is key to our future. That's why for every product sold, 5% of what you pay will be given to one of the Vantola charity partners;  Farms for City Children, YYY foundation or Etatu. Sending these children on education travel trips, allowing them to not only explore but inspire them to build a better future for them, is a key aim.
 


YYY Foundation:
Started by Sera & Sarah Gurung following the earthquake in Nepal April 2015, the charity expanded as fundraising grew. They aim to work in partnership with local communities, to help them to become self sustained and avoid the aid dependency trap.  We are currently working on building schools and social housing in deprived areas in Nepal.
 
Etatu:
Etatu believe in the transformative power of education. Etatu aim to raise standards of education and thereby to raise hope, aspiration and prospects. Vantola and Etatu both believe that education is vital to ending poverty. Each product sold helps reach this goal.
 
Farms for city children:
Farms for City Children offers urban children from all over the UK a unique opportunity to live and work together for a week at a time on a real farm in the heart of the countryside. It is an intense, ‘learning through doing’ experience of a different life – for children who may not know where their food comes from and have limited opportunities to explore the outside world.
 
VANTOLA TIMELINE
 
Timeline of the bike rides, development and testing of the rucksack.
 

 
WHAT DO YOU GET?

PRODUCTION TIMELINE
Vantola have been working closely with our British manufacturer in order to ensure production starts as soon as the funding is completed. Production of the rucksacks will take place in batches of 100 as seen below.



RISKS & CHALLENGES

We have been working closely with our manufacturers to ensure that we have finalised our rucksack and that production can be as smooth as possible. 
As with all new projects there may be a few minor issues along the way. This is why we have allowed a bit more time for the first batch of Vantola rucksacks. 
 

HOW CAN YOU HELP?
Please share our Indiegogo campaign on social media, with people who might be interested. Whilst this doesn't take long, it really helps us in achieving our goal of bringing you the Vantola rucksack. 
If you don't grab yourself one of our awesome bags, please support our cause.

story:
Rider Oasis was first envisioned in a marketing class at the University of Washington in 2015 as a solution to each co-founders' experiences with tubes popping, chains locking, and low energy after a long ride on the trail. These pain points formed the basis of Rider Oasis' mission to offer a service that brings convenience and comfort through free bike tube pump and repair stations, variety in bike part and accessory offerings and fair pricing to the burgeoning Seattle-cyclist community. With our new location at Ballard's Peddler Brewing Company, a haven for bicyclists chasing the best beer in Seattle we are excited to share our service with the broader Seattle community.

Through our pilot program, we learned that this concept is a viable one. We have broad ambitions, including creating a network of interconnected outdoor bike part and accessory vending hubs and free repair stations throughout the Seattle-area. With your generous support, Rider Oasis will purchase and retrofit two more vending hubs, bike tube pumps, and repair tool stations, to be placed in areas with high biker and runner density, such as the Burke Gilman trail next to Fremont, the University of Washington, U. Village, the I-90 bike trail connecting Seattle to Bellevue, and the South Lake Union area.

We truly appreciate your generous support in making Seattle the most bike friendly city in the United States. No longer will runners, bikers, or walkers worry about finding a place to refuel or repair along their journey-Rider Oasis will be their solution.

story:
Bike riders usually encounter these safety risks:

  1. The bike light is not bright enough on field roads or too dazzling on urban streets.
  2. The visual angle is not wide enough when riding fast at night.
  3. The temperature of the bike light becomes too hot after long time use. 
  4. The bike light stops working in harsh environments.

   B3 is different.

 

Our main concern is to be safe on the road, be seen by other vehicles and be able to have a clear view no matter the time, the weather or the environment.

B3 enables the cycling community to ride both in an urban and non-urban environment. Ensuring maximum safety and allows the user to be seen and see the roadway when riding in dark or poorly illuminated lanes. Mountain bikers can use B3 as a professional tool for night and off-trail riding that keeps them clear from obstacles along the way. The possibility to turn B3 into a bright headlamp make it an essential and practical companion of runners and adventurers.

150˚ visibility and up to 2200 lumens, ensuring you’ll get noticed on the road, even in broad daylight and from different angles.

 

To ride confidently even through the deepest darkness we not only have to consider how much brightness our bike light can deliver but even how the light is distributed.

B3 triple LED structure solves both of the problems thanks to the adjustable brightness and the LED choice function.

 

1 Emitter: suitable for urban cycling and city environment. You can let other vehicles know that you also belong to the road, while not disturbing other drivers with a strong light.

2 Emitters: increases visibility and safety, great for road biking and off-road riding, when the user needs a more powerful light to clearly see the obstacles (rocks, roots, etc) along the way.

3 Emitters: perfect for mountain biking and extreme sports, creates a wide protective field of light, enhancing the rider’s safety and enlarging the field of view even in the deepest darkness.

 

 

 

We managed to combine functionality with appearance. The deep fins design on the case maximizes the surface area and increases the airflow for an outstanding cooling effect and thermal transfer performance.  Its effective thermal dissipation stands long time use and keeps the bike light cool and efficient, no matter the weather. 

 

The user can easily choose which emitter to activate, use one, two or three at a time, and customize mode and brightness for each of the lights.

You can set a normal brightness mode (low, medium, high) or a special mode (strobe, SOS, beacon) in case of an emergency.

 

 

 
 

B3 bike light is equipped with 2 switches, the first one to turn it on / off and choose how many emitters to use (one, two or three); the second key is made to regulate your light.

Furthermore, it is possible to personalize and adjust the brightness level, that increases by 10% - until reaching 100% - and save it through memory function.

 

 

 

The smart indicator blue light becomes a friend on the road, once B3 is turned on, the indicator it will warn the user about battery level and will allow the user to know in advance how much power is left.

More than 50%, blue light on;

10%-50%, red light on;

Less than 10%, red flashing light, flashes once every second;

 

Unmatched innovations, to ensure the maximum level of safety on the roadway.

 

1. 3 LED emitters that work independently, each of them is provided with mode setting (high, medium, low) and brightness adjustment function. Plus special modes: strobe, beacon, SOS:

- the user has complete control over the bike light and can set brightness and mode according to the environment.

- the three emitters work independently, if one emitter is out of order the others can still work properly.

 

2. The heat dissipation structure (external fins, internal copper plates, thermoelectric separation) :

-guarantees longer lifespan: 30% higher than common bike lights.

-lowers the heating level of the bikelight: 15°-20° C  less than common bike lights.

 

Special features:

- Extreme visibility and safety on the road, providing a full 150 degrees of powerful protective lighting, no matter where you are.

-It is small, weighs only 135g and boasts from 50 lumens up to a maximum brightness of 2200 lumens.

-It is suitable for road biking, mountain biking, and urban cycling. It becomes a sport and excursion accessory.

-It suitable for any kind of bicycle and environment, stable on the bike thanks to the Go pro mount, and installation is quick and simple.

-Memory function.

-It is lightweight, compact and versatile. It is 2 in 1: bike light and headlamp.

-It is waterproof IPX67, it can soak up to 1m underwater for 24h.

-It is impact resistant - crafted with high-quality materials and the highest grade electronic components.

-It is both safe and convenient. The battery indicator warns you in advance of how much power you have left and it doesn’t suddenly turn off when you on the road.

-The two switches are easy and immediate to use, suitable both for professionals and amateurs.

 

 

 

We are a group of engineers, designers, and researchers but first of all cyclists. We share the same passion for cycling and want to promote bicycle lifestyle and alternative mobility while inspiring others to do the same. 

Our goal is to enhance safety and make sure we can see and be seen wherever we go. Because for us cycling is not just a hobby. Cycling is a way to leave a mark every day.

We joined forces to create a comprehensive solution, focusing on advanced technology and functionality. We have been working on the B3 project for more than one year in order to bring to being a complete tool that could stand the weather, different environments, different kind of bikes, different sports, while being simultaneously easy to carry, to mount and to use.

B3 is all of this.

If you have any concerns about the product feel free to contact us, we’ll be happy to answer your questions.

 

 

We tried to make the most of our time, we have tested the product several times, we have personally chosen our manufacturers and experts in operations and logistic to avoid any production issues...and we are ready! The minute the campaign ends, we’ll begin shipping.

Support our B3 project and help us to empower the bike community!  Thank you!

 

 

 

B3, Your Night Owl

 

*Note:  you can choose the B3 + BATTERY CASE* SET option.  

*Battery case features

story:
Have you ever been cycling? Hiking/Backpacking? Snowshoeing?  Let Adventure Xcursions guide you in a successful first time or even for those avid goers why not join a group of like-minded locals and explore together!

Adventure Xcursions was created to bring together all outdoor and adventure sports together in one central business catering to the Buffalo area. We wanted to create a business that geared to everyone and combined not only one activity, but multiple in order to fulfill everyone’s passions, hobbies, and “want to do’s”.

We ourselves have always had a love and passion for nature and outdoor activities and felt that there is so much to do in Buffalo that many don’t know about. Nature is an escape from the everyday grind and technological dependency. Our vision and our goal is to provide a service that is different and yet incorporates all that we love about our beautiful city by not only providing guiding services for all outdoor adventure sports, but also incorporating local businesses as well to create an out of the box, fun, healthy, daring, and exciting experience for all. We also hope to educate those in the importance of health, fitness, and our environment. ​

Your help in funding and donations will greatly benefit Adventure Xcursions in so many ways to help kick-start our business into a thriving and established business! ​

Where is your funding going??

  • Equipment and gear will be our main focus in funding. Everything from bikes, helmets, water bottles, fitness and exercise equipment, compasses, etc are essential in a quality business and enjoyable time. 
  • Funding will also go towards start up and overall business cost such as rental cost, insurances, storage cost,office supplies, and travel cost.

What's in it for you? 

  • An awesome company in which you and your friends can join and have an AWESOME time!
  • The ability to take classes and seminars to better your knowledge in health, wellness, fitness, compassing, and fun! 
  • Awesome deals and perks with certain dollar donations! 
  • A company that is going to get you off the couch and into nature with choices on how to do so! 

The Impact

By helping fund Adventure Xcursions you are contributing in more ways then just finacially. It is no secret that obesity in America is at an astounding high. More and more children these days are overweight and getting diabetes, cardiovascular disease and other health scares at a surprisingly young age. It is not only children, but teenagers and adults as well. Why? Because we are becoming more inactive and caught up in our technology that we forget what it means to get outside and be active while engaging in activity with friends and socializing outside the screen. I want to create a business where friends and family members of all ages can gather and engage in physical activity together! Stewardship is also key, my goal is to teach all the importance of keeping our environment safe and clean! 

So lets get up, get moving, "Escape the Normal and Get Xploring".

Risks & Challenges

  • There will be many obstacles and bumps in the road like any other small start up business, but I plan to keep my overall goal of bringing fitness, fun, and the great outdoors to all and provide a service that is unique and different. Some tours may not go the way I envision , but that will only allow me to learn from my mistake and make something even better! 
  • Customer service it going to be my biggest goal. I know from past experience and careers that you can have the best product or service in the world, but it's taking care of the customers and employees first that ultimately leads a company to success.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • We understand that sometimes finances are tight but you can still help in our campaign! Please like and share our Facebook page to friends and family and talk us up to others!

story:
/ ¡Necesitamos de tu ayuda para cambiar e mundo!

                          In Quechua language, freedom; it is being true, a little crazy and deeply united with your own soul, a responsible freedom with oneself and with others.

En Quechua, Libertad; es ser verdadero, un poco loco y profundamente unido con tu propia alma, una libertad responsable con uno mismo y con los demás.

                                                                                                                                                     

We are María Fe and Isaías

A couple of travelers, dreamers with a career in business management. We took the opportunity to travel around the world and accumulate great experiences that helped us to realize that our interest and passion is to work in the field of tourism. By chance of life we came to this special place in the Sacred Valley of the Incas. That is why we decided to undertake this great project with the purpose of being able to share it with you, the community and with the whole world, our work with freedom, our Qhispikay.

°

Somos María Fe e Isaías

Una pareja de viajeros, soñadores y administradores de profesión que tuvimos la oportunidad de viajar por el mundo y acumular grandiosas experiencias que nos ayudaron a darnos cuenta que nuestro interés y pasión es trabajar en el rubro del turismo. Por casualidades de la vida llegamos a este lugar especial en el Valle Sagrado de los Incas. Y decidimos emprender este gran proyecto aquí con la finalidad de poder compartir con ustedes, la comunidad  y con el mundo entero nuestro obrar con libertad, nuestro Qhispikay.

                                                       

What we do different?

 / ¿Qué hacemos distinto?

Free English classes for the community

Purchase of local products and supplies

Proactive participation in coexistence with the community

Hiring and training local staff

°

Clases de inglés gratuitas para la comunidad

Compra de insumos y productos locales

Participación pro activa en convivencia con la comunidad

Contratación  y capacitación de personal local

Waste management, re-use and recycling.

Composting

Solar energy

Edible gardens

Re-use of gray water

Wastewater treatment

For every 10 reservations at the hotel a tree will be planted

We will promote recycling in the community

°

  Separación de residuos, re-utilización y reciclaje.

Compostaje

Jardines comestibles

Energía solar

Re-utilización de aguas grises

Tratamiento de aguas negras

Por cada 10 reservas en el hotel se plantará un árbol

Promoveremos el reciclaje en la comunidad

Andean Cosmovision Workshops.
Vegetarian Food
Yoga sessions and tour for sustainable practices.
Group activities outside the facilities.
We seek to be copied to generate a Qhispikay community nationwide.
Inspire everyone to work for their dreams.

°

 Talleres de Cosmovisión Andina.
Comida vegetariana 
Sesiones de yoga y tour por las prácticas sostenibles.
Actividades grupales fuera de las instalaciones.
Buscamos que nos copien para generar una comunidad Qhispikay a nivel nacional.
Inspirar a que todos trabajen por sus sueños.

Glamour + Camping

you will feel the nature from your tent that has as many comforts as a hotel room 
Much more fun with a minimum environmental impact!

°

Glamour + Camping
Vas a sentir la naturaleza desde tu carpa que tiene tantas comodidades como una habitación de hotel.
¡Mucha más diversión con el menor impacto ambiental!

A space to share and meet people from all over the world with a common interest; to find a way to contribute to the world to become a better place.

°

Un espacio para compartir y conocer personas de todo el mundo con un interés en común; buscar la manera de aportar para que el mundo sea cada vez un mejor lugar.

We know that here new friendships will be born, that in spite of the distance you will always keep them in a space of your heart.

Sabemos que aquí nacerán nuevas amistades, que a pesar de la distancia siempre las mantendrás en un espacio de tu corazón.

Here every day we will offer a wide variety of activities such as Andean mysticism sessions, yoga lessons, family dinners, bonfires, movies, just to mention a few. You wont want to miss any of them!

Aquí todos los días ofreceremos una gran variedad de actividades como sesiones de misticismo andino, lecciones de yoga, cenas grupales, fogatas, películas, sólo por mencionar algunas. ¡No te vas a querer perder ninguna!

                                                                                                                                  

Why this proyect is Important?

/ ¿Por qué éste proyecto es importante?

Our world is made up of people, each of them with their stories, and their dreams.
Qhispikay seeks to be responsible with others; we seek to have a cooperative relationship with our customers, employees, suppliers and with the different communities of Maras.

°

Nuestro mundo está compuesto por personas, cada una de ellas con sus historias, y sus sueños.

Qhispikay busca ser responsable con los demás, buscamos tener una relación de cooperación con nuestros clientes, empleados, proveedores y con las distintas comunidades de Maras.

But, the most important reason…

 / Pero la razón más importante…

Buscamos inspirar a que cada vez más personas vivan una vida auténtica, libre y responsable.​

                                

Where?

/ ¿Dónde?

In the Sacred Valley of the Incas- Perú

Our land has an incredible location! It is a very short distance from several attractions in the area: Moray at 5km, Salt mines of Maras at 6km and Ollantaytambo at 8km. In addition, we are right between the foot and the hand of the hill "toad". Can you see it?

/ En el Valle Sagrado de los Incas – Perú

¡Nuestro terreno tiene una ubicación increíble! Está a una muy corta distancia de varios de los atractivos de la zona: Moray a 5km, Salinera de Maras a 6km y Ollantaytambo a 8km. Además, nos encontramos justo entre una patita y una manito del cerro "sapo". ¿Lo logran ver?

                                                                         

What we need?

/ ¿Qué necesitamos?

US$ 80 000

Qhispikay eco lodge needs your help to be a reality. To maintain the identity and personality of the project we seek to raise as much as possible.

Qhispikay eco lodge necesita de tu ayuda para ser una realidad. Para mantener la identidad y personalidad del proyecto buscamos recaudar lo máximo posible.

In case we don´t reach the goal, we will be looking for investors, Qhispikay will become a reality in 2018, we don´t have a doubt.

En caso de no llegar a la meta, estaremos buscando inversionistas, Qhispikay si o si se hará realidad el 2018, no nos queda duda de ello.

 

Other ways to help

Share our project with the world!

/Otras formas de ayudar

¡Comparte nuestro proyecto con todo el mundo!

                                 

Rewards

/ Recompensas


WONDERING HOW YOU CAN HELP MOST? Sponsor us as a Co-Founder, You will get 10% off the lowest available price on accommodation for live! Also the Mini Kit and a space forever for your name on a memorial section of the web and your picture at a wall of the social area with all Co-Founders forever.

Cofundador

¿CÓMO SE PUEDE AYUDAR MÁS? ¡Patrocina como cofundador, obtendrá un 10% de descuento en el precio más bajo disponible en internet! También el Mini Kit y tu foto en la pared de nuestra área común junto con todos los cofundadores de Qhispikay y tu nombre aparecerá en nuestro sitio web en una lista en la sección conmemorativa como cofundador.

Includes: Thank you email / correo de agradecimiento --- Wallpaper / fondo de escritorio  --- Minikit Qhispikay --- 10% OFF for life / 10% de dscto de por vida --- Your picture in our common area

Disfruta Qhispikay

You will have a private tour for two people and three nights at the Sacred Valley. Your name will be listed forever in a commemorative section as Ambassador Qhispikay on our website and common area and 10% off for ever!

Day 1
Pick up from the airport and transfer to Qhispikay in the Sacred Valley of the Incas.
After lunch, a visit to the archaeological site of Ollantaytambo.
At 7 pm "family dinner" for the welcome meal with all the team and visitors of Qhispikay.

Day 2
Visit to the ruins of Pisac and handicraft market.
Lunch in typical food restaurant.
Visit to the Inkariy Museum, which displays the piece of many cultures of Peru.
At 7 pm "family dinner".

Day 3
Adventure day, choose one of the options for paragliding, horseback riding, rafting, paddleboarding in the lagoon, mountain biking, zip line and via ferrata.
Visit to the farmer and weaver community of Misminay.
Hike to the Inca agricultural laboratory in Moray.
At 7 pm "family dinner".

Day 4
Transfer to the city of Cusco, if there is free time we can go where ever you want, we give you free transport (maximum 100km).

Includes: accommodation in glamping and activities within Qhispikay, all meals, all transfers in private car, entry ticket and guide to archaeological sites and museums. The trip is yours, we can modify it as you like.

​Valle Sagrado para 2! (4d / 3n)

Tendrás un tour privado para dos personas de 4 días y 3 noches por el Valle Sagrado. Tu nombre se incluirá para siempre en una sección conmemorativa como Embajador Qhispikay en nuestro sitio web y áreas comunes, ¡y tendrás 10% de descuento para siempre!

Día 1

Recojo del Aeropuerto y traslado a Qhispikay en el Valle Sagrado de los Incas

Después del almuerzo, una visita al lugar arqueológico de Ollantaytambo

A las 7pm "family dinner" para la cena de bienvenida con todo el equipo y visitantes de Qhispikay

Día 2

Visita a las ruinas de Pisac y mercado artesanal

Almuerzo en restaurant de comida típica.

Visita al Museo Inkariy, que exhibe pieza de muchas de las culturas del Perú.

A las 7pm "family dinner" para la cena

Día 3

Día de aventura, elije una de las opciones para hacer parapente, cabalgatas, rafting, paddleboard en la laguna, bicicleta de montaña, zip line y via ferrata.
Visita a la comunidad campesina y tejedora de Misminay
Caminata hacia el laboratorio agricola Inca de Moray.
A las 7 pm "cena familiar" para la cena

Día 4

Traslado a la ciudad de Cusco, si hay tiempo pasamos por donde quisieran, les damos movilidad libre (max 100km).

Incluye: alojamiento en glamping y actividades dentro de Qhispikay, todas las comidas, todos los traslados en movilidad privada, ingreso a los sitios arqueológicos y museos con guía. El viaje es tuyo, podemos modificarlo como gustes.

 

Includes: Thank you email / correo de agradecimiento --- Wallpaper / fondo de escritorio --- Minikit Qhispikay --- 10% OFF for life / 10% de dscto de por vida --- Your picture in our common area

                                                                                                                                                       

A private all-inclusive tour for 2 people through the Sacred Valley and Machu Picchu, your name will be listed for ever on a memorial section as a Qhispikay Ambassador at our website & common area., and you will have 10% off for ever!

Day 1
Pick up from the airport and transfer to Qhispikay in the Sacred Valley of the Incas
After lunch, a visit to the archaeological site of Ollantaytambo
At 7pm "family dinner" for the welcome dinner with all the team and visitors of Qhispikay
Day 2
Visit to the ruins of Pisac and craft market
Visit to the living museum of Awanakancha, with llamas, alpacas and weavers with traditional techniques.
Lunch in typical food restaurant.
Visit to the Inkariy Museum, which exhibits a piece of many of the cultures of Peru
Day 3
Visit to the salt mines of Maras
Visit to the rural community and weaver of Misminay, where they will be able to direct the embroidery of their Qhispikay hat.
Hike to the Inca agricultural laboratory of Moray
Picnic for lunch with a view of the Apus that surround the Sacred Valley of the Incas
Day 4
Full day at Machu Picchu with trekking to Wayna Picchu (if available)
Day 5
Day of adventure, choose up to 2 options for paragliding, horseback riding, rafting, paddleboarding in the lagoon, mountain biking, zip line and via ferrata.
Day 6
It depends on your mood, you can go back to do some adventure activity, visit more archaeological sites, road trip to the community of Lares with hot springs or full day in the city of Cusco.
Day 7
Transfer to the city of Cusco.

Includes: accommodation in glamping and activities within Qhispikay, all meals, all transfers in private mobility and train in "Vista Dome", entry to the archaeological sites and museums with guide, open bar in Qhispikay. The trip is yours, we can modify it as you like.

Descubre el Valle Sagrado y Machu Picchu

Un tour privado con todo incluido para 2 personas a través del Valle Sagrado y Machu Picchu, tu nombre aparecerá en una lista conmemorativa como Embajador Qhispikay en nuestro sitio web y área común y ¡tendrás 10% de descuento para siempre!

Día 1

Recojo del Aeropuerto y traslado a Qhispikay en el Valle Sagrado de los Incas

Después del almuerzo, una visita al lugar arqueológico de Ollantaytambo

A las 7pm "family dinner" para la cena de bienvenida con todo el equipo y visitantes de Qhispikay

Día 2

Visita a las ruinas de Pisac y mercado artesanal

Visita al museo viviente de Awanakancha, con llamas, alpacas y tejedoras con tecnicas tradicionales.

Almuerzo en restaurant de comida tipica.

Visita al Museo Inkariy, que exhibe pieza de muchas de las culturas del Peru

Dia 3

Visita a las salineras de Maras

Visita a la Comunidad campesina y tejedora de Misminay, donde podrán dirigir el bordado de su gorro Qhispikay.

Caminata hacia el laboratorio agrícola Inca de Moray

Picnic para el almuerzo con vista a los apus que rodean el Valle Sagrado de los Incas

Día 4

Día completo en Machu picchu con treking a Wayna picchu (si esta disponible)

Día 5

Dia de aventura, elije hasta 2 opciones para hacer parapente, cabalgatas, rafting, paddleboard en la laguna, bicicleta de montaña, zip line y via ferrata.

Día 6

Depende de tu animo, puedes volver a hacer alguna actividad de aventura, visitar mas sitios arqueologicos, roadtrip a la comunidad de Lares con aguas termales o full day en la ciudad de Cusco.

Día 7

Traslado a la ciudad de Cusco.​

Incluye: alojamiento en glamping y actividades dentro de Qhispikay, todas las comidas, todos los traslados en movilidad privada y tren en "Vista Dome", ingreso a los sitios arqueológicos y museos con guía, barra libre en Qhispikay. El viaje es tuyo lo podemos modificar a tu gusto.

 

Includes: Thank you email / correo de agradecimiento --- Wallpaper / fondo de escritorio --- Minikit Qhispikay --- Maras natural salt / Sal natural de Maras --- Bath set / Set de Baño ---Eco Hand Bag / Bolso de mano ---Hand embroidery hat / Gorro con bordado a mano --- Lama leather laptop case / Estuche para laptop de cuero de llama --- Plant a tree on our place / Plantamos un árbol en nuestro terreno --- Baby Alpaca beanie / Chullo de baby alpaca

                                                             

Contact us

/ Contáctanos

www.qhispikayecolodge.com

befree@qhispikayecolodge.com

facebook / qhispikay.ecolodge

instagram / qhispikay.ecolodge

Whatsapp María Fe +51 932 109 959

Whatsapp Isaías +51 956 712 601

María Fe Gamarra
I love traveling and learning on the road, the first time I met the Sacred Valley it was when I was 8 years old and I just fell in love!. During my childhood I had many road trips through southern Peru where I got to know my country and its culture.
After college I studied business administration at Universidad del Pacífico with the aim of starting my own business one day. And once graduated, I worked at Pizzerias Presto, the company of my parents, where I learned almost everything you need to know to start a business and make it successful.
Last year, it was when I decided to venture myself to travel the world for a period of 11 months that allowed me to know myself and to inspire myself to start Qhispikay.

°

Me encanta viajar e ir aprendiendo en el camino, la primera vez que conocí el Valle Sagrado fue cuando tenía 8 años y simplemente ¡me enamoré!. Durante mi infancia tuve muchos viajes por carretera por el sur del Perú en donde pude conocer mi país y su cultura.

después del colegio estudié administración de empresas en la Universidad del Pacífico con el objetivo de emprender mi propio negocio. Y una vez graduada, trabajé en Pizzerias Presto, la empresa de mis papás, en donde aprendí casi todo lo que se necesita saber para poder emprender un negocio y hacer que sea exitoso.

Finalmente, el año pasado, fue cuando decidí aventurarme a viajar por el mundo durante un periodo de 11 meses que me permitió conocerme a mi misma e inspirarme para iniciar Qhispikay. 

Isaias Mendoza del Solar
In 2012 I made the decision to leave my office work in Lima and go out to travel the world investing my savings and time in gaining traveling experiences. Without a doubt the best decision I could have made so far, for the first time I felt really free and I feel that it is in this state that a person can discover and internalize their fears and passions.
For me the fear is to let life pass and not try to live dreams and my passion is to work in a sustainable and regenerative development in tourism.
The school I studied in Arequipa, I am a professional in business administration from the University of Lima and the last 4 years I work in the tourism sector.

°

En el 2012 tome la decisión de dejar mi trabajo de oficina en Lima y salir a recorrer el mundo invirtiendo mis ahorros y tiempo en ganar experiencias viajando. Sin duda la mejor decisión que pude haber tomado hasta ahora, por primera ves me sentí realmente libre y siento que es en este estado que una persona puede descubrir e interiorizar sus miedos y pasiones.

Para mi el miedo es dejar pasar la vida y no intentar vivir los sueños y mi pasión es trabajar en un desarrollo sostenible y regenerativo en turismo.
El colegio lo estudie en Arequipa, soy profesional en administración de empresas por la Universidad de lima y los 4 años trabajo en el sector de turismo. 

 

​
story_txt:
/ ¡Necesitamos de tu ayuda para cambiar e mundo!                          In Quechua language, freedom; it is being true, a little crazy and deeply united with your own soul, a responsible freedom with oneself and with others.En Quechua, Libertad; es ser verdadero, un poco loco y profundamente unido con tu propia alma, una libertad responsable con uno mismo y con los demás.                                                                                                                                                     We are María Fe and IsaíasA couple of travelers, dreamers with a career in business management. We took the opportunity to travel around the world and accumulate great experiences that helped us to realize that our interest and passion is to work in the field of tourism. By chance of life we came to this special place in the Sacred Valley of the Incas. That is why we decided to undertake this great project with the purpose of being able to share it with you, the community and with the whole world, our work with freedom, our Qhispikay.°Somos María Fe e IsaíasUna pareja de viajeros, soñadores y administradores de profesión que tuvimos la oportunidad de viajar por el mundo y acumular grandiosas experiencias que nos ayudaron a darnos cuenta que nuestro interés y pasión es trabajar en el rubro del turismo. Por casualidades de la vida llegamos a este lugar especial en el Valle Sagrado de los Incas. Y decidimos emprender este gran proyecto aquí con la finalidad de poder compartir con ustedes, la comunidad  y con el mundo entero nuestro obrar con libertad, nuestro Qhispikay.
                                                       What we do different? / ¿Qué hacemos distinto?Free English classes for the communityPurchase of local products and suppliesProactive participation in coexistence with the communityHiring and training local staff°Clases de inglés gratuitas para la comunidadCompra de insumos y productos localesParticipación pro activa en convivencia con la comunidadContratación  y capacitación de personal localWaste management, re-use and recycling.CompostingSolar energyEdible gardensRe-use of gray waterWastewater treatmentFor every 10 reservations at the hotel a tree will be plantedWe will promote recycling in the community°  Separación de residuos, re-utilización y reciclaje.CompostajeJardines comestiblesEnergía solarRe-utilización de aguas grisesTratamiento de aguas negrasPor cada 10 reservas en el hotel se plantará un árbolPromoveremos el reciclaje en la comunidadAndean Cosmovision Workshops.Vegetarian FoodYoga sessions and tour for sustainable practices.Group activities outside the facilities.We seek to be copied to generate a Qhispikay community nationwide.Inspire everyone to work for their dreams.° Talleres de Cosmovisión Andina.Comida vegetariana Sesiones de yoga y tour por las prácticas sostenibles.Actividades grupales fuera de las instalaciones.Buscamos que nos copien para generar una comunidad Qhispikay a nivel nacional.Inspirar a que todos trabajen por sus sueños.Glamour + Campingyou will feel the nature from your tent that has as many comforts as a hotel room Much more fun with a minimum environmental impact!°Glamour + CampingVas a sentir la naturaleza desde tu carpa que tiene tantas comodidades como una habitación de hotel.¡Mucha más diversión con el menor impacto ambiental!A space to share and meet people from all over the world with a common interest; to find a way to contribute to the world to become a better place.°Un espacio para compartir y conocer personas de todo el mundo con un interés en común; buscar la manera de aportar para que el mundo sea cada vez un mejor lugar.We know that here new friendships will be born, that in spite of the distance you will always keep them in a space of your heart.Sabemos que aquí nacerán nuevas amistades, que a pesar de la distancia siempre las mantendrás en un espacio de tu corazón.Here every day we will offer a wide variety of activities such as Andean mysticism sessions, yoga lessons, family dinners, bonfires, movies, just to mention a few. You wont want to miss any of them!Aquí todos los días ofreceremos una gran variedad de actividades como sesiones de misticismo andino, lecciones de yoga, cenas grupales, fogatas, películas, sólo por mencionar algunas. ¡No te vas a querer perder ninguna!                                                                                                                                  Why this proyect is Important?/ ¿Por qué éste proyecto es importante?Our world is made up of people, each of them with their stories, and their dreams.Qhispikay seeks to be responsible with others; we seek to have a cooperative relationship with our customers, employees, suppliers and with the different communities of Maras.°Nuestro mundo está compuesto por personas, cada una de ellas con sus historias, y sus sueños.Qhispikay busca ser responsable con los demás, buscamos tener una relación de cooperación con nuestros clientes, empleados, proveedores y con las distintas comunidades de Maras.But, the most important reason… / Pero la razón más importante…Buscamos inspirar a que cada vez más personas vivan una vida auténtica, libre y responsable.​                                Where?/ ¿Dónde?In the Sacred Valley of the Incas- PerúOur land has an incredible location! It is a very short distance from several attractions in the area: Moray at 5km, Salt mines of Maras at 6km and Ollantaytambo at 8km. In addition, we are right between the foot and the hand of the hill "toad". Can you see it?/ En el Valle Sagrado de los Incas – Perú¡Nuestro terreno tiene una ubicación increíble! Está a una muy corta distancia de varios de los atractivos de la zona: Moray a 5km, Salinera de Maras a 6km y Ollantaytambo a 8km. Además, nos encontramos justo entre una patita y una manito del cerro "sapo". ¿Lo logran ver?                                                                         What we need?/ ¿Qué necesitamos?US$ 80 000Qhispikay eco lodge needs your help to be a reality.
