story:
Ever dreamed of having underwear for everywhere? Underwear that’s perfect for exploring the world or exploring the great indoors?

Undies that lounge, gym, & swim.

Because what’s the difference?

Why do we need to buy three bra tops for a single day of activities?

Why is it ok to post a picture of yourself in your bikini but not your underwear?

We think underwear should empower you, not limit you…

So we created SOMI: 

The breathable underwear that moves with you...

Because we’re always moving! 

We’re jumping in the pool, or hitting the trail, or getting in a quick yoga session.

And we shouldn’t have to constantly change our undies to fit the occasion.

Or worse, have to skip out on activities because we don’t have a swimsuit, or a sports bra, or a change of underwear.


SOMI is the three-in-one solution that’s made from a sustainable version of Silk Jersey fabric. It’s breathable, antibacterial, moisture-wicking, quick-drying, supportive, comfortable, and always ready for your next activity. And that’s the way underwear should be!

  • So you can lounge in comfort at home
     
  • So you’re ready for anything.
     
  • So your bedroom drawers aren’t so crammed.
     
  • So you can jump in the pool without the hassle of changing.
     
  • So you can cool off in that hidden waterhole on your hike.
     
  • So you can be free to focus on what matters.
     

​

So, seriously...what is the difference?

What sets a swimsuit apart from a set of undies?

And what makes SOMI a category apart?

Well, swimsuits are generally made of cheap materials. They aren’t concerned with comfort, they aren’t meant to be worn close to the skin for extended periods of time, and they tend to feature:

  • Awkward ties, twists, and bumps.
     
  • Loud colors and prints that show through clothing.
     
  • Round strings rather than flat elastic straps.
     
  • Absurdly high price tags (especially for something you only wear a few times a year).

 


What about traditional underwear? It’s made from delicate, fragile lace that you have to wash carefully, and it’s much easier to tear. Or it’s a five-pack of cotton undies—generic, water-absorbent, and destined to show wear within a few washes.

In the eco-conscious category, you can forget style and sexiness. It’s utilitarian, rugged, and often oddly shapeless.

SOMI bridges this gap with stylish, comfortable, versatile classics made from an eco-friendly fabric that washes like a dream.
 


We’ve always loved the idea of minimalism, but we wanted to offer our SOMI wearers the best of everything: The best workout underwear, the best swimwear, the best “I-just-want-to-be-comfortable-and-lounge-around-in-my-undies” wear. But how could we do that while still maintaining an eco-positive, minimalistic approach?

The answer was simple: Create one functional (yet fashionable) set of undies that does it all.

And make it durable enough to last for years to reduce your carbon footprint.

 

 


Wear SOMI for your next:

Adventure

  • SOMI packs small, so throwing a spare pair in your day pack is easy.
     
  • You’ll ALWAY have your swimsuit on you, so if you need to cool off in that hidden waterhole it’s A-okay.
     
  • You won’t need to find a changing area on the trail (save time and stay safe!)
     
  • Stay clean and fresh for longer, even after a long day of kayaking or cycling!


Workout

  • Unlike cotton underwear, which traps and logs sweat, SOMI underwear is moisture-wicking and quick drying.
     
  • SOMI’s antibacterial properties are sweat activated to keep you fresh, even after a hard sweat.
     
  • The Betty and The Deep Dive from our tops collection double as sports bras for low impact exercises like yoga, barre, and pilates.
     
  • You can easily transition from lounging on your couch to your home workout.
     

Swim

  • SOMI is UV and chlorine resistant.
     
  • SOMI styles are designed with classic simple cuts that work for the beach, pool, and beyond.
     
  • Save time and jump right in the pool!
     

Lounge

  • Above all, SOMI is comfortable!
     
  • No more wires, no more wedgies, no more sticky, sweaty material.
     
  • Wear underneath your everyday clothing without worrying about panty lines.

 


Did you know that fashion is a major contributor to pollution? In fact, 140 million pounds of clothes end up in landfills each year, and 20% of industrial water pollution is estimated to come from garment manufacturing.

We care about the world we live in, so designing SOMI to be eco-friendly and ethically made wasn’t a decision we had to think twice about.

What took a lot longer was coming up with an eco-conscious fabric that offered the water-resistance we needed, combined with the comfort we couldn’t live without.

We partnered with a supplier of some of the best athletic and swimwear brands in the world, and we worked with them to develop a new antibacterial fabric that would hold up even better in the gym and on the road—anywhere you’re likely to sweat.

The result was SustainLuxe: A material comparable to a sustainable version of Silk Jersey in its softness, flexibility, strength, and sheen—yet sustainably made and eco-friendly. And it's even constructed for maximum breathability so you stay comfortable no matter the activity. 

 

SustainLuxe is:

 

Best of all, SustainLuxe:
 


But we didn’t stop there, because we wanted SOMI to be ethically made as well as eco-friendly. To this end, we’ve taken careful measures to vet all our suppliers to ensure their workers are treated fairly.

 


SOMI wearers are practical, adventurous, and always ready to sweat—so we knew we had to make SOMI as resilient as they are.

It had to be durable, long-lasting, and ready to stand up to the wear and tear of a life well-lived.

It had to be easy to care for.

And above all, it had to be ready to go at a moment’s notice.

 


That’s why SOMI is:

  • Easy to hand wash (just wash in the sink with soap or shampoo, then roll into a towel and squeeze tightly).
     
  • Resilient enough to throw directly into the laundry and dryer.
     
  • Quick-drying, and tough enough to withstand heavy usage.

 


All of our designs feature silky, breathable Sustainluxe fabric and are engineered to be supportive for low impact workouts like yoga and pilates. Our four-way stretch movement will keep you feeling comfortable day and night, and you’ll feel fresh for longer with antibacterial properties designed to last for up to 50 washes.

Our bra band and waistband elastic is sourced from a luxury supplier. Since we’re selling directly to you, we can afford to add this expensive detail: It’s thin enough to not add bulk, but thick enough to give you the support you need.

Our favorite part of this elastic is the hand feel. It feels as soft and silky as buttered kittens, and it doesn’t have that super shiny “I’m lingerie!” finish; instead, it’s a subtle sheen that lasts through grueling wash after wash.

To effectively manage resources, we are offering our designs —all in black.

 


 


We tested SOMI on 243 women, sampled over 100 fabrics, and examined 50 bra band elastics before bringing our venture to crowdfunding. Why? Because we wanted SOMI to be perfect in every way—and we knew the only way to achieve that was by paying attention to the little details, then getting real feedback from the people who matter.

Here’s what they had to say about their SOMI experiences:

 


With SOMI, we’re creating a new category…

It isn’t swimwear. It isn’t underwear. It isn’t yoga-wear…

It’s all three.

Here’s how SOMI compares to the status quo:

 


Because our SOMI bra tops are designed with super-stretchy double-lined fabric, we recommend choosing your size based on your band measurement rather than your cup size. If in doubt, size down!

Please note that some styles are only available in certain sizes, so make sure to look at the size availability when picking your preferred look.

 

 


It started with an email.

“Hey,” it said. “Can I wear this underwear in the water? Like a bikini?”

At this point, SOMI was just a vision and a website.

We thought about it. What was the difference between underwear and swimwear, really? Our test line was already made from quick-dry fabric with sporty accents.

“We don’t see why not,” we wrote back.

Two days later, she sent a photo wearing her SOMI effortlessly in the water.

Then we got another photo.

And another.

 

 


Different women smiling and wearing their underwear proudly for everything from home workouts to hikes.

And there was one hiker who did a week-long trip with only SOMI, wore it as a swimsuit, and washed it in the sink at night.

We realized we were onto something.

Fast-forward to today, and we’ve transformed our flagship line into something never seen before: A whole new category of designs intended to empower and embolden.

We’re more than just a team of dreamers, though. We know how to bring products to market, how to deliver on our promises, and how to execute on manufacturing and production.


So without further ado, meet our people:

story:
Review


Included the first tele presence hand manipulator system 

The mix between Robotics and Human Brains

Yori, is an Inca word meaning " Dawn" or in Japanese "trustworthy". Now is the name of a cybernetic machine that resembles a small astronaut, created by Robitz and "Robots Crate" (www.robitz.net,  www.robotscrate.com ). 
Finally we´ve developed "Yori "as a social robotics and "Rent a Human Brain" platform. This humanoid machine has functions of "remote control over internet"with remote programers, physician assistants, home assistants, care assistants and human entertainment services. Besides it is one of the few robots that has capabilities of manipulation extensions for remote operation. 

Currently the first prototypes are guides at the exhibition "Robots Crate" Some pictures: www.robotscrate.com  

(Yori Expandable Arm)

Thanks to your collaborations through Indiegogo, Yori will be the new companion and assistant, the new pet or entertainment platform system, who will bring you the beer, pick up your clothes , clean the floor and dust shelves ( small scale, with a human brain operator behind him), but "who" also care and accompany adults, children and office workers. You can choose between autonomous mode or a super smart human brain to program or control your robot.

        What can your Yori Robot do? 

           You were not able to manipulate the world. !UNTIL NOW!

.

a) Autonomous mode: "Programming form cero".   Yori is like a child pet at home, an office assistant or sick and elderly companion. Do you remember Tamagotchi?. It's like a  real life one. When this robot says - "I got something new", he must  show a new ability, for sure.

How does this work?. Well,  When Yori is unboxed, he has no programs or memories. "He is like a new born child". This machine will begin to learn from the first time to be turned on. Why?. Because we incorporate  a new way to program machines. This means to do that through observation and real interaction between humans and machines. So, we incorporate real human brains for programming your cybernetic friend.

You'll have to take care of him, and he will take care of you.

This will increase the posibilities.

Besides,  Yori can be even better. You have some interesting features ahead, like "Telepresence" and "Rent a Human Brain"  modes.

b) Telepresence: Your human hands are connected directly to the brain. In fact much of it ( the brain) is intended for them ( your hands). This is the reason why you feel tied and imprisoned when controlling a robot camera online (just watching without taking control). But now Yori allows the use and manipulation of objects in the real world.  !So you are not prisoner of a webcam anymore!. 

Who said you can't be in to places at one?. Now Yori's articulated arms provides you  control over a  remote environment.



c) Rent a Human Brain: On the other hand, you can contact and rent online specialist from Robitz network.They are (human) clinical advisors, medical advisers, (basic medical care only, not as physicians) for adults and children, Including assistant for disabled people, elderly or sick. Contact nannies that make the job via Yori. Controlling the robot for taking care of kids.  

Models and Characteristics: 

Yori Black

¿What is Yori made of?

The finished robot is made from acrylic resins with a tough , flexible and resistant film on injected plastic base , a compound that mimics the aged metal as an alternative material. Most part of the robots are hand made.

Data network and shared control programs:  

Make each robot to improve their skills by sharing , "programs" that are generated in it ( ¿or him?), like in other Yori units around the world .


What we need and what you get

We need  $58,000 to pay for the cost of everything that's needed to produce these robots, including bigger automated machinery.  The donations you give us will be used for molding, production, packaging and shipping of the product. It also goes to the improvement of electronic engineering , software for each robot and its functions as well as for hiring skilled personal in Human - Machine interactivity. In the other hand are legal and intellectual property issues required for this robot to get life. 

In return, you will get the coolest personal robot with awesome laser cut figures and LED lights, electronic control unit, video and infrared distance sensors, self charging station, access to robot apps ( rent human brains ) from Yori Cloud and the first arms telepresence operated system in a robot for home.  

With your help we will make the world most upgradeable robot with super intelligence inside because  of technicians brains behind each robot.  We'll be able to continuously update the machine, sharing ideas from other Yori robots and ultimately making them smarter.

The Robots Crate and Yori Black -  T Shirts

If we achieve the goal or up to 30 % less than it, we will come closer to the goal of building the robot big assembly line for large-scale production. If we fail, we will deliver ordered robots as part of this campaign with all characteristics but yori cloud. This will be based on small assembly plant that we already have, but large scale production will be postposed. So your support is very, !very!  Important to accomplish this dream.  

www.robotscrate.com

(In Picture: Yori at Robots Crate Exhibition)

The Impact

We are a small Industrial Automation company for Telepresence, Robotics and interactive museology systems. So, your donation is important because will determine whether or not we produce this kind of social robots (provided with optional human brains) to the world. Contrary to popular belief, the construction of this robot model will provide jobs and will allow more independence to people with this mechanic friend. ( like old,  sick or disabled people)


Other successful projects

We have a list of successful projects in 14 years of experience. With the parent company Robitz 

1)  We´ve built five large-scale museums and more than 40 interactive systems for museum industry, patented 10 interactive robots,  including  Interactive Home Robots

Visit: http://www.robitz.net/robots.html

or facebook: www.facebook.com/cajaderobots

2)  We have also built "Robot Crate"  " A museum of Robotics with thousands of visitors. Photos Robots Crate in  ( www.robotscrate.com )

"Robots Crate" The robot exhibition, where Yori is involved


(In Picture: Robots Crate Base - Home of Yori Robot )

3) Jupé de Tech-CAFE, Cooker Robot made by Robots Crate.

Successful brand projects

Industrial Automation


         Museum Technology

Robots Crate, The Robot Exibit

Technology Food Center. Robotics Cafe

Inventions Center for Kids

Our Team:



Risks & Challenges

Our dream is to build a robot "who" instead of a simple machine. In order to do that, there may be problems concerning delays during the optimization process . For this reason and focused on product quality, especially software and mechanisms, donors will be notified to avoid surprises in case of any delays.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you don't have money right now, you can help us turn these Yori Robots into a reality by sharing this campaign with your contacts and friends.  In the other hand if you Share this in your Facebook page, you will have the opportunity to win Yori Robot for free. Simply the most shared link will win a Yori Robot. Thanks for your Support.  

!THANKS!

Simply the most shared link will win a Yori Robot. Thanks for your Support.  


!THANKS!

story:
Short Summary

As a former marine biologist, I learned a long time ago that water is the most important element to sustain life.  Is not only vital for us, but it is also critically vital for our pets.  It is extremely important that our pets are drinking enough water every day and to take action if we see any changes in their water intake.  These changes could be an indication of a serious medical issue that we most investigate, but never before were we able to know or figure out if our pets are drinking water or not. 

That is why I created the Pet-H2O not only to provide your pet with clean H2O but also to help you keep an accurate record of their daily water intake.  Our Pet-H2O is in constant communication with our mobile application, keeping an accurate record of your lovable pet’s water intake, and it will immediately alert you if there are any drastic changes on their water intake.  This is why our Pet-H2O is so important for us, our pets, and our veterinarians.  We need your support to begin manufacturing this year and to put a Pet-H2O in every pet owner’s hands.  There is no need to keep letting our pets suffer because we don't know when they started drinking less or too much water and are now in a painful situation.  Let’s keep our pets healthier and close to our hearts for years to come. Also we have made a commitment to help our local Naples Humane Society by donating Pet-H2O units and a percentage of all proceeds.

We are ready to GOGO. The funds will be use to finalize our patent certification, tooling, manufacturing, and shipping.  We have performed all testing on our product as well as its mobile application. We also have all suppliers for all components and manufacturing arrangements ready to go.  Our tooling process will begin as soon as funds from our campaign are released. So join us and be part of an incredible product that will help us to keep our lovable pets’ healthy and close to our hearts. Look through our perks and rewards and support us at any level that you wish to.  If you are a pet owner, you surely want to secure your own Pet-H2O or take advantage of the premium reward of getting one or two more as gifts for your friend or family that have pets in their homes. 

In order for us to succeed with our Pet-H2O campaign, we need your complete support in every way you can offer it.  We are seeking $84,000.00, which will be used for finalizing our utility patent.  We will also be able to fulfill our initial order, including our mobile application with all of its features. Please check out all of our perks and rewards and please support us for the one that fits better for you.  If you are a pet owner, we really encourage you to secure your own Pet-H2O by participating in our Silver Reward. Please when you order specify, if its a cat or dog as well as size (small, Medium or large).  Note, that for now, small size pets are the only one with both features of making water from water molecules and city water. Medium and large dogs utilizes filtered city water to maintain water level, but all the features will be included on every model and size of our Pet-H2O.

Platinum: I believe every member of my family that has a pet should have their own Pet-H2O. That is why I need four of them. Please ship them to me as soon as possible. Please specify if its a cat or dog and size (small, Medium or large).  

Gold: I need one for me and two more to give away as gifts for my friends. I need a total of three Pet-H2O so we can take care of our lovable pets right way! Please specify if its a cat or dog and size (small, Medium or large).  

Silver:I really need a Pet-H2O for my pet. I don’t want to take any chance of not knowing that my loving pet could be getting sick by not monitoring his/her water intake and having no way to know about it.

Bronze: I don’t have a pet yet, but I love pets and your product. That’s why I need my awesome Polo Shirt with embroidered logo and website to support this amazing product the Pet-H2O everywhere I go.

Dedicated: I don’t have a pet yet, but I love pets. I love your product and the fact that this product could be saving our lovable pets.  Please send me a t-shirt and hat to support this amazing product everywhere I go.

Copper: For sure I want to be part of this amazing campaign! Send me my awesome Pet-H2O t-shirt to help promote this amazing product every were I go!

Just Because I Love Animals: I will tell to all veterinarians I know in my area and all my friends and family who have their own pets as well as my coworkers.  As a reward, for my support I will receive a personalized letter from the creator and inventor of the Pet-H2O.

Because I Love This Product: I will tell everyone I know to follow you and post on Twitter. I will like your Facebook page and share with all my friends and family on Google+ and Instagram or chat about it on WASAP or any other chat room I am in!  In exchange, I will receive a thank you letter signed by the inventor and creator of the Pet-H2O and its mobile application, and my name to be listed on Pet-H2O’s Honor Page if I wish.

In the eventuality that we can’t reach our final goal, we will finalize as much as we can with the funding we receive, like, for example, completing the funding for our utility patent, and we will continue moving forward towards manufacturing, taking every possible step that is already on schedule, such as rapid prototyping, tooling, and manufacturing.

Your contribution is critically important not only for us but, more importantly, for every single pet.  Currently, most pet owners can’t tell if their pets are drinking sufficient water or not. In fact, most of them can’t tell the different between evaporated water and consumed water.  This is a very dangerous situation for every single pet, but now, with our Pet-H2O monitoring your pet’s water intake, this should no longer be an impossible thing.  Many pet owners take their pets for checkups because they have been lying down for a while or they are no longer as active as they use to be. This is a very visual symptom that, most of the time, started a while ago and indicates that the pet’s condition could be in a very advanced stage. This is something that could have been detected in time by simply monitoring their daily water intake.  You would be part of something amazing, and your support is vital so that together, we will change the way we monitor our pets’ health, so you can keep your pet health close to your heart.

Risks & Challenges

As we all know, when we are in the process of manufacturing a new product, there are some challenge that we must be prepare for, such as manufacturing location, shipping, and delivery. To overcome some of these future problems, we have already made contacts and agreement to minimize such issues.  Funding will be the most important issue for us to overcome since we have other issues, which all depend on the ability for us to reach our campaign goal. 

Another aspect that we have been concerned about from the beginning is the quality of the product as well as its warranty.  For that, we have establish two levels of strict quality control protocols, one during our manufacturing process and the second one prior to shipping out our product.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone has a pet, but that doesn't mean you can't help us.  We have established a simple way for you to help us promote our campaign and still show your love for pets all over the world with our reward programs, “Just Because I Love Animals” and “Because I Love This Product.”

This is your chance to make as much noise as you can about our product's campaign with all veterinarians in your area!

Tell everyone you know, to follow us and post on Twitter, like us on Facebook, and share with all your friends and family on Google+ and Instagram.

story:
Check out the action at www.sopothelink.org and @sopothelink ! 

Sopo Bicycle Cooperative:

Since 2005, Sopo Bicycle Cooperative has served Atlanta cyclists as a community resource with access to bike parts, tools, classes, and support from trained volunteers. We provide space, tools, volunteers and bikes to the public on a donation basis. Basically, we're a community-run bike shop. 

The Link:

Since late 2013, Sopo volunteer and Atlanta native Patrick Davis has managed a program at the shop to provide cycling resources to the residents of the Gateway Center for the Homeless in Downtown Atlanta. Called the Link, it gives Gateway residents and anyone else in need a chance to earn a free bike by volunteering at the shop.

 Besides providing a cost-effective means of transportation, cycling can provide health benefits and build confidence through self-reliance, creating a virtuous cycle of community well-being.

Transportation Equity:

Atlanta is a sprawling, car-dominated metropolis with few transportation options for those without a car. A lack of investment in public transit and vast distances between population and jobs centers prices many of the working poor out of an opportunity to join the middle class.

"Sprawling cities with higher commute times — two of Atlanta's chief  characteristics — also have worse economic mobility, a 2013  Harvard study concluded. Atlanta has lower rates of mobility than  any developed city for which data is currently available..."
Read more:  http://www.businessinsider.com/atlanta-is-the-most-unequal-city-in-america--heres-why-2015-3#ixzz3Wf4HJphK

We need your help:

With your donation, Sopo can continue its outreach efforts to the citizens of Atlanta and get more people on bikes. Beyond the Gateway Center, the Link has also started a refugee program spinoff with a group in Clarkston (http://www.lsga.org/lsg-and-sopo-partner-to-provide-bikes-for-refugees/).

With your help, there's no telling how far this program can go.

 

This campaign is raising funds on behalf of Sopo Bicycle Cooperative, a verified nonprofit. All contributions are considered unrestricted gifts and can't be specified for any particular purpose.

story:
Notre grand rêve, c'est de s'envoler pour le Japon......honeymoon spirit! 

Après avoir pensé à la Californie nous sommes tournés vers le Japon pays dans lequel nous ne somme jamais allés. Quoi de plus merveilleux que d'essayer un voyage à deux dans une destination qui semble difficile à atteindre hors contexte exceptionnel . Visiter des temples zen, la super urbanité et les magasins branchouiles pour Fanfan, le bouddhisme zen pour Steph.

story:
Without lifting a hammer, you can help preserve two of the most historic buildings in Lethbridge’s Chinatown and help ensure a piece of Alberta’s history is kept alive.

As long as these buildings stand, the memories, stories and history of the early Chinese residents of southwestern Alberta remain and the trials and triumphs of Chinatown are there for future generations to learn about and from. Help provide the funds that will restore these buildings and help convert them into an interpretive centre and public space (as well as a residence) where the story of Alberta and Lethbridge’s Chinese history can be told.

A group of concerned people and organizations – working together under the Save Chinatown Lethbridge banner – are raising money to save these buildings.

Each $1 raised is actually $2 of work on the building! As these two buildings are Municipal Historic Resources, every $ we raise is eligible for matching grant funding.


What We’re Protecting – Keeping People’s Stories Alive

The story of Lethbridge’s Chinatown – indeed, the story of the Chinese in southwestern Alberta – is poorly understood and has not been well told. The interpretive centre that is planned for the buildings will help give an identity and a voice to these men and women of southern Alberta’s past who for too long have been overlooked in the history books and stories.

In addition to raising money to protect the buildings and to build the exhibits, our group is researching the history of the community and the individuals who lived in and interacted with Lethbridge’s Chinatown in its heyday before the Second World War.

Here are just some of the names (we apologize for errors in the names. These are the names as found in historic documents and we are still trying to confirm spelling and proper names):

Joe Fong, John Lee, Mah Wing and Mah Ben – in 1901 these four businessmen (laundrymen) wrote to the Town of Lethbridge protesting the high cost of the laundry tax in Lethbridge. They provided information on the amount of tax paid in other western communities. In the 1912 Directory of the City of Lethbridge, Joe Fong is listed as a businessman at 308 1 Avenue South.

In 1916, Joe Hop Wah, wife Dong and sons See and Tai were all residing and working at 308 2 Avenue South. Joe, 48 years old, was a cook and had been in Canada for 5 years.

Wong Ku Chong came from China in 1888 and in 1916, at the age of 42, he was working as a cook in the coal mine camp at Coal City north of Barnwell.

Ching Tow was 36 years old in 1916 and working as a gardener in Raymond. He was married but from the 1916 census it does not appear that his wife was with him in Canada. He had been in Canada for 10 years by this time and likely, as with so many other early immigrants, he hadn’t seen his wife since his arrival in Canada.

Though we’re still researching and cross-referencing, we have a list of over 250 names of early Chinese residents – your donation can help ensure these people have a place in history.


What We’re Protecting – Two of the Last Remaining Buildings in Lethbridge’s Chinatown, Two of Lethbridge’s Oldest Buildings

Lethbridge Chinatown – This Place Matters

The Bow On Tong building was constructed in 1919. The Tai Sing Wing Co. opened in the building in the early 1920s, dealing in Chinese goods. Since 1926 the building has been the Bow On Tong – the Good Health Store – a Chinese apothecary, operated by the Leong family. The building also provided residences for single Chinese men living in the area. There were many single Chinese men as the head tax and Chinese Immigration Act made it very difficult for Chinese women to move to Canada so many of the men either never married or had to leave their wives and children behind in China.

  The Bow On Tong was a popular meeting site in Chinatown and played a significant role in Chinese history in Lethbridge. The Bow On Tong was one of many sites in Chinatown where gambling occurred. Gambling in Chinatown was about more than just gambling. It was also part of the economic welfare of Chinese Canadians, particularly single men who, as they aged and with no family members to help them, needed someone else to help them out. Older men were used as runners for the gambling games. It is a source of pride within the Chinese community that no Chinese person in Lethbridge went on relief (welfare) during the Great Depression even though the 1930s were known as the Hungry Thirties and were a desperate time for many.

  Though the building still has to be restored to its former glory,  a step inside the building takes you immediately back into the past – the old wood floor, oiled and maintained over decades. The drawers containing the apothecary medicines and supplies. Open anyone and you’ll be surprised by what you find. The large windows that beckoned to people on the street to come and view the displays will soon invite people into the building to discover the interpretive centre and display area telling the story of the early Chinese residents. Can you imagine a better place anywhere to tell the story than this building?

Right next door to the Bow on Tong is another treasured building. The Manie Opera Society/Kwong On Lung & Co. building is presently the oldest building in Lethbridge’s Chinatown. The building has seen several uses over the years; the first tenant was Wing Wah Chong Co., Chinese goods store. Wing Wah Chong was a president of the Chinese National League in Lethbridge in the early part of the 20th century. The building also provided residences for many of the single men who lived in the area. During the late 1910’s, the Kwong On Lung & Co., a Chinese grocery, and the Pekin Cafe operated in the building. By 1927, the Canton Chop Suey restaurant was in operation. Due to discrimination, employment opportunities for Chinese Canadians were limited and restaurants and market gardening provided two avenues of employment. During the 1920’s there were 25 Chinese gardeners who went through Lethbridge selling vegetables door to door from horse-drawn wagons. These gardeners, primarily single men, resided in the buildings in Chinatown.

More recently the building has continued to provide a venue supporting the Chinese Canadian and Lethbridge community with such uses as:  the New China Chop Suey, the Han Dynasty Importique, and the Chinese Canadian cultural organization called the Manie Opera Society.

Lethbridge’s Chinatown provided services and support for Chinese Canadians across southwestern Alberta. 


Albert Leong and Family

Preserving these buildings isn’t only about the history – it’s also about getting Albert home. When these buildings were condemned, Albert Leong had to move out of his home. Born in the Bow On Tong, Albert has lived his entire life in Lethbridge’s Chinatown and he remains a living memory of the lives of all of the people who have made Chinatown home over many decades.

Way Leong emigrated from Hong Kong to Vancouver. In Vancouver he operated a Chinese pharmacy (apothecary). In 1921 he was joined in Vancouver by his wife Florence (Ho). It was fortunate that Florence had arrived before 1923 because starting in that year the Chinese Immigration Act made it nearly impossible for Chinese men to bring wives to Canada. This Act, the cost of head tax and discriminatory immigration policies meant that the number of Chinese in Alberta actually dropped between 1921 (3581) and 1931 (3211).  The Leongs, though, defied the odds and moved to Lethbridge in 1926 where Way Leong opened the Bow On Tong Co. Bow On Tong translates as good health store and is a rare Chinese apothecary filled with objects from China and the Vancouver store.

Through their perseverance they created a viable Chinese goods business in Lethbridge and worked to help build a social and cultural community for the Chinese Canadians of southwestern Alberta. Florence Leong operated the store when her husband was ill and following his death. A road in Legacy Ridge (where all roads and parks are named after women of southern Alberta history) was named in her honour.


Deeper Background

The Chinese started to arrive in southern Alberta in the 1880s and 1890s to work on railways in the area. Some stayed to work and live in southern Alberta.

 Anti-Chinese feelings and discriminatory practices both in southern Alberta and across Canada were prominent in the late 19th and early 20th centuries. The federal government enforced a Head Tax against the Chinese meaning that the Chinese had to pay to come to Canada. Discriminatory hiring meant the Chinese were limited in the types of jobs they were permitted. Many of the Chinese therefore worked in laundries, restaurants, as servants and in other similar jobs.

In Lethbridge, several local businesses advertised they had “white only help”. One restaurant even went so far as to call itself White Man’s Café – an indication of its hiring policies.

Lethbridge’s Chinatown was quite large, with businesses located around several city blocks. The 1915 fire insurance maps shows several Chinese businesses located between 1 and 3 Ave S and 2 and 4 St S. Lethbridge’s Chinatown provided services and support for Chinese Canadians across southwestern Alberta. 

Discriminatory practices against Chinese Canadians started to decrease in the 1940s. China and Canada were allies during the Second World War and Canada’s immigration policies and practices started to change around this time. With the changes, the Chinese in Lethbridge were able to live anywhere in the city and new businesses and professions were open to new Chinese immigrants. Lethbridge's Chinatown lost some of its prominence. As buildings were lost and people moved away, less and less of Chinatown remained. Now there are just a few buildings to remind us of this story and the people who lived and worked here.


Long Term Plans/How Else You Can Help

 While it’s a slow process, over time these two buildings will be renovated and become useful public spaces once again.

 While Albert will move into the back of the Bow On Tong, the front will be converted into an Interpretive Center that will tell the history of the building and the Chinese community. The upstairs will be converted into a meeting space for the public.

That’s where you come in. With your generous support we can ensure these buildings are there for generations to come, for future generations to understand and learn from our history

A community that doesn’t know its history has no identity, no roots. These places matter because they remind us of who we are and help us building a strong community rooted in our past and with the strength to continue to build a strong city. These places matter.

This is not a quick project. It will take several years for all of the work to be done. But we are committed and we know that with the help of wonderful supporters like you, we can make this happen.

We are all caretakers of the past and the present for the future. Think about what type of future we want for the children and grandchildren. What messages do we want to leave them? What sort of built landscape do we want them to inherit? Something that represents a throw-away society or one where our history and heritage is respected? Where there is a sense of identity and purpose? Where our entire community story is told?

By working together and saving these buildings, we can make a difference. Please give generously and let all of your friends know about this opportunity to support the buildings.

organizations – working together under the Save Chinatown Lethbridge banner –
are raising money to save these buildings. 
Each $1 raised is actually $2 of work on
the building! As these two buildings are Municipal Historic Resources, every $
we raise is eligible for matching grant funding. 
What
We’re Protecting – Keeping People’s Stories Alive
The story of Lethbridge’s Chinatown –
indeed, the story of the Chinese in southwestern Alberta – is poorly understood
and has not been well told. The interpretive centre that is planned for the
buildings will help give an identity and a voice to these men and women of
southern Alberta’s past who for too long have been overlooked in the history
books and stories.
In addition to raising money to protect the
buildings and to build the exhibits, our group is researching the history of
the community and the individuals who lived in and interacted with Lethbridge’s
Chinatown in its heyday before the Second World War.
Here are just some of the names (we
apologize for errors in the names. These are the names as found in historic
documents and we are still trying to confirm spelling and proper names):
Joe Fong, John Lee, Mah Wing and Mah Ben –
in 1901 these four businessmen (laundrymen) wrote to the Town of Lethbridge
protesting the high cost of the laundry tax in Lethbridge. They provided
information on the amount of tax paid in other western communities. In the 1912 Directory of
the City of Lethbridge, Joe Fong is listed as a businessman at 308 1 Avenue
South.
In 1916, Joe Hop Wah, wife Dong and sons
See and Tai were all residing and working at 308 2 Avenue South. Joe, 48 years
old, was a cook and had been in Canada for 5 years.
Wong Ku Chong came from China in 1888 and
in 1916, at the age of 42, he was working as a cook in the coal mine camp at
Coal City north of Barnwell. 
Ching Tow was 36 years old in 1916 and
working as a gardener in Raymond. He was married but from the 1916 census it
does not appear that his wife was with him in Canada. He had been in Canada for
10 years by this time and likely, as with so many other early immigrants, he
hadn’t seen his wife since his arrival in Canada.
Though we’re still researching and
cross-referencing, we have a list of over 250 names of early Chinese residents – your donation can help
ensure these people have a place in history.
What
We’re Protecting – Two of the Last Remaining Buildings in Lethbridge’s
Chinatown, Two of Lethbridge’s Oldest Buildings
Lethbridge
Chinatown – This Place Matters
The Bow On Tong
building was constructed in 1919. The Tai Sing Wing Co. opened in the building
in the early 1920s, dealing in Chinese goods. Since 1926 the building has been
the Bow On Tong – the Good Health Store – a Chinese apothecary, operated by the
Leong family. The building also provided residences for single Chinese men
living in the area. There were many single Chinese men as the head tax and
Chinese Immigration Act made it very difficult for Chinese women to move to
Canada so many of the men either never married or had to leave their wives and
children behind in China.
  The
Bow On Tong was a popular meeting site in Chinatown and played a significant
role in Chinese history in Lethbridge. The Bow On Tong was one of many sites in
Chinatown where gambling occurred. Gambling in Chinatown was about more than
just gambling. It was also part of the economic welfare of Chinese Canadians,
particularly single men who, as they aged and with no family members to help
them, needed someone else to help them out. Older men were used as runners for
the gambling games. It is a source of pride within the Chinese community that
no Chinese person in Lethbridge went on relief (welfare) during the Great
Depression even though the 1930s were known as the Hungry Thirties and were a
desperate time for many. 
  Though
the building still has to be restored to its former glory,  a step inside the building takes you
immediately back into the past – the old wood floor, oiled and maintained over
decades. The drawers containing the apothecary medicines and supplies. Open
anyone and you’ll be surprised by what you find. The large windows that
beckoned to people on the street to come and view the displays will soon invite
people into the building to discover the interpretive centre and display area
telling the story of the early Chinese residents. Can you imagine a better place
anywhere to tell the story than this building?
Right next door
to the Bow on Tong is another treasured building. The Manie Opera Society/Kwong
On Lung & Co. building is presently the oldest building in Lethbridge’s
Chinatown. The building has seen several uses over the years; the first tenant
was Wing Wah Chong Co., Chinese goods store. Wing Wah Chong was a president of
the Chinese National League in Lethbridge in the early part of the 20th
century. The building also provided residences for many of the single men who
lived in the area. During the late 1910’s, the Kwong On Lung & Co., a
Chinese grocery, and the Pekin Cafe operated in the building. By 1927, the
Canton Chop Suey restaurant was in operation. Due to discrimination, employment
opportunities for Chinese Canadians were limited and restaurants and market
gardening provided two avenues of employment. During the 1920’s there were 25
Chinese gardeners who went through Lethbridge selling vegetables door to door
from horse-drawn wagons. These gardeners, primarily single men, resided in the
buildings in Chinatown.
More recently
the building has continued to provide a venue supporting the Chinese Canadian
and Lethbridge community with such uses as: 
the New China Chop Suey, the Han Dynasty Importique, and the Chinese
Canadian cultural organization called the Manie Opera Society.
Lethbridge’s Chinatown provided services
and support for Chinese Canadians across southwestern Alberta. 
Albert
Leong and Family 
Preserving these
buildings isn’t only about the history – it’s also about getting Albert home.
When these buildings were condemned, Albert Leong had to move out of his home.
Born in the Bow On Tong, Albert has lived his entire life in Lethbridge’s
Chinatown and he remains a living memory of the lives of all of the people who
have made Chinatown home over many decades.
Way Leong
emigrated from Hong Kong to Vancouver. In Vancouver he operated a Chinese
pharmacy (apothecary). In 1921 he was joined in Vancouver by his wife Florence
(Ho). It was fortunate that Florence had arrived before 1923 because starting
in that year the Chinese Immigration Act made it nearly impossible for Chinese
men to bring wives to Canada. This Act, the cost of head tax and discriminatory
immigration policies meant that the number of Chinese in Alberta actually
dropped between 1921 (3581) and 1931 (3211).  The Leongs, though, defied the odds and moved
to Lethbridge in 1926 where Way Leong opened the Bow On Tong Co. Bow On Tong
translates as good health store and is a rare Chinese apothecary filled with
objects from China and the Vancouver store. 
Through their
perseverance they created a viable Chinese goods business in Lethbridge and
worked to help build a social and cultural community for the Chinese Canadians
of southwestern Alberta. Florence Leong operated the store when her husband was
ill and following his death. A road in Legacy Ridge (where all roads and parks
are named after women of southern Alberta history) was named in her honour.
Deeper
Background
The Chinese
started to arrive in southern Alberta in the 1880s and 1890s to work on
railways in the area. Some stayed to work and live in southern Alberta.
 Anti-Chinese
feelings and discriminatory practices both in southern Alberta and across
Canada were prominent in the late 19th and early 20th
centuries. The federal government enforced a Head Tax against the Chinese
meaning that the Chinese had to pay to come to Canada. Discriminatory hiring
meant the Chinese were limited in the types of jobs they were permitted. Many
of the Chinese therefore worked in laundries, restaurants, as servants and in
other similar jobs.
In Lethbridge, several
local businesses advertised they had “white only help”. One restaurant even
went so far as to call itself White Man’s Café – an indication of its hiring
policies. 
Lethbridge’s Chinatown was quite large, with businesses located around
several city blocks. The 1915 fire insurance maps shows several Chinese
businesses located between 1 and 3 Ave S and 2 and 4 St S. Lethbridge’s
Chinatown provided services and support for Chinese Canadians across
southwestern Alberta. 
Discriminatory practices against Chinese Canadians started to decrease in the 1940s. China and
Canada were allies during the Second World War and Canada’s immigration
policies and practices started to change around this time. With the changes, the
Chinese in Lethbridge were able to live anywhere in the city and new businesses
and professions were open to new Chinese immigrants. Lethbridge's Chinatown lost some of its prominence. As buildings were lost and people moved
away, less and less of Chinatown remained. Now there are just a few buildings
to remind us of this story and the people who lived and worked here.
Long
Term Plans/How Else You Can Help
 While
it’s a slow process, over time these two buildings will be renovated and become
useful public spaces once again.
 While
Albert will move into the back of the Bow On Tong, the front will be converted
into an Interpretive Center that will tell the history of the building and the
Chinese community. The upstairs will be converted into a meeting space for the
public. 
That’s where you come in. With your
generous support we can ensure these buildings are there for generations to
come, for future generations to understand and learn from our history
A community that doesn’t know its history
has no identity, no roots. These places matter because they remind us of who we
are and help us building a strong community rooted in our past and with the
strength to continue to build a strong city. These places matter. 
This is not a quick project. It will take
several years for all of the work to be done. But we are committed and we know
that with the help of wonderful supporters like you, we can make this happen.
We are all caretakers of the past and the
present for the future. Think about what type of future we want for the
children and grandchildren. What messages do we want to leave them? What sort
of built landscape do we want them to inherit? Something that represents a
throw-away society or one where our history and heritage is respected? Where
there is a sense of identity and purpose? Where our entire community story is
told?
By working together and saving these
buildings, we can make a difference. Please give generously and let all of your
friends know about this opportunity to support the buildings.

story:
The Orb Story

My name is Andrew Phillips, and I've been cycle commuting in the UK for almost 10 years. In that time, I've had dozens of near misses (and been knocked off once) - from vehicles approaching from the side. When I went away and looked at the accident statistics, I found that side impact collisions are a serious and common problem. After dozens more near misses, I started looking for a light that would keep me visible from all angles at night.

The product I wanted to buy didn't exist yet, so I started making it myself. In December 2017 I raised £20,000 through Kickstarter to bring the product to manufacture. Now after almost 3 years of hard work, The Orb is in production and almost ready to ship.

Funding

Back in December 2017, I raised £20,000 on Kickstarter to pay for the tooling costs necessary to get The Orb into production. Since December, we've ironed out a few design issues which has meant a change to some of the moulds. The funding raised through Indiegogo will help pay for these final adjustments. The Orb is now in production and this is your last opportunity to get hold of it at presale prices.

The Impact

I believe that within the next ten years side visibility will be considered as crucial as front and rear visibility are today. By bringing side-visibility lighting into the mainstream, I hope to be able to reduce the number of people injured on the roads

Risks & Challenges

With The Orb already in production, you can rest easy knowing that you are backing a product that will be delivered.   

Other Ways You Can Help

If you love the campaign, but don't cycle yourself please share with anyone you think might be interested in what we're doing! 

You can also find out more on www.orb.bike

story:
The Parks Are Calling

THE PARKS ARE CALLING is a thirteen-month photographic expedition which will visit 100 national park units, including all fifty-nine national parks, in conjunction with the National Park Service centennial. Through the lenses of photography and outdoor recreation, this project will create a public space providing education, generating inspiration and encouraging the use of our collective voices to protect these lands we all own.

Traveling through forty-six states and two territories, THE PARKS ARE CALLING departs northwestern Illinois on September 25, 2016, heading north to Voyageurs National Park in Minnesota. Continuing in a clockwise direction from here this project will continue until October 2017, with the following objectives:


  • To employ photography in documenting lands operated by the National Park Service at its centennial, creating a photographic collection of each unit explored. Making these images publicly accessible online, a stretch goal of THE PARKS ARE CALLING is the production of a physical exhibit and corresponding book with the aim of bringing continued public interest and awareness to these lands.

  • To build an online community through the use of digital platforms where interested parties can follow and participate in this journey. Through THE PARKS ARE CALLING the intention is to educate, inspire and encourage champions of our parks such that these lands and their possessions continue for future generations.

Background

On August 25, 2016, the National Park Service celebrated its 100th birthday. As this governing body begins a second century of existence it is an increasingly interesting and important time to examine the condition of our parks as environmental, economic and political factors threaten their status.

Effects felt from climate change are at the forefront. Glacier National Park in Montana, for instance, home to over 150 glaciers in the mid-19th century, now contains only 25, all of which have seen dramatic reductions in overall volume. At current rates, scientists predict this U.S. park, named after its many glaciers, will contain no more by the year 2030, possibly earlier.

The economics of our park system is another important matter. Just this February the Park Service reported a maintenance backlog deficit of almost $12 billion dollars, meaning roads, campgrounds, visitor's centers and trails in need of work are not receiving them. This translates to an increased risk of personal injury, potential damage to both private and public property, a cultural loss of certain structures along with resource damage to the environment itself.

There are also movements on a political level regarding who controls these park lands and what uses are permitted in them. A bill introduced by two U.S. Senators, for example, looks to potentially give bicycle access to wilderness areas within national parks and other public lands, going against a 1964 directive which defined and allowed for public wilderness.

Environmental changes, economic impacts and political movements are just a few of the many complex, very delicate, greatly layered issues the parks currently confront, making the start of a new century a particularly appropriate time for THE PARKS ARE CALLING.

I had the good fortune of working on some of these public lands in partnership with the Student Conservation Association and National Park Service. Entrusted with co-leading youth in outdoor education through building and maintaining hiking trails in Colorado and Alaska, working with these organizations provided the opportunity to experience and learn how protected lands in the park system operate. Our field work also instilled in me a greater appreciation for these majestic places along with a more intense desire to understand, explore and document units I had not seen firsthand.


Campaign

The past seven months have been an all-consuming labor of love as I have carried out logistical and creative planning, working to make this vision into a tangible enterprise. Now, the time has come to get others involved in THE PARKS ARE CALLING!

Undertaking an expedition of this depth and magnitude, dedicating more than a year on the road to this project requires serious investments. Putting in my time, energy and personal financial resources, I have committed myself to this project's success. I am, however, in need of assistance. To achieve the desired outcomes, THE PARKS ARE CALLING is looking to raise $25,000. These funds will be dedicated to the following earmarked categories:


Perks

As a way to encourage contributions while also furthering the stake of investors, a variety of unique perks are available. Starting at just $5, below are just a few to which you can lay claim. Remember, your contribution not only allows for the successful completion of this project but also makes you a part of its accomplishments!

Further Ways To Contribute

No contribution is too small but I understand not everyone is in a financial position to do so. There are other actions, therefore, you can take to be a part of and provide for a successful THE PARKS ARE CALLING experience!

*Follow these online platforms! To show further support, simply upload the photo and corresponding message below, encouraging others to join!

Instagram: @davidwilliamcurrier

I am supporting @davidwilliamcurrier and his national park photographic expedition, The Parks Are Calling. Learn more about this amazing adventure and do the same by clicking on his username (link to campaign is in the bio). #theparksarecalling #findyourpark

Facebook: @davidwilliamcurrier

I am supporting @davidwilliamcurrier and his national park photographic expedition, The Parks Are Calling. Learn more about this amazing adventure and do the same at https://igg.me/a/TheParksAreCalling #theparksarecalling #findyourpark

Twitter: @davidwmcurrier

I'm supporting @davidwmcurrier and his national park photography project,  #TheParksAreCalling. Learn more and join! https://igg.me/a/TheParksAreCalling

*Contribute frequent flier miles! Four of the units require air travel off the U.S. mainland. These miles will help cover this expense.

*Do you have online or media contacts? Know an individual who works in the outdoor industry? What about someone who could help in another manner? Please contact me at info@davidwilliamcurrier.com. I would love to hear from you! 


Join Today!

Our national parks are one of our most valuable resources. Just because they are here today, however, does not mean they will be tomorrow. From climate change to both economic and political forces, it is important for these lands to remain in the public consciousness and stay a part of our national conversation. If we don't, we stand to loose not only land that belongs to every single one of the 324 million U.S. citizens but also those transformative feelings, emotions and experiences our national parks evoke in visitors the world over. Join THE PARKS ARE CALLING today, learn more about these lands, get inspired and become a champion for their future!


Thank you for your support!

story:
AUTOPLUS is a stylish minimalist traveler tools with ultra-brightness safety light in very low power consumption. Making the decision to embed the minimalist design with multi-function into a traveler tools.
We develop a stylish, useful tool  for you to can keep it every day.
With that in mind, we created AUTOPLUS, an innovation safety light + Phone mount; a minimalist tool with brightness improve design and environment friendly. A product of clean lines and simple beauty that makes gadget personal.
 

PHONE BIKE MOUNT

PHONE BIKE MOUNT_INSTALLATION

BACKPACKER



BABY STROLLER

However, AUTOPLUS is not just a tool with a beautiful outlook it is also a useful multi-purpose tool

Small changes in daily activity and habits can have a positive impact on road safety and convenience.  In fact, according to the World Health Organization(WHO) media center: More than 270,000 pedestrians killed on roads each year. 
We believe using our AUTPOPLUS on a bike, baby stroller, Back Pack…. etc. would decrease the numbers of traffic accidents.

AUTOPLUS does not discriminate.  It doesn’t matter who you are or where you’re from, from road bike rider to Mum’s pushing a baby stroller, as long as you’re a mobile device user, AUTOPLUS is for you!

AUTOPLUS suitable for everyone.

 

 

"Enhance 300% brightness with unique light diffuser!"

Mini Torch


Our AUTOPLUS is a competent mini torch, any emergency situation could be give you a big help.It can maybe save your life.
 

Safety light


Our AUTOPLUS (nearly) can wrap around everywhere, such as back pack, keyring, baby stroller, hiking pole, front or rear bike …. etc.
 

 Phone bike mount


Our AUTOPLUS suitable of 99% of bicycle handle bar, even aerodynamic style, should be no problem to AUTOPLUS.
And suitable for 5” to 7” Smart phone


AUTOPLUS Design for Life

Design sensibility is a cornerstone for our company. To us, the outlook cannot be sacrificed for a better function. The simple lines and organic shape is designed to be used in everyday life and for any special occasion. 

Taking a minimalist, 'less is more' approach, our designer created a AUTOPLUS that is useful, beautiful and unique. It is a traveller tool that acknowledges the past while looking toward the future.


 

WHY we need you?

We have designed, built, and tested the AUTOPLUS prototype. We have selected a well-respected production facility that we have previously worked with successfully. 

However, one of our biggest concerns was making AUTOPLUS affordable to the most people possible, while still insisting on a rich feature set. In order to proceed, we need create the tooling and order quantity necessary to keep the price reasonable for everyone

That is why you are our most important asset! By working together, we can all benefit. 

Risks and challenges

The AUTOPLUS

 As each winery has its own unique formula and production process ,our  AUTOPLUS create by Environmental friendly material with unique formula polysiloxanes
So that our AUTOPLUS can keep it very thinness(below 1 mm), and provide Ultra Strong & Elastic.
Because of the unique material , we can make a ultra thinness lampshade, so that it could provide very high transmittance. That is the one of reason why our AUTOPLUS can improve the visibility = provide more road safety.

 

What you receive in return

By investing in our project, your pre-orders will help fund the first production run in a quantity that keeps the price low for everyone. In return you get (besides our gratitude and sincere thanks!) a totally innovation of traveler tools at a highly discounted price.
Because that is our innovation design, At this moment You never find it at eBay, Yahoo, Amazon…etc.

More than that, you join the AUTOPLUS family and make a statement about the importance of your road safety, technology, convenience and style. You will journey with us as we change the face of road safety forever.

We have created several different perks to offer AUTOPLUS at prices up to 50% off of retail, as well as some special perks.

OUR TEAM

We are a diverse group. Our team have been heavily involved in manufacturing sports and consumer electronics for some of the most well-respected brands in the world, our designers are an experienced international team with years of industrial and product design, our developers live and breathe code, and our marketing team are die-hard electronic veterans.

Our team hails from seven different countries with one single goal...to combine style and technology to develop something like no others.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you like our project but you can't make a monetary contribution, please consider sharing it with your friends and family using the share buttons under the video. This will help us greatly to spread the word.

A NOTE TO INTERNATIONAL BACKERS:

Please note: international backers will be responsible for any and all customs, import duties, and/or local taxes you may incur in your country of residence.  We recommend you ask your local tax authorities what you will incur based on the value of your pledge.  Please understand, we have no control over what your own country will charge you in VAT and import duties.  As a final note, we cannot misrepresent the customs information.  We appreciate your understanding of this matter.

AUTOPLUS suitable for everyone.
  "Enhance 300% brightness with unique light diffuser!"Mini TorchOur AUTOPLUS is a competent mini torch, any emergency situation could be give you a big help.It can maybe save your life. 
Safety light
Our AUTOPLUS (nearly) can wrap around everywhere, such as back pack, keyring, baby stroller, hiking pole, front or rear bike …. etc. 
 Phone bike mount
Our AUTOPLUS suitable of 99% of bicycle handle bar, even aerodynamic style, should be no problem to AUTOPLUS.And suitable for 5” to 7” Smart phone

AUTOPLUS Design for LifeDesign sensibility is a cornerstone for our company. To us, the outlook cannot be sacrificed for a better function. The simple lines and organic shape is designed to be used in everyday life and for any special occasion. Taking a minimalist, 'less is more' approach, our designer created a AUTOPLUS that is useful, beautiful and unique. It is a traveller tool that acknowledges the past while looking toward the future. WHY we need you?We have designed, built, and tested the AUTOPLUS prototype. We have selected a well-respected production facility that we have previously worked with successfully. However, one of our biggest concerns was making AUTOPLUS affordable to the most people possible, while still insisting on a rich feature set. In order to proceed, we need create the tooling and order quantity necessary to keep the price reasonable for everyoneThat is why you are our most important asset! By working together, we can all benefit. Risks and challengesThe AUTOPLUS As each winery has its own unique formula and production process ,our  AUTOPLUS create by Environmental friendly material with unique formula polysiloxanesSo that our AUTOPLUS can keep it very thinness(below 1 mm), and provide Ultra Strong & Elastic.Because of the unique material , we can make a ultra thinness lampshade, so that it could provide very high transmittance. That is the one of reason why our AUTOPLUS can improve the visibility = provide more road safety. What you receive in returnBy investing in our project, your pre-orders will help fund the first production run in a quantity that keeps the price low for everyone. In return you get (besides our gratitude and sincere thanks!) a totally innovation of traveler tools at a highly discounted price.Because that is our innovation design, At this moment You never find it at eBay, Yahoo, Amazon…etc.More than that, you join the AUTOPLUS family and make a statement about the importance of your road safety, technology, convenience and style. You will journey with us as we change the face of road safety forever.We have created several different perks to offer AUTOPLUS at prices up to 50% off of retail, as well as some special perks.OUR TEAM
We are a diverse group. Our team have been heavily involved in manufacturing sports and consumer electronics for some of the most well-respected brands in the world, our designers are an experienced international team with years of industrial and product design, our developers live and breathe code, and our marketing team are die-hard electronic veterans.Our team hails from seven different countries with one single goal...to combine style and technology to develop something like no others. Other Ways You Can HelpIf you like our project but you can't make a monetary contribution, please consider sharing it with your friends and family using the share buttons under the video. This will help us greatly to spread the word.A NOTE TO INTERNATIONAL BACKERS:Please note: international backers will be responsible for any and all customs, import duties, and/or local taxes you may incur in your country of residence.  We recommend you ask your local tax authorities what you will incur based on the value of your pledge.  Please understand, we have no control over what your own country will charge you in VAT and import duties.  As a final note, we cannot misrepresent the customs information.  We appreciate your understanding of this matter.

story:
*********

Important Note: Thanks to those who funded us! Sorry for those who had technical difficulties on Indiegogo and were unable to contribute. After lots of feedback, we ultimately realized that Indiegogo was not an ideal platform to purchase a product at our price point. Also, it became clear that potential renters were frustrated that they couldn’t immediately schedule the dates of their trips on this site. Luckily, this is all behind us, since we are fully operational at WWW.HOMEGROWNTRAILERS.COM and already taking orders. Please visit us there today to purchase or rent our sustainable, handcrafted travel trailers!

**********

Overview

Homegrown Trailers™ produces sustainable, handcrafted travel trailers for sale and rental. We are a unique company that fuses a global desire for compact, environmentally conscious, and healthy living spaces for all types of people, including those who haven’t traveled in RVs before. We are passionate about helping people connect to nature and find adventure in a fun, comfortable, and responsible way.

Homegrown Trailers’ products contain a number of exciting features:

  • Iconic teardrop shape with wood paneling

  • Attractive, comfortable interior design

  • 100% solar-powered (with the future option for wind power)

  • Efficient LED lights and ENERGY STAR appliances

  • Full cook’s kitchen with induction cooktop and mini refrigerator

  • Sustainable materials and non-toxic chemicals

  • Clean, composting toilet

  • Hard-sided pop-top for extra headroom and ventilation

  • Lightweight and durable chassis and frame

  • Dimensions: 18’ x 7’4” x 6’9”

  • Approximately 2,000 lbs. dry weight and 3000 lbs. total capacity (here’s a handy online resource to check whether your vehicle has enough towing capacity)

  • Sleeps 4 people in one queen and two twin bunks

The company’s three co-founders, Corey Weathers (operations), Eric Gertsman (marketing), and Kimberly Briar (production), bring years of business, sustainability, and technical skills to the table. We are fortunate to be surrounded by a passionate advisory board and early staff members who are all pouring themselves into making this enterprise a success.


What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for your help in raising $350,000 to build our initial fleet of trailers. We already have seed funding that has allowed us to lease a production facility, hire staff, buy tools, build and test our next generation prototype, and obtain regulatory/industry association approval. What we need now are commitments for a critical mass of rental units and sales before we launch into full-scale production.

We want you to support us because you believe in our mission… and because you want to experience adventures in a Homegrown Trailer yourself. We have many different levels of funding with associated perks—including prepaid rentals and purchases—so now is the time to secure priority in the queue. Reserve your spot today, while giving us the momentum to get out of the gates!

This crowdfunding campaign is critical to our ability to launch the company and begin manufacturing trailers in Woodinville, WA within the next few weeks. With a successful crowdfunding campaign, we will offer rentals by Memorial Day.

The Impact

Sure, we’re a trailer company. But we see ourselves more as a conduit for adventure, travel, and the outdoors. Imagine this scene: Wake up from a comfortable night’s sleep, brew a fresh pot of French press coffee, and take an invigorating stroll next to a creek that’s just outside your trailer door. Or discover a remote, off-grid location to park your Homegrown Trailer as a basecamp for your favorite outdoor activities—rock climbing, hiking, biking, kayaking, or whatever. Or gather the kids around a mountain fire pit to sing songs and roast marshmallows without dealing with a soggy tent or a subpar cooking situation. Where will you explore in your Homegrown Trailer?

Our core ethic is to create an incredibly sustainable way to travel, while protecting the natural places you enjoy! Here’s some of our central sustainability elements:

  • Aerodynamic, teardrop shape and lightweight design help maximize towing efficiency, allowing small, more efficient vehicles to tow it

  • 100% solar-powered (with the future option for wind power), eliminates the need for using fossil fuels and running noisy generators when off the grid

  • Efficient LED lights and ENERGY STAR appliances

  • No toxic chemicals or volatile organic compounds (VOCs)

  • Renewable materials such as FSC-certified wood, sustainably-harvested cork and bamboo surfaces, and other recycled materials used in the interior and exterior

  • Clean, composting toilet allows you to tread lightly when adventuring and reduce toxic chemicals used in traditional black water storage tanks

  • Reusable dishes and flatware, biodegradable soap, and recycled  paper products provided with every rental trailer

Risks & Challenges

Starting any company is difficult and we expect to hit obstacles along the way. We already have seed money to carry us through these critical early months, a production facility, passionate stakeholders, myriad prospective customers, a beautiful prototype, a compelling brand, and a great business plan. We are proven business people that know how to make things work and we won’t quit until this vision is a reality—you can count on that!


Other Ways You Can Help

We recognize that you may not currently have the funds available to contribute. If that’s the case, please tell your friends, family members, colleagues, journalists, bloggers, and any other influencers about us via Indiegogo’s sharing tools, social media, email, phone, and skywriting. If we’re going to be successful and create a movement in the Pacific Northwest and beyond, we need help from you to spread the word.

Thank you! www.homegrowntrailers.com

story:
Building the Vision . . .

How does a farm in rural Canada become a hotbed for innovation, a center for growing good ideas and pioneering ground-breaking solutions to some of today’s toughest challenges?

One cabin at a time.


We are transforming an organic farm and forest in New Brunswick, Canada into a Rural Innovation Campus. It’s no small feat, but we’ve got the land and the dream so now it’s time to provide students, innovators and guests with inspiring accommodations.

Enter the backwoods cabin of the future. Last month we asked architects, designers and DIYers from around the world to give us their best ideas, and we’ve received over 60 amazing tiny shelter designs. Now we have a winner and we're getting  ready to build it this summer!


2016 Winner - 'Be a part of nature'

The winning design 'Be a part of nature' by Germany's AW+ Architects has everything we could hope for - timber frame construction, straw insulation and a cool moss roof!  To top it all off, the cabins exterior calls for and ancient Japanese technique that uses charred wood to preserve and protect it from moisture and insects alike.

To see all the winning entries, portfolio links, and quotes  from the jury, visit our announcement page here.

Did we mention that you can even come stay in the cabin? That’s right - if you’ve ever dreamed of staying in a tiny off-grid cabin in the woods then keep on reading.

$5,000 Will:

  • Help cover material costs for building the backwoods cabin of the future.
  • Provide inspiring accommodation for students, innovators and guests.
  • Make a critical and lasting contribution to the Rural Innovation Campus infrastructure.
  • Bring an inspired idea into reality - a tiny shelter designed to meet global the challenge of climate change.

The Rural Innovation Campus

The Rural Innovation Campus in New Brunswick is paired with efforts in Tanzania, where a sister facility was constructed on the island of Pemba, Zanzibar in 2013.  These two facilities, though worlds apart, represent an international partnership devoted to uniquely rural solutions – bringing awareness, training and applied solutions to global challenges such as food, water, energy insecurity, economic exclusion and climate change.

Ecoforestry Workshop, Rural Innovation Campus. Community Forests International has hosted over 50 workshops with 500+ participants to date. 

How You Can Stay in a Cabin (and Other Perks)

We wouldn’t be here without our supporters and we want to give back. We’ve got a great list of campaign perks to show our appreciation and we hope you like them.

Experience a Night in the Backwoods Cabin

Our top campaign supporters get a night in the cabin. Witness the Rural Innovation Campus firsthand and experience off-grid living. Book your dream vacation now - give $300 or more and select our top perk.

Pemban Perk – Hand Woven Baskets

Our partners in Pemba have pitched in to make our campaign a success. They’ve already got their own Rural Innovation Campus and believe that we too can create a culture of innovation. Tanzanian women have hand-woven these baskets, and for a gift of $200 they could be yours!

Cool Cap (and we’ll plant you a tree)

Your choice of a knit cap, trucker hat or ball cap. While you rep your CFI swag, we’ll plant you a tree in Pemba.

T-shirt (and we’ll plant you a tree)

As a symbol of solidarity, Canadian tree-planters that support Pemban tree-planting projects have been sporting CFI t-shirts for years. Now you can have one too. Donations of $50 or more get a shirt and a tree planted on their behalf in Pemba.

Tree Plant

Our organization began when rural Pembans decided they wanted to plant trees for fruit, timber and conservation. Since then we’ve grown to deliver all kinds of projects, but we still haven’t forgotten our roots. A gift of $25 comes with a tree planted on your behalf by our project partners in Pemba.

Planting 'Mtondo', Pemba, Tanzania

How You Can Help

Please make a contribution and help us bring our vision into reality! 

Help spread the word - tell your friends about our campaign and help us expand our reach.

For more information about Community Forests International and our work, please visit us at www.forestsinternational.org

Thank you!

story:
Why do we promote the Flat Earth Globe?

After rapper B.O.B. Experienced such waves of backlash upon release of his single, Flatline, we decided it was time to support our fellow Flat earthlings.

It is a well known fact that the Earth is flat. The idea that planet Earth is a sphere or a potato is an elaborated fabrication of the NASA and US Government. If the Earth were to be a sphere, how could we possibly walk without falling into the void?

This is why we want to create an accurate representation of planet Earth.

The FLAT EARTH GLOBE is easy to use and it simplifies geography for children and adults alike.

A flat circle hold by a wooden structure, and stainless steel screws.

Our FLAT EARTH GLOBE is waterproof, fire hazard safe, disabled access friendly and environmentally friendly, made from the finest plastic of the People's Republic of China.  


What we need and what you get

  • We need at least $1500 to create the first prototypes in a professional way.
  • The money will be spent in wood, stainless steel screws, plastic and paint.
  • You will get a Flat Earth Globe for a $300 contribution.
  • Other rewards include exclusive posters.

Risks

It is hard to spread the word about Flat Earth without risking backlash from the "scientific" community. We need your help and support.

No official institution would invest in this project.

Every change of paradigm is scary to the mainstream public, but we believe in social transformation through design.


Thank you so much for your support.

IT'S TIME TO BE FLAT!
