story:
Backstory

We have recently successfully funded our idea as a Kickstarter campaign and raised enough money to pay for molds which are often the most expensive investment. In order to offer more color options to our backers, we are running an INDIEGOGO campaign.

Our goal of $10,000 will allow several production runs, resulting in 3 separate color options that will be available. If we raise less than $10,000, the product will still ship in our standard lime green color. If we raise $10,000 or more we will be offering the Grip’enGo Hydration System in 3 separate colors, 2 of which will be chosen through a backer survey immediately following the campaign. Your choice of bite valve and suction tube will be available through the post campaign survey as well. 

 

Here are the reasons we love Grip'enGo:

  • It is durable
  • It is compact
  • It is lightweight
  • It is easy to use
  • It is easy to clean
  • It can be used with any liquid
  • It can be used in any backpack
  • It can be used with any small mouth water bottle 
  • It doesn't leak (medical grade check valve)

SPECIFICATIONS

The Deal

I need your help!! Plastic injection molds are expensive, especially for tight tolerance parts like the parts within Grip'enGo. When I meet my campaign goal, I will be able to economically manufacture the Grip'enGo components. As a result you will be able to take one on your next adventure!! Grip'enGo takes the hassle and mildew out of hydration systems. You need a one for your next trip!

 

APPLICATIONS

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not interested in purchasing Grip'enGo please share the website to people you know are interested.

story:
Short Summary

Ever seen that incredible plaza spot in Colombia?

How about skating a Soviet - era statue in the furthest corner of Russia?

Down The Backstreets is the book inspired by the Bolts Club app which has got skaters all around the world paid for their footage from spots they rip with their friends.

Dipping back into our decades of  skate experience and lore we present a collection of our favourite skate locations from around the wide world, many of which our team first brought to light internationally.

The perfect present for the skater who thinks they have seen it all!

What We Need & What You Get

Down The Backstreets is a project designed to support of the Bolts Club app in both marketing and finance.

Producing the book will allow us to roll out the next iteration of the app with bigger contests and larger prize purses for skaters to get paid outside of the mainstream media.

The book will be dramatically different to anything previously released in the skateboarding genre, combining unrepeatable photography with sharp and insightful essays on  the terrains, cultures and backstories of the places and skaters involved. Timeless and evocative, our aim is to make it the greatest skate book of all time!

The Impact

This book will be a culmination of our travels and skate sessions from all around the world, showcasing the superb photography of one of skateboarding's best-travelled and loved photographers.

Other Ways You Can Help

Like and share!

story:
(English version available below. Versiòn en castellano disponible abajo)

Raccontare un'emigrazione italiana dimenticata, 130 anni dopo.

Siamo Lorenzo Pirovano e Rossella Rocchino, lui giornalista d'inchiesta e documentarista, lei neolaureata in scienze politiche con un focus particolare sui fenomeni migratori. 

Siamo i protagonisti (e futuri autori!) di "Sulle rotaie dei tùtiles", un viaggio-documentario che vuole costruire una narrazione alternativa delle migrazioni, riportando alla luce una storia dimenticata di emigrazione italiana. 

Tra il 1887 e il 1888 circa millecinquecento italiani salparono da Genova verso Puerto Limòn, Costa Rica, per lavorare alla realizzazione del "Ferrocarril al Atlantico". Un viaggio della speranza che per molti si trasformò in un incubo. Morirono a decine, e le condizioni di lavoro furono talmente disumane da portare gli italiani ad organizzare il primo storico sciopero del paese centroamericano.

Dall'estate 2018 stiamo visitando decine di archivi e biblioteche, costruendo per la prima volta un database sui protagonisti di questa storia per tentare di individuare i loro discendenti in Costa Rica o in Italia. Molti furono infatti quelli che tornarono dopo la realizzazione della ferrovia.

Gennaio 2019 sarà l'inizio del viaggio vero e proprio: da Milano raggiungeremo il porto di Anversa (Belgio), da cui salperemo sull'Atlantic Sky (una nave cargo) verso Liverpool. Da lì comincerà la traversata dell'Oceano Atlantico, che in una decina di giorni ci porterà allo sbarco in Canada, ad Halifax, da cui proseguiremo per il Costa Rica. A Puerto Limòn sarà la volta del treno merci fino a Siquirres, dove da vent'anni la linea percorribile si interrompe. Da lì a Cartago cammineremo sui binari e sui ponti ferroviari realizzati anche dai nostri antenati, raccogliendo testimonianze e vissuti dei discendenti sparsi nei villaggi nati attorno al treno.

Di cosa abbiamo bisogno e come vogliamo ringraziarti.

Ad aprile abbiamo vinto il primo Premio FuoriRotta 2018. Questo ci ha permesso di raccogliere praticamente la metà dei finanziamenti necessari alla realizzazione del viaggio-documentario. Con questo "secondo round" di campagna crowdfunding vogliamo:

  • raccogliere l'altra metà dei soldi necessari a realizzare il viaggio-documentario (circa 2.000 euro);
  • coinvolgere più persone intorno al progetto e renderle parte del viaggio, ascoltando i loro suggerimenti.

Per questo abbiamo deciso di riconoscere a ogni donatore un 'perk', ovvero un pensiero (piccolo o grande, dipende dalla somma!) direttamente dal nostro viaggio. Per ringraziarvi del vostro contributo.

L'impatto che vogliamo avere.

"Sulle rotaie dei tùtiles" vuole riscoprire la natura migrante dell'umanità tutta e - quindi - anche del popolo italiano. Un viaggio lento e - a tratti - scomodo per riscoprire il senso più profondo del viaggio stesso.

È una bella sfida.

E desideriamo che tu ne faccia parte. Il viaggio presenta già molte insidie ma documenti inediti e storie mai ascoltate sono lì ad aspettarci. 

Puoi contribuire in tanti modi.

Non solo con una donazione! Ci puoi aiutare condividendo il progetto sui tuoi social network (abbiamo anche una pagina facebook) o parlandone con chi conosci. In ogni caso, sai dove trovarci...Puoi anche scriverci a sullerotaiedeitutiles@gmail.com.

----

ENGLISH VERSION

"They do not usually have anything except a little case and a bag”; with these words, on 8 November 1887, the Gazzetta of Mantua described the 762 Italians -most of whom were from the Lombardy region- that were leaving from the port of Genoa to Costa Rica to try their luck.

That long journey led them- and the other 670 Italians that arrived later- to work for the construction of the railway track that connected the Atlantic coast to San Josè, capital of Costa Rica.

A long-forgotten emigration, characterized by misfortunes and struggles, that deeply influenced the villages along the railway and the Costa Rica society as a whole.

After four generations, two young guys from Lombardy -she from Milan and he from Mantua- decide to walk along the railway track that once was a state-of-the-art project while today, on the contrary, represents a failure. The 140 km of railway, covered by plants, conserve forgotten stories, abandoned stations, known family names, memories of the last descendants and the population of that territory, villages that are at the same time so close and so far from us.

Archives, pictures, travel notebooks and stories, will be collected with the purpose of creating an “interactive museum” available online.

Why?

In an era in which the word “immigration” has been often associated with clandestine boat arrivals and the idea of an “invasion” is spread, Sulle rotaie dei tùtiles aims to foster the historical memory of Italians as a migrant population. The goal is to create a connection between people, distant in time and space, linked to this story in the two countries.

“Tútiles” is the typical expression used to define the Italians in costa Rica. It comes from the shout “Tutti lì” (in english “everyone there”) of the Italians during the rebellion (around 1890) promoted against the unsustainable living conditions that they encountered during the construction of the railway track.

How?

Firstly, crossing the Atlantic Ocean on board of a cargo ship. Then walking from Puerto Limon to Cartago- the previous capital of the country- along the abandoned railway track where many Italians died or settled around the 1890.

----

VERSIÒN EN CASTELLANO

“Generalmente no tienen màs que una maleta y un saco” escribìa la Gazzetta di Mantova el 15 de noviembre de 1887 desde el puerto de Gènova, desde el cual 762 italianos, en su mayorìa lombardos, zarparon para “hacer de Costa Rica su propria América”.

Un largo viaje que los llevò – a ellos y a los 670 que llegaron cinco meses màs tarde – a trabajar en la realizaciòn de la lìnea del ferrocarril que conectaba la costa àtlantica con la capital San José.

Una emigraciòn olvidada, hecha de sufrimiento y luchas que dejaron huellas profundas a la historia de los pequeños pueblos cruzados por los rieles y en la historia costarricense en general.

Cuatro generaciones despùes, dos jòvenes crecidos en Lombardia – ella en Milàn, el en Mantua – recorren a pie los rieles del ferrocarril al àtlantico, antigua importante obra y emblema ahora de un fracaso sumergido por la naturaleza. Bajo la espesa vegetaciòn se esconden de hecho 140 kilòmetros de historias olvidadas, estaciones
abandonadas, apellidos conocidos, voces y recuerdos de los ùltimos nietos y de los habitantes de aquellos lugares, pueblos tan lejanos y sin embargo tan estrictamente conectados (también) a nuestro presente.

Se recogeràn materiales de archivo, fotos, diarios de viaje y testimonios de las personas encontradas para crear un “museo interactivo” disponible en lìnea.

¿Por qué?
En un periodo en que hablar de inmigraciòn equivale a menudo en limitar el fenòmeno a la ‘emergencia desembarcos” y a una percepciòn distorsionada de la seguridad pùblica y a una improbable ‘invasiòn’, Sobre los rieles de los tùtiles quiere alimentar la memoria histórica y contribuir en rescatar la figura de los italianos como poblaciòn migrante, descubriendose nuevamente como parte de ello. El objetivo es crear un vínculo entre las personas, distantes en el tiempo y el espacio, vinculadas a esta historia en los dos países.

“Tútiles” es una tìpica expresiòn con la cual los costarricenses se refieren a los italianos en Costa Rica. Deriva de hecho del grito ‘tutti lì!’ de los italianos en huelga por las duras condiciones de vida a que
estaban sometidos durante la construcciòn del ferrocarril alrededor de 1890.

¿Còmo?
Cruzaremos el Océano Àtlantico en barco de mercancìas y luego caminaremos de Puerto Limón hasta la antigua capital Cartago, por aquel tramo de ferrocarril donde numerosos italianos encontraron a la muerte o se establecieron después de los eventos de 1890.

story:
The Banale Backpack introduces a brand new design with the amazing wrapping pocket that expands when you need to carry more but tightens up when you don’t.

 Run errands with ease, knowing you’ll have space to carry everything. It is perfect for anyone who doesn’t want to be limited on the move.

 The Banale Backpack is prepared for wherever your day leads you - to work, the gym, the post office, the mall, or any adventure.

 The interior is well organized, the exterior is durable and carefully made and if you want to have a closer look, let Diego, the bag designer, guide you through the finest details of the Banale Backpack.

 The Banale Backpack gets even better with the pro-version, designed specifically for those who consider themselves the most diligent urban mover. 

 The quality of design and construction is shared between the two but the pro-version comes with a few added features.

In the Pro bag, the expandable wrapping pocket detaches to become a handy tote bag. Just unzip the pocket, unclip the buckles, adjust the length of the webbing, re-clip the buckles and you're ready to go!

Some of the features: premium coated material, top of the line ykk zipper, extra padded laptop sleeve, secret back pocket, reflective details and more.

The Pro Backpack is perfect for travelling as well, as its trolley sleeve allows it to slide easily onto any luggage. The water-resistant coating material allows for increased protection against the elements as you make your way around the city.

 To thank our supporters, we wanted to offer the best value for your money we can ever imagine.

The Banale Backpack and the Banale Backpack PRO come with a once-in-a-lifetime pre-order discount. On top of that, we’ve got awesome add-ons to help make your travels easier, better organized and more convenient.

 Both versions come in 3 colours. We’ll send out a survey after the campaign is over so you can choose your preferred colour.

For those who live an on-the-go lifestyle, a duffel bag for the gym, sports, shopping and exploring is an everyday essential. The Banale Gym Bag is a foldable, high-quality duffel bag that’s designed to fit perfectly into the wrapping pocket and match the urban style of the Banale Backpack.

 Rest assured that your creams, shampoos, and liquids are safe and organized with our Banale Travel Kit. It includes 3 squeezable, anti-drip silicone bottles, and 3 small jars that fit inside a durable and waterproof plastic case.  

  Reward Packages

 Banale has a mission: to innovate every travel experience. The friendly and informal atmosphere that we have built at Banale headquarters, located in Milan, allowed us to launch and bring to the market 8 innovative products, and design many more.

 Marketing by Tross

 Tross is a data-driven crowdfunding company

story: Northern Lights has done it again!  Senior 4 Lady Lights are going to Disney in Orlando Florida to compete with the best of the best at The Summit!  We have just a few short weeks to fund 20 girls and turn their dream into reality!  The girls are working hard. They are putting on clinics, babysitting, holding community events and even walking dogs to earn funds.  Every single dollar helps and every single dollar is so much appreciated by these girls and their families!  Thank you thank you thank you for all the love and support!!
story_txt: Northern Lights has done it again!  Senior 4 Lady Lights are going to Disney in Orlando Florida to compete with the best of the best at The Summit!  We have just a few short weeks to fund 20 girls and turn their dream into reality!  The girls are working hard. They are putting on clinics, babysitting, holding community events and even walking dogs to earn funds.  Every single dollar helps and every single dollar is so much appreciated by these girls and their families!  Thank you thank you thank you for all the love and support!!

story:
I am so humbled. Once again I hear adventure and servitude calling my name. I am brimming with anticipation and excitement. In just a few short months I will return to the country  and culture that captivated my being to share the hope in Jesus Christ that has restored all that I am. This is what I was made for.

I am traveling in the beginning of August with 318LIVE. It is a local young adult ministry in Bossier, Louisiana. We are going to be joining and working alongside  Teen Challenge, serving the local church, street ministry, and my favorite part, spending time with widows and orphans.

I'm asking you to partner with me for support in prayer and finances. The trip isn't much, compared to what will be gained...  

There aren't words to completely encompass my appreciation. Thank you, thank you, thank you.

If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to ask!


Prayer points:

Please, lift up my team in prayer. We want to be ready and prepared to the best of our abilities so there are no hindrances.

1. Wisdom

2. Protection

3. Provision

4. Divine Appointments. We are, after all, going the with a purpose in mind!


Once again, thank you! I am so grateful that you  took the time to look at this campaign. It means the world to me!

Please spread the word, and pass it on!

story:
About this project

Welcome bike lovers! I hope You watched my video. My name is Kamil, creator of "V-Bike", app that can easily replace traditional bike computers. Goals were obvious - this should be fast, optimized, battery friendly app which does not require a internet connection and which does not contain disturbing ads:



The first version was published in January this year, it was a just regular bike computer and hardly anyone knew about it. V-Bike 1.0.0 were the results of the entire 2014 summer programming and testing. Since then I have corrected few bugs and improved compatibility with the latest Windows Phone system for mobile phones, added altimeter functions (1.0.1) and s.o.s button (1.0.2).

Bike functions:

  • Current speed
  • Average speed
  • Maximum speed
  • Current distance
  • Total distance
  • Current time of trip
  • Total hours spent on bike
  • Current altitude
  • Maximum altitude
  • Climb uphill
Additional functions:
  • Current time
  • Flashlight (personally I use this function as additional lighting at night)
  • S.O.S message (creates a message with gps coordinates)

General functions:

  • Autosave
  • Toggle metric or imperial units
  • Running at background
  • Running with screen off
  • Reset button (clear all records and restore default settings)
  • Overwriting total distance (rewriting from old device)
  • Battery friendly and optimized algorithms
  • The status bar stays on top (informs about the text messages and calls)
  • Autostart

Requirements:
  • Just any Windows Phone 8/8.1 device with GPS receiver.
  • Less than 1MB of free space
  • Led flashligt (flashlight function)


Try it for free!

    Download from Windows Phone Store here, or scan QR code:


V-Bike manual


Help

Writing such an application requires the dedication of many hours of work. In addition to be able to become a windows phone developer and have the ability to emulate created programs, I was forced to buy the Windows 8.1 Pro system (~250$), having an account on the Microsoft site is 19$ per year, app promotion/advertising cost me about 40$. It's costs that I have put into this project. I need to raise money to keep the app free from fee and adverts.

If you can't support the project financially, please share this page with others on Facebook, Twitter or Google+:


I wish my application had language support for other countries..If you can help with translate, please download excel file here. You can send the completed file to the V-Bike official Facebook page here or just e-mail me at vbikeapp@gmail.com.

(With Your help I already added Italian and Ukrainian languages! I can't wait for more : )! Thank You! German language will come soon!)

Any help is important to me and will be appreciated and any person who will support the project will be marked on fb.com/vbikeapp page as honorable mention. 


I’m looking for 2015 & 2016 sponsors

In gratitude I will put your logo with link to your web page in 480x200 format inside my app, in settings menu. Logo will be there until the end of the year 2015/2016.

Sample:


Where Does the Money Go?

Of course the further promotion and development of the application. My plan is to create more functions like:

  • improve altimeter functions (10% complete)
  • settings menu (95% complete) COMPLETED!

  • autostart function (0% complete) COMPLETED!
  • driving angle (85% complete)  COMPLETED!


  • compass (5% complete)
  • multi-language support (35% complete) Polish, Italian, Ukrainian and Germany LANGUAGE ADDED!

  • backlight themes (60% complete)

          and more..

  • calories burned (0% complete)
  • temperature (0% complete)
  • saving and loading all new settings (20% complete)

Still are not convinced?


Let's take a look at a small comparison..


Hope You like it. Have fun with the V-Bike!

Best Regards,
Kamil
story_txt:
About this projectWelcome bike lovers! I hope You watched my video. My name is Kamil, creator of "V-Bike", app that can easily replace traditional bike computers. Goals were obvious - this should be fast, optimized, battery friendly app which does not require a internet connection and which does not contain disturbing ads:The first version was published in January this year, it was a just regular bike computer and hardly anyone knew about it. V-Bike 1.0.0 were the results of the entire 2014 summer programming and testing. Since then I have corrected few bugs and improved compatibility with the latest Windows Phone system for mobile phones, added altimeter functions (1.0.1) and s.o.s button (1.0.2).



Bike functions:

Current speed
Average speed
Maximum speed
Current distance
Total distance
Current time of trip
Total hours spent on bike
Current altitude
Maximum altitude
Climb uphill

Additional functions:



Current time
Flashlight (personally I use this function as additional lighting at night)
S.O.S message (creates a message with gps coordinates)


General functions:

Autosave
Toggle metric or imperial units
Running at background
Running with screen off
Reset button (clear all records and restore default settings)
Overwriting total distance (rewriting from old device)
Battery friendly and optimized algorithms
The status bar stays on top (informs about the text messages and calls)
Autostart




Requirements:



Just any Windows Phone 8/8.1 device with GPS receiver.

Less than 1MB of free space
Led flashligt (flashlight function)





Try it for free!
    Download from Windows Phone Store here, or scan QR code:





V-Bike manual



Help
Writing such an application requires the dedication of many hours of work. In addition to be able to become a windows phone developer and have the ability to emulate created programs, I was forced to buy the Windows 8.1 Pro system (~250$), having an account on the Microsoft site is 19$ per year, app promotion/advertising cost me about 40$. It's costs that I have put into this project. I need to raise money to keep the app free from fee and adverts.

If you can't support the project financially, please share this page with others on Facebook, Twitter or Google+:



I wish my application had language support for other countries..If you can help with translate, please download excel file here. You can send the completed file to the V-Bike official Facebook page here or just e-mail me at vbikeapp@gmail.com.



(With Your help I already added Italian and Ukrainian languages! I can't wait for more : )! Thank You! German language will come soon!)

Any help is important to me and will be appreciated and any person who will support the project will be marked on fb.com/vbikeapp page as honorable mention. 

I’m looking for 2015 & 2016 sponsors
In gratitude I will put your logo with link to your web page in 480x200 format inside my app, in settings menu. Logo will be there until the end of the year 2015/2016.
Sample:



Where Does the Money Go?
Of course the further promotion and development of the application. My plan is to create more functions like:

improve altimeter functions (10% complete)


settings menu (95% complete) COMPLETED!



autostart function (0% complete) COMPLETED!


driving angle (85% complete)  COMPLETED!




compass (5% complete)


multi-language support (35% complete) Polish, Italian, Ukrainian and Germany LANGUAGE ADDED!




backlight themes (60% complete)
      and more..

calories burned (0% complete)
temperature (0% complete)
saving and loading all new settings (20% complete)


Still are not convinced?

Let's take a look at a small comparison..






Hope You like it. Have fun with the V-Bike!

Best Regards,
Kamil

story:
BIG NEWS! New Grand Prize, all inclusive cat skiing trip to the Chic-Choc mountains in Quebec!

~Details below~


Central Vermont's newest backcountry ski glades

Rochester Area Sports Trail Alliance (RASTA) was founded in 2013 with a mission to provide safe and sustainable multiple use trails and backcountry (BC) ski glades for the enjoyment of local residents and visitors to the Central Vermont area.

During the fall of 2013, RASTA member Zac Freeman approached Paul Kendall, Sharon Rives and the New England Forestry Foundation (NEFF) to see if they would be interested in working together to create BC glades on the 1,547 acre Braintree Mountain Forest (BMF) property in Braintree, Vermont that Kendall and Rives had recently donated to NEFF.  In the fall of 2014, over 35 RASTA volunteers spent a weekend cutting RASTA’s first BC glade off the north face of Skidoo Mountain.  The new glade drops 1,000 feet in elevation and ends at the Bell Gates Cabin. 

This past spring, RASTA volunteers spent two days and two nights cutting a skin track and establishing two additional glade zones off of Skidoo Mountain.  This fall we hope to add an additional glade–or two–off the adjacent summit of Twin Peaks.

This project is a model for future BC skiing development in Vermont and beyond.  It shows how proper planning, landowner negotiations and organized volunteers can create sustainable BC skiing that will be enjoyed for years to come.  

The Catamount Trail Association (CTA) and Vermont Backcountry Alliance (VTBC) are helping lay the groundwork for future BC skiing chapters around the state to follow Rasta's footsteps. 

RASTA’s BMF BC ski project is proving to be a major asset by bringing our local community together as we work to provide additional recreational opportunities (more powder for all!). It also provides an economic boost as visitors from afar now stop at local businesses to grab a bite to eat, fill their gas tanks and spend the night at one of the beautiful local inns.  

Funding goals

Our plan is to continue building on the success of the first BC glade by creating what could become one of Vermont’s largest maintained BC zones.  We experienced some growing pains last winter as parking was a big issue and needs to be resolved.  The old cabin at the foot of Skidoo Mtn is perfectly located to serve day use and overnight BC skiers.  It needs a some fixing up and a new wood stove.  Once completed it will comfortably sleep 8, have a cozy comfortable feel and be a great addition to the BMF!

Please consider helping RASTA complete the following items:

  1. Construct a 16+ car parking lot for public use and hire a local plow truck driver to keep it clear all winter long.

  2. Renovate the existing Bell Gates Cabin at the base of the Skidoo glade zones.
  3. Build a trail head kiosk for new maps and other important BC travel info. 
  4. Hire out additional BC glade work to supplement volunteer sweat equity, as there are plans to develop multiple zones across the BMF ridge. 

Donations and Rewards

We’re seeking your financial support and remember ANY donation amount is important and very much appreciated!  We have four different donation levels that will enter you into our awesome raffle.  Some highlighted raffle prizes include local art work, a pair of Voile powder skis and the #2 GRAND PRIZE is a two night stay at a local Air B&B with a two day private guided BC tour for two people....very cool!

UPDATE! We have a new #1 GRAND PRIZE from Chic-Chac in Murdochville, QC the heart of the Chic-Choc mountains! A three night stay, two days of cat skiing, one day of human powered backcountry skiing and all your meals included! Please take a second and go to their website www.chic-chac.ca to see what they have to offer. Great people, doing great work up there!

Boot Deep-$10

Knee Deep - $25

Waist Deep - $75

Chest Deep - $250

Overhead Blower - $500

We greatly appreciate your donation consideration!

Gratitude

The continued support shown by our members, volunteers and landowners is what makes projects like this possible. We are so grateful for everyone's positive energy and hard work! Thank you all so much.

Also, a special thanks goes out to T-Bar Films for making this video, Voile for the raffle ski donation, New England Forestry Foundation, Paul Kendall and Sharon Rives for the opportunity to make this project a reality, Catamount Trail Association &  Vermont Backcountry Alliance for their ongoing support.

For more information about RASTA, how to become a member and our projects be sure to visit www.rastavt.org

We sincerely hope that you will join us this winter to backcountry ski or snowboard in the Braintree Mountain Forest. See you out there in RASTA Country!

Thank you,

- RASTA

story:
" The Rough Ways" Bushcraft Man 2016 is three day race for bushcrafters, woodsmans, trail runners, the ultra light hikers, backpackers, survivalists, hunters and gatherers, flintknapers, climbers, preppers, archers, tramps and for everyone, who loves to stay in the forests and mountains and like primitive skills ...rigid screening of their forces, capabilities and knowledge...


...and we want show this adventure to you!
We want to do good record of the entire race, reports, interviews, profiles of participants and provide all our supporters through an exclusive online access ...

About 30 skilled and courageous people on September 23, starts the race and the next 48 hours will be braving the unknown route and its pitfalls, challenges and elevation, will be settled weather, direction, estimate their strength and abilities and fight with route and yourself. 
They show others what you can handle with a minimum in the backpack, but the maximum in the head and heart!
More about rules and during of the race you can find on our website.

What We Need & What You Get

Our race are carried out in each case at the appropriate level, with quality equipment, with nice prizes for the participants and winners  ...but you can help make them even better! ...and mainly: 

...we would like to cater to other soulmates and sympathizers and numerous other worldwide who are dedicated to bushcraft and that it should nevertheless too far to be able to personally attend - and this perhaps you!

We want make profi record the race, reports, profiles of the contestants, interviews and convey the atmosphere of the whole race through exclusive access to all of our contributors, You will be able to see how to cope with the climb, with archery, manufacture fire way of the Stone Age and other obstacles demanding 25 kilometers of track. ...and all this with english comment.
Yes, for that we need technology, profi videohosting, good directing and few experts... and of course YOU!

Our perks

Map and compass
Original map and compass used for overcoming "The Rough Ways" signet by the winner + Original coin from race + Access to records and reports + your name on our official website.


Bushcraft knife
Valuable, high-quality, handforget bushcraft knife in a leather case with the logo of the race + Access to records and reports + your name on our official website.


Bushcraft backpack

Durable backpack in waxed canvas and leather, in our design and with logo of the race (will available in 10 - 11/2016) + Access to records and reports + your name on our official website.



More perks is right.
His contribution to our project not risk! Perks will get in any case, whether we reach the full amount or not, but the recording and reports quality  will be lower.

Team


Other Ways You Can Help

Share of course ...and you can come to race! You are welcome!

Many thanks!

story:
Thanks For Checking Out Our Project!

We are Gina (18) and Arjuna (19) a young filmmaking/photographing couple from the Netherlands. For our newest project, will be filming a documentary, start vlogging and publishing photos. But why is this so different than all the other folks doing this, you might ask. This is a mobile project, filmmaking from the perspective of two young nomadic supertramps!

This journey will take us all across Europe. From the Netherlands, to the Arctic and back down to the Spain, through more than 21 different countries! A distance of over 9000 miles (15000km to be exact) and we expect it to take us 6 months to make the trip and film all the footage for both the documentary and our vlogs. We have always been dreaming about traveling the globe for a living. So we want to make our career as "Digital Nomads". With our first project, this will be a first step into the rest of our new lives! 

What’s Our Plan?

In May 2017, we want to embark on a trip with a campervan (which we will convert ourselves) from the Netherlands to North Cape (Norway, north) and from Scandinavia after the summer to Tarifa (Spain, south). 

The Documentary

In this film we will visit different innovative projects around the continent that help creating a cleaner and more sustainable future for us all. We believe that there are alternative ways of keeping our productivity up, as a human race, but without hurting the planet we actually live on. We expect the documentary will air the first week of January 2018.

New Kids On The Vlog

We will be blogging weekly and daily upload via Instagram. Our YouTube videos will be uploaded twice a week (if we get the hang of it, we’ll try doing it daily).

Photography

After the trip, we will transform all the photographs taken on the trip into a beautiful photobook of wonders. It will feature high quality imagery you can also order printed on premium metal. Follow us on www.instagram.com/travelingterranauts or visit our website www.travelingterranauts.com for our latest photographs. 

 

What Will Your Donation Do For The Project?

Even though we will be living on a budget and saving money prior to the start of this project, we need some financial support in order to get this traveling manifestation of goodness off the ground. Don't worry, we will be penny-pinching as expected of two Dutchies. 

But for the one still doubting:

  • Fuel to make those miles (kilometers as we prefer to measure, but miles sound cooler)
  • Conversion materials for the bus
  • Several nutritious substances we call 'food' and hygiene (to hide our human odors through the camera)
  • And of course the amazing rewards we will be sending you!

Those prizes are exposed on the right side of this page, you'll love 'em!

Your Contribution Makes A Change!

Even if you are not at all interested in the trip, you should make a donation anyway. Why? Because in our documentary we want to raise awareness for climate change, the current state of our planet and how we can try to fix it. So if we want our (grand)children to grow up on a healthy planet, we should start getting our message out RIGHT NOW!

We have come a long way from where we started, and our narrow timeframe motivates us to keep taking big steps. We have faith our project will succeed and we will reach our own goals as well!

Our Story Has No Worst Case Scenario

But we do want to inform you there might be some complications that could cause a delay or change of plans.

  • A major car accident will definitely be a major issue if it comes to delivering our product on time
  • Even if our relationship would end at some point on this trip, we agreed to finish it as professionals.

Other Ways You Can Help Without Donating Money

For those of you who can not provide shiny ducats to the expedition we have listed some ways you can help us out:

  • Share our project on (all of) your social media
  • If you'd like your music/(fan)art to be featured in our videos in exchange for a nice credit, please contact us

story:
Magic Coffee Art - made by micro roasters

Coffee beans are very sensitive. Roasters are artists that add colours to the beans. Colours - in relation to coffee beans - mean flavour. Roasters are similar to painters, who create art by putting colours on canvas. 
The art work continues once we have received the freshly roasted beans.We create art when we prepare the coffee. The final cup will be a piece of art that mirrors the work and passion of the farmer, roaster and barista.
Coffee beans are wonderful. They connect various people from different parts of the world.

Our First step,

is to introduce micro-specialty coffee roasters from Chiang Mai in Northern Thailand.

More about this location:

Chiang Mai is a place, where magical coffee rituals take place. We return to this city over and over again. Chiang Mai is located in between hills in the Northern part of Thailand. It’s filled with friendly and inviting people, beautiful ornate temples and many interesting coffee shops. Chiang Mai is both, vibrant and quiet. Most of all, it's full of inspiration. 

We visited the city more than once. Each time, We are fascinated, how the coffee-lovers of Chiang Mai celebrate the preparation of coffee while enjoying the beauty of simple practicality and a life of ease within nature. They graciously live in the moment. We love, how local farmers, roasters, baristas and life- enjoyiers find beauty in imperfection. Simple things, like natural and heartfelt daily rituals, can make a big difference in people's lives. 

The coffee-lovers of Chiang Mai highly respect coffee and value deep understanding. They care about each bean and detail of the coffee preparation ritual. In Chiang Mai we discovered that many local roasters and baristas are also passionate photographers. They made us realize that the preparation of coffee is like a photography composition. Even if a landscape may not look interesting at the very first sight, one can always find some nice details and then just focus on them.

We want to learn more about the art of preparing coffee. It’s our goal to introduce the coffee artists of Chiang Mai to the world. Their magic is waiting for us! 

If you are interested to purchase one of the packages, which are described in this project, we will provide you access to a private Facebook group. There we will also share images from our trip and inspirations from various coffee shops and roasters of Chiang Mai. If you do not use Facebook, we will connect via Instagram or Google Drive, from where you can download some images for free for personal use.

Who are we?

Myself - Marek Kubinek (passionate barista and hot beverages photographer) and Patricia Wilke (health expert and a big fan of cacao and coffee).  

Our references:  

Coffee blog and project page here.  

We used run coffee shop, facebook page here  

Photo slide show from our last shop is here

My photography portfolio is here  

Our world travel blog is here

Photo slide show, from some our images is here

If you do not use Facebook, we will connect via Instagram or Google Drive, from where you can download some images for free for personal use.Who are we?Myself - Marek Kubinek (passionate barista and hot beverages photographer) and Patricia Wilke (health expert and a big fan of cacao and coffee).  Our references:  Coffee blog and project page here.  We used run coffee shop, facebook page here  Photo slide show from our last shop is hereMy photography portfolio is here  Our world travel blog is herePhoto slide show, from some our images is here

story:
Hello, my name is Ryan.  Im a Airbnb "Experience" Host in Los Angeles.  Airbnb experiences are activities that you can book with local people.   Its a new program that airbnb is using to market to their 40 million guests worldwide.  I offer an experience that teaches kiteboarding.   In the last three weeks I have had 3500 people wanting to book, that's over 300,000 dollars of work and I can not accommodate this many people.

When I submitted the "kiteboarding experience"  I had no idea my passion was going to take over my life.  What an amazing gift. I love kiteboarding and I love to share that with interesting and amazing people.  With airbnb behind me as one of their top hosts in the world I want to make this expeience into the best kiteboarding school on the west coast.  With your help we can do it together.  Airbnb will advertise and reach the masses for us.  They have already posted me in forbes.com

: https://www.forbes.com/pictures/hdlf45eefd/harn...

They are also planning more marketing for me by the end of the month. They even have a film crew coming this week!!! With airbnb as my marketing arm I believe this Kiteboarding school can bring so much fun and happiness to people in Los Angeles.  

 

I am going to raise 50k.  

15,000 will go to getting a van that will transport even more equipment so we can double our class size and increase our profits.

10,000 will go to getting a second instructor and act as my co-host on the experience team.

Then the last 25,000 will go to getting a zodiac inflatable boat so we can take the class to the wind and never cancel a experience.

If we raise more money than our goal we want to buy equipment and set up a structure at the beach. This structure will need to be coordinated with the city and county and will have legal fees.

 

This school will add so much enjoyment to many people from all walks of life but the real service is adding an experience that you wouldn't be able to do as of now. There is no risk of this school failing right now with airbnb behind us and bookings already into october of 2017.  All I want is to step it up to the professional level that I know this school can become.  So please get the word out and share this with as many people that you know. I want to build something great and with your help we can do it!!!

story:
Short Summary

We are the Tara Rokpa Centre (TRC), a Buddhist centre in the district of Groot Marico, three hours from Johannesburg, South Africa. We focus on four “wings”: therapy, dharma activity, community and environment. This year our focus is on environment. We are building environmentally-friendly structures and developing a permaculture project to grow organic food and medicinal plants.

Our book “With Earth in Mind” documents the eco-building central to the establishment of the centre, as well as showcasing the natural surroundings and the other environmental projects established at the TRC. The up-and-down story of building the eco-buildings are told almost as an analogy of what it means to be a practicing Kagyu Buddhist, where all joy and pain are taken onto the path. The wonderful nature of a Buddhist sangha (community) is captured – imperfect, often irrational, and yet a stronghold, a refuge that you can depend upon as you struggle along this path called life.

Our book ‘With Earth in Mind” is near completion, but we need your help for the final push. To celebrate the work we do at the Tara Ropka Centre, and in honour of our spiritual leader and founder, Akong Rinpoche, we want to see our book in print in March. Contributers will help us publish our book as well as assist our eco-building projects at the TRC. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $5500 to complete our project.
  • We have exciting gifts as a gesture of our gratitude: a beautiful image of TRC with a personalised thank you note from our team, a copy of the final book, visits to TRC for you and a friend, a weekend retreat at TRC with Lucy-Draper Clarke and Nan Lutz.
  • If we reach our entire goal we will not only be able to publish our book but also expand and nurture our eco-building. 
  • If we don't reach our entire goal, the money will still go towards the eventual publication of our book. 

Connect with us

https://www.facebook.com/TaraRokpaCentre?fref=ts
https://twitter.com/TaraRokpaCentre
http://www.tararokpacentre.co.za/

Other Ways You Can Help

2 minutes: share our campaign on your social media. 

5 minutes: Like us on Facebook, Tweet about #WithEarthInMind and invite your friends to do the same. 

15 minutes: Tell your friends about our campaign and get them to join our community. Send them an email, have a chat, show them our video or just share it on their Facebook wall. 

A few hours: Come and visit the Tara Rokpa Centre and become part of our environmental vision. 

Contact us if you would like to help market our campaign.

Remember: you can use the Indigogo share tools!

story:
Flexible Goal - Your Rotto is guaranteed ! 

 

We at Rotto Mania believe that every human being should be given the right to live his life in his own way and that each person has the ability to influence his environment in a good way and we express this idealism in our products. 

 

Meet the Rotto

 

 

Who is in charge ? 

  • As two army veterans , we know the meaning of dedication and hard work. we made it our mission to provide a product that celebrate life.

  • Both of us live with ADHD. For us, Rotto is the perfect game for expression and concentration. We always take the Rotto wherever we go and always get amazing reactions We are not only the co-founders, we are the best customers. We’re sure that our products will deliver just as much satisfaction to you as they have to our team!

 

         Rotto Mania company           

                    

  • Rotto Mania Ltd., an Israeli based company started in 2018, was founded on the belief that one’s ability to express his uniqueness the key life. Accordingly, we’ve designed our Rottos to be an extension of personality. Beautifully crafted for both fashion and function, we’re proud of our Rottos. To us, they’re not only pieces of art, they’re tools for a life better lived.Explore our products, read our testimonials and learn what the Rotto lifestyle is all about.

We need your help ! 

 

  • The Rotto is not just a piece of spinning fabric. It gives people a way to express themselves. And by contributing & sharing our campaign you can help people get to know and enjoy the Rotto.

  • In these early stages all our staff is practicing and filming all the coolest tricks and with your financing and collaboration we can create professional content and spread the word so  you can enjoy the game and increase your performance.

 

What You Get : 

  • After more then a year which we develop , created, sold, received feedback, planned again, created, sold again - we came to you, any amount raised will be spent on materials and work - your Rotto is guaranteed.

  • Our great passion as young entrepreneurs is to get as many people in the world as possible to enjoy the Rotto, we have made every effort so you can enjoy the Rotto this summer.

Other Ways You Can Help

 

We are at the beginning of our Journy! We need you!

- Facebook  ---- >  https://www.facebook.com/RottoManiaOffical/

- Twitter ---- >   https://twitter.com/RottoMania

- Instagram  ---- > https://www.instagram.com/rottomania/

- Pinterest ---- >  https://www.pinterest.com/rottomania/pins/

- YouTube ---- >  https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCEiG53Y7k3qZRA...

- Rotto Mania Offical site - www.RottoMania.com

And wherever you can spread the word!

Peace, 

 

Rotto Mania.

story:
Imagine one of your ordinary luggage. Big box-shaped body, four wheels, and a stretchable handle to draw it. You must have pictured just like this.

Have you ever doubted why most of people think so similar? Because no one tried to change it. And that’s why it remained so dull and uncomfortable for decades. Do you really think this is the best way to carry your luggage?

 

 

Humanity used baskets and boxes before backpack or tote bag were born. 

The improvement of transportation led people to pack more stuff. Bags became too big and heavy to carry by themselves. People needed to find more efficient way to carry it.

RAWROW focuses on the essentialities of products. And we defined the trunk as a tool that helps people carry and move easily. 

R TRUNK is our solution to carry heavy things with ease that contains our obsession to the essentiality of bag, including the bar handle which has never been changed for decades.

 

 

R TRUNK was released at one of the representative online shops in Korea.
RAWROW is originally famous for bags, shoes and glasses among Korean fashion market. And the first luggage we made is already proven by Korean no.1 customers’ reviews.

 

 

R TRUNK was highlighted at Japan along with success in Korea. Japanese thriving shops like ZOZO TOWN and MONOCO started to sell our goods and LOFT held pop-up store for us at Shibuya and Ginza. We were invited to a showcase to introduce Korean good brands and showed off R TRUNK.

 

 



R TRUNK helps you focus only on your journey when you stay or move.

 

Business trip, short travel and long journey… Are you preparing for any kinds of traveling?
R TRUNK will be your best companion to organize and pack whatever your purpose is.

 

It’s way harder when you are with your heavy luggage even though it’s your everyday path.
R TRUNK will lessen the burden on your wrist, and noise on the road as well.

 

  • HINOMOTO Lisof Wheel

R TRUNK uses Japanese low noise wheels called ‘HINOMOTO Lisof Wheel’ which reduces 20dB on the road compared to other brands’ luggage. It also turns 360° smoothly so you can control it easily.

 

The truth that you have to carry so many things doesn’t mean that you may exceed the weight limit. You need to weigh it whenever and wherever you are.

 

  • Scale Handle

Just pick it up and put it down. You’ll see how precise it is.

* Only for 63L, 88L models

* Between 6.6lbs and 88lbs available
   (error range: under 33lbs: ± 1.1lbs / over 33lbs ± 3%~4%)

* LR44 bettery used

 

  • HIDDEN POCKET

You can keep your ticket, passport or a map here and take them out whenever you need.
You can also check whether they are safe with your own eyes.

 

  • BAR HANDLE

You can hang your bag, jacket or umbrella on the bar handle to free your hands.

 

Your luggage will have to endure poor environment at over 30,000ft high during your flight. Low temperature, bumping into other luggage… R TRUNK will keep your stuff safe no matter what happens.

 

  • BAYER Polycarbonate Body and Aluminum Frame​

Body is made of anti-shock German BAYER polycarbonate. The application of Aluminum frame keeps shape of body and protects from various impacts.

 

  • Polycarbonate

Polycarbonate is super light and extra strong material and is being used at high-end luggage. It is 250, 150 and 30 times stronger than plate glass, tempered glass and acrylic respectively. Shock resistance, thermal resistance, weatherproof, self-extinguishability and transparency.

 

  • Durability test

Mileage Test (Stroll 20km with 7kg loaded)

 

Tumble Test (Tumbled 100 Cycles at uneven ground)

 

Drop Test (Dropped from 90cm high testing impact on wheels and edges)

 

Jerk Test (Dropped 2000 times with its handle pulled out)

 

  • TSA Lock

Luggage locks approved by the TSA(Transportation Security Administration).
Only the TSA have a universal master key that will open the locks without breaking it.

How to Reset Your Lock

1. Set Code to '000'

2. Move Reset Button behind the lock to 'Set' and change code

3. Move the button to original position

There’s no time to lose at luggage claim. You need to recognize your bag at a glance.

 

  • BAR HANDLE CUSTOMIZING

RAWROW offers you 8 colors of bar tapes made of vegetable leather.
You can find your bag faster than any others without using name tag or cover.  

How to wrap the bar tape

A pair of bar tapes for each R TRUNK will be presented for Indiegogo backers.
*random color

 

 

  • COLORS​​

 

  • DIMENSION

​

BODY

37L    19.3"(20.9")L x 15"W x 7.9"H    8.3lbs

63L    25.2"(26.8")L x 17"W x 9.1"H    10.9lbs

88L    27.2"(28.8")L x 18.2"W x 11.5"H    12.4lbs

 

BAR HANDLE

W 14.4"

H 37L 22.9" / 63L 17.2" / 88L 14.8"

HIDDEN POCKET

6.3"L x 4.2"W x 0.8"H

*Most of the airlines allows to carry 37L into the plane.
  For more details, please contact your airline. 

 

 

 

 

We provide worldwide free shipping for our backers. Delivery generally takes 7-14 working days. It depends on where you live and forwarder's circumstances. Here are some QnAs you might want to check in advance.

 

Q    When will R TRUNK ship?

A    We are expecting around the begining of January, 2019

 

Q    Do you ship to P.O. Boxes?

A    We only accept actual address where you can get the product in person.

 

Q    Can I modify the shipping information?

A    You can change your address or phone number before dispatch. 
Please email to rawrow.md@gmail.com

 

Q    Do I have to pay taxes?

A    You may have to pay additional import duties and other applicable taxes based on the import policies of your country. The duties and tax rates vary from country to country and we are unable to help you.

 

 

You can return our product within 14 days of delivery. All items must be returned unused with enclosure in original packaging. We will charge you exact around shipping fee and indiegogo fees. We have a one-year limited warranty. If you get a defected product, please contact us at rawrow.md@gmail.com. We will be happy to help you.

 

 

 

 

 

  • Brand

  • Slogan

Product - We’re making necessities in daily life.

Project - We’re thinking essential things in daily life.

 

Mission

  1.  Explore the mere truth. For example what is more important in gold and water in your life?
  2. Do not force what I do not want to do. Even I do not know myself, how do I know you?
  3. Nurture is more important than creation. Is there more to be created or more to disappear at this age?
  4. Be bold. Live as if you were die tomorrow.

 

Story

We started the business with a single design of bag in 2012. Among those who say ‘it’s more than just fashion’, we said ‘it just a bag’. We collaborated with amazing craftsmen to develop shoes and glasses, also collaborated with our first customer to make a ‘MINU BAG’. We opened a store at GWANGJANG market, which has a 110-year-old history. We exchange to new products to customers who have been using the products for a long time. We are exporting to 13 countries without advertisements and sales. RAWROW looks everyday things in unusual ways.

story:
Welcome to Travel Buddy

 

We are a Swedish-American based company that its primary focus is to develop a product that ensures travelers of all kinds to rest while on long-haul trips away from home.               

                         Our products were designed in California, Made in Sweden                                       

            

PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT:

Our initial designs and developments for Travel Buddy started around a year ago, after many years of travel time nothing was comfortable and convenient for traveling. The donut shape travel pillow its designed to rest your neck side ways, but not to ensure proper posture while resting your neck. Our Travel Buddy, does all the above: rest, proper posture and keeps you from waking up every time your neck tilts the wrong way. 

                         

                        A standard travel pillow

Shape and design: Travel Buddy We first got the idea after we tried on a friend's medical cervical collar. While medical cervical collar's primary function it is to treat neck pain, and neck pain being one of the  most prominent and costly health problems in the United States we realized an immediate need for its usage and purpose. Around 50-70% of United States citizens will experience neck pain at least once in their lives. 


 

KEY COMPONENTS: 
Balance: We realized that keeping a balanced neck while resting may help with neck and shoulder pain after hours of travel. 

Comfort: the extra cushion as well as the wrap around the entire neck will increase the level of comfort enabling your body and mind to secure a superior rest. 

Quality:  The high quality foam molds to the natural curves of your neck to provide truly custom comfort.


                         

                
                          

        

 

SAMPLE VIDEO OF USAGE: 

Travel buddy is designed & shaped for traveling, inspired by medical cervical collar

PRODUCT DESCRIPTION:

Travel Buddy is wrapped round the neck for supporting the head during long-haul traveling. Most of the neck cushion (U-shaped) can only support the neck on its back. But Travel Buddy will provide an all-round support. Therefore the user will feel refreshed even after a nap during long journey.

The high quality foam molds to the natural curves of your body to provide truly custom comfort. Travel Buddy will help relieve the stress on your neck and shoulders from sitting for extended periods while traveling. It is perfect for the plane, train, bus, car, or even for watching TV at home!

PICK YOUR FAVORITE COLOR GREY or PURPLE

Travel Buddy has a side pocket for you to keep your credit cards or your phone safe.

Hoodie Travel Buddy, Incognito Edition 

PRODUCT EDITIONS: You will have access to a plain Travel Buddy or the Incognito Edition which it includes a hoodie. 

Next time choose Travel buddy for a better sleep and no neck pain while you travel.

 

Is there more color choice in the future? 
Yes we will produce different colors, currently we only have purple and grey, we will have a milestone on our campaign for color availability.  

Do you ship worldwide? 
Yes of course, we want everyone do have the possibility to enjoy their Travel Buddy.

Can everyone use Travel Buddy ? 
Yes, we have designed and shaped Travel Buddy to custom comfort all ages from 3 years and older. 

Is there any warranty? 
Yes, we have one year warranty on all of our Travel Buddy products.

Is the hoodie re-attachable? 
No, not at the moment to keep Travel Buddy comfortable we have to attach the hoodie to travel Buddy.

Wholesale/Retailer questions? 
Please send us a private message and let us know who you are and what company you represent and we will contact you for further discussions.  

My questions is not here? 
Unfortunately we don't know what that is, so please send us a email to indiegogo@travelbuddy.se and we will answer you ASAP.

 

Challenges:

Currently the only challenge we have in front of us is to make every Travel Buddy we deliver to be at the best quality as possible for the best possible price. Our job it is to and test every unit going to our backers to ensure  you will get a resistant, comfortable and of superior quality product.

Thank you once again for your help to get Travel Buddy on the market!

 

 Follow Travel Buddy on Facebook

story:
SunJuice Solar Charger:

  • 7.5 Watts, 3.9 ounces
  • 14 x 10 inches
  • Embedded USB charging port
  • Charges smartphones in less than 5 hours
  • Lightweight
  • Water-resistant
  • Flexible design ideal for any climate
  • Easily integrates into everyday products

Story

Our experienced team brings more than two decades of solar experience to SunJuice. Collectively we’ve worked on enough solar projects to power over one million homes.

Our goal is to extend the benefits of solar power from the roof and ground mounts into the hands of consumers, helping to enhance quality of life and protect the environment through renewable energy.

Why SunJuice Is The Best

SunJuice ultra-thin charger features the highest-performing solar module by weight, generating over 2 watts per ounce.

SunJuice Today

To date, all our efforts have been self funded and we have hundreds of SunJuice in stock ready to ship.

We have several patents pending that will allow us to integrate our technology into a variety of everyday consumer products.

Campaign Goals

With the funds raised, we will strengthen and increase our intellectual property portfolio by completing and filing additional patent applications. We will also design new consumer products that integrate SunJuice into outdoor activities. Our goal is to have two new products available by March 2017.

Thank You

To say thank you to those that support this IndieGoGo campaign, we will extend a 10% discount on all of our products through 2017.

Let’s Connect

Our best ideas have always come from our clients and customers - those whose lives are being impacted in a positive way through solar.  

We welcome and invite all feedback by contacting us at ideas@solarconsumerproducts.com or 1 800-433-6869.

SCP Facebook

SCP Twitter

story:
Texto en español debajo! :) (turn on the subtitles on the video)

***

Warmifonias is a project involving five women: Sofy, Guaytamba, Gene, Dani and Paty (joined the project after the video recording). We all share the same dream: to travel by bicycle!

Sofy, 32 years old, is a city planner and works in education. She has been teaching other women how to ride the bicycle in the city for six years.

Guaytamba (actually her name is Sofi as well), 28 years old,  an architect who also loves to illustrate.

Gene, 35 years old, has worked with women in holistic reproductive health since 2006

Dani, 26 years old, designs urban cycling apparel and loves to take pictures.

Paty, 25 years old, is a geographer and loves teaching - learning processes.

Each of us dreamt of travelling by bike, and we met each other step by step in different situations.

Dani and Sofy met Guaytamba through a polish cyclo tourist that was staying at her home. From the very beginning they decided to do this trip and project together. Later on, Gene joined the project without doubting it a second. Finally, Paty knew about the project and decided to join us as well.

This is how we ended being 5 women turning this project into a reality!

As a sponsor, how are you helping to change the world?​

  • There are projects that are already changing our world. Your donations will make it possible to share these stories with you and many other people. Sharing this experiences is the key to making new transformations!
    We share our content at Warmifonias Blog, Warmifonias Facebook and other transmedia channels.
  • Your support in this project helps demystifying how women travel and live in South America. Also it helps promote cycling as a way of transportation.

What we need and what our sponsors will get in return?

  • We will need enough food and water (because this will be using our feet for transportation), having safe equipment and insurance. We plan on the 7 month trip to need aprox. $18,000 USD. Fortunately, we've saved for basic expenses already, but we still need your help to cover other expenses!
  • The money will be used mainly for buying food from local producers in each rural community we visit. 
  • After the trip, we will publish a digital book about our findings and we will do a photo exhibition of the story and illustrations of these inspiring women around South America.

 If we achieve our goal, 90% of the fundings will go to support the trip and 10% toward the digital release of research results.

  • If you support us, we want to reward you with special gifts : customized pictures, original illustrations, exclusive content of our trip, your name in our final digital and physical publications.

If we don't achieve our goal of $18,000, all collected funds will go towards  the trip’s basic expenses.

The impact 

  • Through us, the women we will be visiting will find a new channel to make their voices heard. Meanwhile, our visit and the final publication, are important ways to recognize  the value of what these women are doing for their communities.
  • In the other hand we want to share this network with you and many other people around the world, in that way, we can help many little ideas grow with inspiration and thank of this knowledge exchange!

 

Record of Success

Three of us are part of a volunteering woman-based group called "Carishina en Bici" since 2010. This group is based in Quito, Ecuador. We had planned street races, workshops and the amazing urban bicycle school called "God Mother in bike" that helps women of all ages to start riding bikes in the city. The impact with our action has created over 600 new women riders.

http://carishinaenbici.blogspot.com/

Gene has created a project that helps hundred of women a year called "Lunas" (translates to moons in English), a project promoting the use of ecological sanitary towels.  

http://lunasecologicas.org/

 

Risks and challenges 

We are knowledgable and aware of the risks that are included with travel. We will be traveling with no support car behing us, we will carry our tents, stoves and gear all by ourselves. There is limited education and respect for the cyclists in South America. Our biggest concern is that many people in South America see us as a very vulnerable just for the fact of being women. Finally, physic,health risks and bad climate are other risky factors we can't ignore, but will do our best to mitigate.

One of the principal focuses we have learned over the years with cycling is persistence. We believe that is one of our main strengths and we are also capable to see all the risks as challenges to overcome during this trip. We will overcome!

Our largest strength is to be multi-disciplinary. Together we cover knowledgement on many areas: bike mechanic, healthy nutrition, alternative therapies, comunication and social media skills, bilingual language. Our diverse backgrounds play well together in forming a unified team.

  • We have planned our route day by day, that way we can communicate our followers where we are and when we are going.
  • We have researched and purchased our equipment with professional advice. 
  • We have talked and travel with a lot of cycle tourists whom have completed similar routes. 
  • We will travel with an international insurance.
  • We are part of an international cyclist community network (warmshowers.org) that is a free worldwide hospitality exchange for touring cyclists. That way we will be covered in many cities we will visit.
  • We have already interviewed two women in our home city of Quito. Our project is already underway! 

Other ways you can help us:

  • Share this campaign! We want as many people as possible to be aware of this project.  
  • If you know projects in South America that involve badass women, send them to us. We would love to visit!
  • If you have friends living somewhere in our rute, please help us contacting them! So we can find good places to sleep or stay. :)

____________

Warmifonias somos cinco amigas: Sofy, Guaytamba, Gene, Dani y Paty , quien se unió al proyecto después de la grabación del video. Todas con un mismo sueño, viajar en bicicleta!

Sofy, 32 años, es urbanista y trabaja en educación. Lleva 6 años enseñando a otras mujeres a pedalear en la ciudad.

Guaytamba, 28 años, (que en realidad se llama Sofi también) es arquitecta y le gusta ilustrar.

Gene, 35 años, trabaja con mujeres en salud reproductiva holistica hace 10 años.

Dani, 26 años, diseña productos de ciclismo urbano y le apasiona la fotografía.

Paty, 25 años, es geógrafa y le apasiona la enseñanza-aprendizaje.

Todas teníamos el sueño de viajar en bici dándonos vuelta en la cabeza, pero nos fuimos encontrando de a poco.

Primero Dany y Sofy conocieron a la Guaytamba gracias a un cicloviajero que ella hospedó en su casa. Luego Gene nos encontró en una feria y no lo dudó ni un segundo. Y finalmente Paty, se enteró del viaje y decidió subirse también.

Así, terminamos siendo 5 mujeres, consolidando un proyecto y haciéndolo realidad.

Con tu ayuda, ¿cómo ayudas a cambiar el mundo?​

  • Hay proyectos que están cambiando el mundo. Tu contribución hace posible que la historia de esos proyectos pueda llegar a ti y a muchas otras personas.  Su difusión es clave para generar nuevas transformaciones.
    Compartimos el contenido generado en Blog Warmifonias, Facebook Warmifonias y otros canales de transmedia.
  • Tu ayuda aporta a romper paradigmas en Sudamérica respecto a cómo viajamos las mujeres y el uso de la bici como medio de transporte.

 

 

 

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

 
  • Necesitamos suficiente comida y agua ( ya que serán nuestra gasolina durante el viaje) tambien es importante adquirir equipo de alta calidad y liviano por lo que aproximadamente nuestro presupuesto para 7  meses es de $18000. Afortunadamente hemos ahorrado y recaudado algunos fondos para ello, pero todavía necesitamos de tu ayuda!
  • El dinero recaudado se utilizará principalmente para comprar comida a productores locales de cada ciudad y pueblo que visitemos.
  • Luego de nuestro viaje publicaremos digitalmente un libro con todos los hallazgos e historias del viaje, también organizaremos una exposición con vídeos, ilustraciones, fotografías y escritos sobre estas inspiradoras mujeres sudamericanas a nuestro regreso a Ecuador. 

Si alcanzamos nuestra meta en esta campaña, el 90% de los fondos se destinarán para costear el viaje y el 10% restante irá para la publicación digital final.

  • Queremos recompensar a nuestros colaboradores! Con contenido especial y exclusivo : fotos personalizadas, videos especiales, ilustraciones, con la publicacion digital final.
  • Si no conseguimos recaudar el 100% del monto en esta campaña, los fondos iran para cubrir gastos del viaje para completarlo.

 

 

El impacto

 
  • Por una parte, las mujeres que vamos a visitar, a través de nosotras tienen un medio para hacer escuchar su voz. Al mismo tiempo, nuestra visita y la publicación son un reconocimiento de lo valioso que es su proyecto en sus comunidades.  
  • Por otro lado, queremos que esta red que llegará a ti y a varias personas alrededor del mundo, pueda generar un intercambio de saberes para enriquecer tus proyectos y potenciar los que tienes en mente.

 

Historial de éxito

 

Tres de nosotras hemos colaborado voluntariamente desde el 2010 en un colectivo de ciclistas mujeres de Quito, Ecuador, "Carishina en Bici". Hemos organizado carreras, talleres y la escuela de bici urbana "Hadas Madrinas en Bici", que han impactado a alrededor de 600 mujeres con resultados muy gratificantes.

http://carishinaenbici.blogspot.com/

Gene ha compartido con miles de mujeres temas de menstruación consciente a través de "Lunas Ecológicas", ahora lleva a cabo procesos de danzas de paz y círculos de mujeres.

http://lunasecologicas.org/ 

 

Riesgos y desafíos

 

 Somos conscientes que este viaje implica ciertos riesgos. Viajamos sin carro de abasto, con carpas, cocineta y cargando nuestro propio equipaje.  El respeto al ciclista en Sudamérica es escaso.  Puede ser que a la mitad del viaje no tengamos recursos económicos o nos roben. Además, muchas personas consideran que somos vulnerables por ser mujeres.  Finalmente, hay riesgos físicos como enfermedades, accidentes e inclemencias del clima.

  • Una de las enseñanzas más importantes de la bici es la persistencia. Creemos que esa es una de nuestras mayores fortalezas y vemos a los riesgos como parte de los retos del viaje.
  • Al tratarse de un equipo multidisciplinario conocemos sobre mecánica de bicis, salud alimenticia, terapias alternativas, conocimiento de manejo de redes sociales y comunicación, idioma bilingue, que harán que podamos complementarnos en nuestras necesidades del día a día.
  • De todos modos, hemos planificado la ruta  día por día, para que los seguidores de nuestro proyecto sepan donde estamos.
  • Hemos adquirido nuestro equipo con asesoramiento profesional.
    Nos hemos asesorado con muchos ciclo viajeros para evitar riesgos innecesarios.
    Contaremos con un seguro de salud internacional.
  • Formamos parte de una red internacional de ciclistas (warmshowers.org) que colaboran solidariamente con hospedaje y asesoramiento en varias ciudades que visitaremos.
  • Hoy por hoy, dentro de nuestra ciudad, ya estamos entrevistando a mujeres y compartiendo sus historias, el proyecto está en marcha.
 

 

 

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

 

¡Difunde esta campaña con todos tus conocidos! Nunca sabes quién puede estar interesado en apoyar.  

Si conoces proyectos inspiradores en Sudamérica, postúlalos para que los visitemos!

Si conoces amigos que vivan en la ruta que transitaremos ayúdanos a ponernos en contacto con ellos para que nos reciban una noche! :)
