Todas teníamos el sueño de viajar en bici dándonos vuelta en la cabeza, pero nos fuimos encontrando de a poco.
Primero Dany y Sofy conocieron a la Guaytamba gracias a un cicloviajero que ella hospedó en su casa. Luego Gene nos encontró en una feria y no lo dudó ni un segundo. Y finalmente Paty, se enteró del viaje y decidió subirse también.
Así, terminamos siendo 5 mujeres, consolidando un proyecto y haciéndolo realidad.

Con tu ayuda, ¿cómo ayudas a cambiar el mundo?​

Hay proyectos que están cambiando el mundo. Tu contribución hace posible que la historia de esos proyectos pueda llegar a ti y a muchas otras personas.  Su difusión es clave para generar nuevas transformaciones.Compartimos el contenido generado en Blog Warmifonias, Facebook Warmifonias y otros canales de transmedia.
Tu ayuda aporta a romper paradigmas en Sudamérica respecto a cómo viajamos las mujeres y el uso de la bici como medio de transporte.

 
 
 Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes 
Necesitamos suficiente comida y agua ( ya que serán nuestra gasolina durante el viaje) tambien es importante adquirir equipo de alta calidad y liviano por lo que aproximadamente nuestro presupuesto para 7  meses es de $18000. Afortunadamente hemos ahorrado y recaudado algunos fondos para ello, pero todavía necesitamos de tu ayuda!
El dinero recaudado se utilizará principalmente para comprar comida a productores locales de cada ciudad y pueblo que visitemos.
Luego de nuestro viaje publicaremos digitalmente un libro con todos los hallazgos e historias del viaje, también organizaremos una exposición con vídeos, ilustraciones, fotografías y escritos sobre estas inspiradoras mujeres sudamericanas a nuestro regreso a Ecuador. 

Si alcanzamos nuestra meta en esta campaña, el 90% de los fondos se destinarán para costear el viaje y el 10% restante irá para la publicación digital final.

Queremos recompensar a nuestros colaboradores! Con contenido especial y exclusivo : fotos personalizadas, videos especiales, ilustraciones, con la publicacion digital final.
Si no conseguimos recaudar el 100% del monto en esta campaña, los fondos iran para cubrir gastos del viaje para completarlo.

  El impacto 
Por una parte, las mujeres que vamos a visitar, a través de nosotras tienen un medio para hacer escuchar su voz. Al mismo tiempo, nuestra visita y la publicación son un reconocimiento de lo valioso que es su proyecto en sus comunidades.  
Por otro lado, queremos que esta red que llegará a ti y a varias personas alrededor del mundo, pueda generar un intercambio de saberes para enriquecer tus proyectos y potenciar los que tienes en mente.


 
Historial de éxito
 
Tres de nosotras hemos colaborado voluntariamente desde el 2010 en un colectivo de ciclistas mujeres de Quito, Ecuador, "Carishina en Bici". Hemos organizado carreras, talleres y la escuela de bici urbana "Hadas Madrinas en Bici", que han impactado a alrededor de 600 mujeres con resultados muy gratificantes.
http://carishinaenbici.blogspot.com/

Gene ha compartido con miles de mujeres temas de menstruación consciente a través de "Lunas Ecológicas", ahora lleva a cabo procesos de danzas de paz y círculos de mujeres.
http://lunasecologicas.org/ 
 Riesgos y desafíos  Somos conscientes que este viaje implica ciertos riesgos. Viajamos sin carro de abasto, con carpas, cocineta y cargando nuestro propio equipaje.  El respeto al ciclista en Sudamérica es escaso.  Puede ser que a la mitad del viaje no tengamos recursos económicos o nos roben. Además, muchas personas consideran que somos vulnerables por ser mujeres.  Finalmente, hay riesgos físicos como enfermedades, accidentes e inclemencias del clima.

Una de las enseñanzas más importantes de la bici es la persistencia. Creemos que esa es una de nuestras mayores fortalezas y vemos a los riesgos como parte de los retos del viaje.
Al tratarse de un equipo multidisciplinario conocemos sobre mecánica de bicis, salud alimenticia, terapias alternativas, conocimiento de manejo de redes sociales y comunicación, idioma bilingue, que harán que podamos complementarnos en nuestras necesidades del día a día.
De todos modos, hemos planificado la ruta  día por día, para que los seguidores de nuestro proyecto sepan donde estamos.
Hemos adquirido nuestro equipo con asesoramiento profesional.Nos hemos asesorado con muchos ciclo viajeros para evitar riesgos innecesarios.Contaremos con un seguro de salud internacional.
Formamos parte de una red internacional de ciclistas (warmshowers.org) que colaboran solidariamente con hospedaje y asesoramiento en varias ciudades que visitaremos.
Hoy por hoy, dentro de nuestra ciudad, ya estamos entrevistando a mujeres y compartiendo sus historias, el proyecto está en marcha.
   Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar
 
¡Difunde esta campaña con todos tus conocidos! Nunca sabes quién puede estar interesado en apoyar.  
Si conoces proyectos inspiradores en Sudamérica, postúlalos para que los visitemos!
Si conoces amigos que vivan en la ruta que transitaremos ayúdanos a ponernos en contacto con ellos para que nos reciban una noche! :)

story:
https://instagram.com/ladykatphoenix

https://flickr.com/hausphoenixrising

I was invited out to film and photograph the Amazon in Peru with the Conservation team Wild Forests and Fauna and ARCAmazon. With a chance of a life to be part of a great project this is something that can not be passed up. After my 2 month stay in the Amazon I head to Europe to Backpack and work my way across every country working on a chance of a life photo exhibition series immersing myself into a cultural exchange.

Europe I will have a base of 800/mth to travel with as I find creative ways to make money as I travel. I will be working in exchange for food and places to stay and couch surfing. 

Amazon will cost a little more  as it is about $35 to cover 3 meals a day, fresh water, gasoline, and transportation. This is an off the grid expedenture.

Raising money to help procure the subjects for my first exhibition show.

This includes supplies and clothing airfare for around the world. Euro rail pass, camera equipment, passport, etc.

I leave in January all paperwork has been turned in and ready to go. Now just securing sponsors and donors to be producers of this Exhibition show.

2016 is about celebrating life and living in gratitude. It's about living my Seasons of Love as someone has been living with HIV for 6 years. This photo journey is about not taking life for granted and recognizing the beauty in every moment that there isnt any bad situations just lessons to learn.

Will you help be part of this cultural exchange and immersion and help celebrate life.  this is not a vacation. I will be working my way across Europe and capturing a world I can't yet to begin to imagine or comprehend

Links to video what we do in Peru and pre planning list for your info below 56 days of the campaign to go if 1000 of the 1500 friends i have on facebook each help produce this art photo exhibition by contributing $7 we will have no problem reaching the goal. Money raised is helping with airfare, items needed listed below, eurorail, and covers the expenses in cures on a trip such of this. Will be gone for a year dealing with elements.

What are we doing in Peru and Info
Please check out the video on the campaign
Https://youtu.be/svBgbqgPo4c

Predeparture pack info
Https://drive.google.com/…/0B4gCzwGlAcqySHdndlZzTWNYa…/view…

Items needed where and why we have cost to the trip 
*passport
*65-75L rucksack/backpack and small day pack 15-24L
*Quick drying long sleeve shirts for field (2-3) neutral colors to camouflage 
*Quick drying long trousers for field (2-3) zip offs are popular neutral colors
*short sleeve comfortable thirty and vests (5-10) neutral colors
*shorts or cropped pants (2-3)
*underwear and socks plenty 
*swimwear
*warm outfit eg sweatshirt heavy cotton trousers or jeans
*towel medium sized fast drying (2)
*sandals or flip flops 
*light hiking walking boots
*high wellies/rubber boots
*walking stick
*rope
*lock
*rain coat or poncho ponchos preferred 
*broad brimmed hat or cap
*bandana
*sleeping bag
*head torch and rechargeable batteries( 2)
*deet insect repellant
*Sunscreen spf25+ and sun glasses
Washbag and toiletries ecological antibacterial soap and shampoo ad well as ecological clothes washing soap
*ziplock bags and silicon satchets 
*compass 
*waterbottle, metal flask or camel bags
*first aid kit
*digital camera
>telescopic lens
>night vision
*field guides or notebooks to take notes
*wristwatch
*Binoculars 
*earplugs
*Pocket knife 
*following field guides 
>neotropical rainforest mammals by Emmons and feel
>Mammals of the neotropics:the central neotropics
>Birds of Peru
>Reptiles and Amphiphians:an ecotourist guide
>Cusco Amazonico
>Reptile Biodiversity : standard methods for inventory
>Butterflies of South Amazonia
>A field guide to the families and general of woody plants of North west south America
>a neotropical companion 
>travelers wildlife guides Peru 
>Smithsonian atlas if the Amazon

Budgeting
So I get to go through Europe on an 800/month budget as i have that much that comes in every month plus what ever I make working across Europe. Im driving for Uber and Lyft to help supplement as well. $7000 raising pays for the airfare, Euro rail and the most expensive part of the trip amazon at $35/ day but covers food water training and everything it's not the flexible

In Jan I will be joining ARCAmazon and Wild Forest and Fauna in Peru and working with their conservation research team. I will also be hiring a guide to take me the entire length of the Amazon River down to Brazil. then I head to Ireland/England Europe to work my way through Every Country preparing for my first Photo/video Exhibition Show including India and Africa and hoping to end my trip with the great wall of China and the Forbidden Gardens. Morroco, mumbai, Genevea, are definitely on the list This is not a vacation but a chance to immerse myself in to cultural exchange learn for other photographers abroad and capture places in a chance of a life time trip. the goal is minimum $7000 for the year journey.

in January it will be 6 yrs since I became HIV+ and February will be a year since surgery and this trip is about Honoring my experience and capturing a year in my Seasons of Love.

Katerina Du Lac
Lady Katerina - Phoenix Rising
Katandi Media and Entertainment

‪#‎PeruEuroKat‬
‪#‎IAmKat‬


 http://conservetheamazon.org


About my Peru Trip I will be joining the ARC Amazon Research and Conservation Team for 2 months before Taking a trip the length of the Amazon before heading to Europe.

The Las Piedras Amazon Center (LPAC) is our home in the rainforest, a rustic expedition-style camp on a 4,460 hectare (11,021 acre) reserve in the remote Las Piedras River watershed, one of the most biodiverse regions on the planet. The camp accommodates researchers, volunteers, student groups and expeditions in rustic comfort, with minimal impact to the surrounding forest ecosystem. ARCAmazon works with partner Amazon Centers throughout the Amazon rainforest.
‪#‎AmazonAcademy‬
‪#‎ConserveTheAmazon‬
‪#‎AmazonCenter‬

ARCAmazon is currently working to protect an important area within Madre de Dios called Las Piedras. Las Piedras is the longest tributary in the Madre de Dios Region and forms part of the Amazon-Andes Biodiversity Hotspot and an important area for its beautiful landscapes, rich fauna and flora, and fascinating native communities.

When our research teams began studying the Las Piedras River watershed they were blown away at the diversity and abundance of wildlife. Las Piedras is home to a number of remarkable communities, some indigenous to the region, some remote and unconnected with the outside world and others formed with the sole purpose of extracting the forest’s resources. The team was concerned to learn that this pristine area is under increasing pressure from the extraction of timber and the rapid conversion of forest into agriculture and pasture land. More so, that there is little to no private or government environmental policy enforcement in the area. For this reason, ARCAmazon has decided to pioneer a large conservation effort to begin dealing with the issues currently threatening Las Piedras.

The Fauna

While the area remains largely unstudied, we have already seen an extraordinarily large complement of wildlife species. The small area we have studied in the lower Las Piedras is home to over 40 medium to large-bodied mammals including cats: Jaguar, Ocelot, Margay, Puma and Jaguarundi; over 10 monkey species include Black spider monkey, Black-headed night monkey, Red howler monkey, Gray’s bald faced saki, and Saddle-backed tamarin; as well as many other enigmatic mammals such as the Short-eared dog, Giant armadillo, Giant anteater, Grison and Brazilian tapir. There is also an exciting assortment of over 500 bird species in the area, including some of the rarer species such as Psittacidae (Parrots), Cracidae (Guans), Harpia harpija (Harpy Eagle), Morphus guianensis (Crested Eagle), Conioptilon mcilhennyi (Black-faced Cotinga), Cnipodectes superrufus (Rufous Twistwing), Notharchus ordii (Brown-banded Puffbird), Conopias trivirgatus (Three-striped Flycatcher) and Sclerurus rufigularis (Short-billed Leaftosser)

The People

The headwaters of the Las Piedras begin in the Alto Purus National Park, home to groups of native indigenous tribes that live in voluntary isolation from the outside world. Our duty is to ensure we remain well away from these people for their safety, and ours, which is why we only work in the lower reaches of the Las Piedras River–days away from these important tribal lands. In the lower reaches of the Las Piedras River there are a number of interesting riverside communities that welcome visitors and the idea of responsible tourism. The communities of Lucerna and Palma Real form a river port and one of the oldest communities. They established during the time of the Rubber Barons.

There is a road between the community and the Interoceanic Highway which is beneficial to the Brazil nut harvesters who depend on good transport to maneuver their produce. The communities dedicate their lives to agriculture (corn, ginger, cacao, fruit), Brazil nut harvesting and timber. Further up river one finds the remote communities of Puerto Nuevo and Monte Salvado. Puerto Nuevo is an incredibly remote community, at two days upriver from Lucerna. This remoteness has advantages and disadvantages. While the community can lead a relatively undisturbed lifestyle and enjoy fluency in their native tongue (Yine) they are still at risk from disease, malnutrition, lack of access to health services and the odd surprise visit from the uncontacted tribes. Monte Salvado is the most remote settlement on the Las Piedras River and they are decedents of the Yine People. As implied by the name it is also the site of a North American Christian mission devoted to converting the uncontacted tribes to God. The strategy of the mission was to leave the tribes gifts of machetes and bananas. Not surprisingly, these days the community tends to be threatened by the uncontacted people at least once a year while the tribesmen gesture for more machetes and bananas.

The Challenge

Unfortunately, threats from the lower Las Piedras area are spreading upriver at a concerning rate and endangering the future of these unique people and wildlife. Between 2002 and 2004 the Peruvian government granted more than 7.5 million hectares of forest in concessions to logging companies. The middle and lower Las Piedras were primarily divided into Brazil Nut Concessions and Timber Concessions. Despite this attempt to zone the use of the forest, over-harvesting of timber continues to grow due to the high market price of species such as Mahogany, Cedar, and Iron Wood, and a total lack of government presence and law enforcement.

Recent loopholes in the law and generally low income from Brazil Nut harvesting has meant that thousands of Brazil Nut Concessions (hundreds of thousands of hectares) are now legally being logged, and hunted as a consequence, in the lower and mid Las Piedras. The areas surrounding Las Piedras are increasingly under threat from encroaching road networks and conversion of forests to agriculture. While it is technically illegal to convert forest in a concession many local people believe they will have a good chance of obtaining land ownership if they race to convert it to agriculture. As a result, the area cleared in the lower Las Piedras is growing at an alarming rate, with frontier extraction communities such as Lucerna continually felling and burning the land around them to make way for unsustainable agriculture. It is vital to work with these communities to find ways to increase the productivity of their forests and community lands, and so reduce their rate of forest conversion. There is currently little presence of private or government conservation-focused action in the region. ARCAmazon is one of the pioneers in this area and we are joining forces with other small initiatives to create a bigger impact.

Europe Trip

As a Lyft and Uber driver I hear from my riders ways to get the most out of my trip.  I will be working on farms and ranches, volunteering as tour guides and at hostels, and doing odd jobs to stretch my $800/mth budget as I work my way through every European Country and Looking at Africa and India and Asia as  well learning about various cultures, trying new challenges to sustainable living, and learning from various photographers. 

I am looking at hoping to get a job with National Geographic or another company from my diverse portfolio when trip is said and done.

story:
On Monday 5th October, between 10am and 1pm, The Fleeting Arms on Gillygate was broken into, with money and some equipment stolen, predominantly a laptop used to run the business*. Although there was, thankfully, no damage to the premises or any stock stolen, the pub has been the victim to opportunist theft previously, and may be targeted again if we don't improve security at the back of the building.

As a small community not-for-profit enterprise, the robbery does mean that takings for the week are down, but we simply cannot afford to replace the laptop. Although it was an old model, it was useful for running music and projection, managing the social media and emails. We offer free space hire for events, parties, rehearsals, performances, fundraisers and gigs, and now have regular midday-11pm Tuesday- Sunday opening times for people to use us for office and meeting space.

We're starting this crowdfunder as a way for people to support The Fleeting Arms and help us recoup what was stolen from us this morning. It's also highlighted the urgent need to improve our security over the whole building, and invest in new locking devices. 

*Update: The laptop was found abandoned round the back of the premises, so no longer needs replacing. All money raised with therefore be spent on improving the security of the building.

As a small community not-for-profit enterprise, the robbery does mean that takings for the week are down, but we simply cannot afford to replace the laptop. Although it was an old model, it was useful for running music and projection, managing the social media and emails. We offer free space hire for events, parties, rehearsals, performances, fundraisers and gigs, and now have regular midday-11pm Tuesday- Sunday opening times for people to use us for office and meeting space.
We're starting this crowdfunder as a way for people to support The Fleeting Arms and help us recoup what was stolen from us this morning. It's also highlighted the urgent need to improve our security over the whole building, and invest in new locking devices. 
*Update: The laptop was found abandoned round the back of the premises, so no longer needs replacing. All money raised with therefore be spent on improving the security of the building.

story:
Hello my name is Fernando Aguilar, I'm an industrial designer and the creator of MasterKi, After several years of working in different companies, I realized that my passion is to create new and innovative things.

MasterKi is the result of great efforts of the last year, in which we invest time and money in a project for you, we rely on the design of old keys, that was the source of our inspiration. Began as just an invention of a  bottle opener that I had in my keychain, and started to use it to open boxes, remove screws and that's how we came up with the idea. 

 "combine a lot of functions as possible in something you always carry with you, without leaving the design and functionality"

Meticulously designed every aspect to this magnificent result, which to have it in your hand you will have the feeling of security, guarantee that this tool will help you in multiple situations without carriying a toolbox and we want to share with you!

MasterKi goes with your lifestyle


Our Prototypes:


Description: 

MasterKi is a lightweight compact and retro version of a multi-Tool, designed and developer to be truly useful at any moment and even better you can wear it! 

It's so lightweight that you won't notice is with you!

  • -Material: Stainless steel 
  • -Weight:  7.9 gr
  • -Dimensions:  2.5” X 0.98" 
  • -Thickness 0.078"
*** Patent pending ***


The idea: 

Initially the idea was to replace 7 tools, surprisingly of the response from people, we noticed that every time who use it finds a new function. We replacing 13 tools in one multitool

We put a few of the many options out there and we are sure that you will find a new one in every occasion:


Functionality of MasterKi:

  • Ruler (mm or inch)
  • Mini Sharpener
  • Flathead screw driver
  • Lottery scratcher 
  • Box opener 
  • Can opener 
  • Bottle opener 
  • Canister lid popper  
  • Tag popper 
  • 3 different sizes Hex wrench (6.3mm, 8mm, 10mm)  or (1/4", 5/16", 3/8")
  • You can use with standard screw bit

Options/Versions 

We create 2 versions, standard Metric and standard Inch, the differtnes are: 

The metric version is :

  • Graduated  every 5mm,
  • Hex wrench  6.3mm 
  • Hex wrench 8mm 
  • Hex wrench 10mm

The Standard Inch is:

  • Graduated every 1/4" 
  • Hex wrench 1/4" 
  • Hex wrench 5/16"  
  • Hex wrench 3/8"


Challenges  

Throughout this year I searched and overcome almost all obstacles, all we need is your help to produce in series with the best provider and the best materials

MasterKi is not just a project, is the key to creating a company and to launch a series of products that look forward in 2016

The goal

Our goal is to deliver a product that you like it as we are, when you get your hands do part of you and become vital in your life but we need YOUR help.

With your help we can fund and pay the money that is invested in each prototype, to produce the video of the campaign and even better !! Improve product and  able to hire the best manufacture, the best quality provider, using the best materials and start serial production.

The goal is 728 dll And with YOUR help we can get!

Because each aid is important we create different rewards according to your support, remember that the rewards are unique IndieGoGo and not ever see those rewards

Indiegogo is the platform we've been looking to grow and publish inventions and know that with your help we can give life to many projects looking forward to 2016


Other ways you can help

Some people believe they can not collaborate with this project, but it is not like that, you can help us by sharing this project on Facebook and twitter or both

story:
It's OK to Feed the Hikers!

 

A Hiker's Life is a Hungry One.

But we can help. We have a small restaurant called Neenach Cafe near where the internationally famous Pacific Crest Trail (PCT) crosses Highway 138 at mile 518 in the desolate but picturesque West Antelope Valley in California.  In less than two years we have accumulated over 115 Google reviews (unsolicited) with an average rating of 4.5 stars. Google "Neenach Cafe and Market" (link here) to see them for yourself. We also have 29 Yelp reviews, also with an average rating of 4.5 stars (link here).  Much of that love came from PCT hikers, but we are only one lonely outpost along the 2665 mile (4290 km) long PCT.

We would like to improve on that. What if we could serve hikers the kind of food they love (our food) all along the trail?  We could - with a food truck.  Nature imposes a strict timetable on PCT thru-hikers.  Approximately 6000 ambitious thru-hikers from around the world must depart from the Mexican Border mid Spring and hike at least fifteen miles per day to arrive at the Canadian Border by October 1st in order to avoid snow, raging torrents, and freezing temperatures as much as possible.

This is the equivalent of climbing and descending Mount Everest nineteen times, or once every nine days.  Besides thru-hikers, it is estimated about a million people use the PCT each year for shorter adventures.  Our plan is to park our food truck at strategic locations along the PCT (road crossings, campgrounds, trailheads) and serve our popular cooking to hikers as they pass by according to their schedule.  After the main group of hikers have passed we'll move our food truck north to meet the bubble of hikers again.  We anticipate two to three weeks at each location, and we expect hikers will encounter us eight to twelve times during the course of their thru-hike.

Hikers constantly communicate with each other via social media about trail conditions, equipment recommendations, and great places to eat (like ours), so our online presence among our aficionados is more like word-of-mouth than advertising.  Of course we will alert hikers on social media where they can find our food truck along the way.  They already eagerly anticipate feasting at the Neenach Cafe and they’re certain to enjoy our food truck even more.  And what’s not to love about finding a food truck in the middle of the wilderness, especially when you’re really hungry!  Best of all, for hikers it weighs nothing and takes up no space.

 

We're World Famous!

 

Feel the Love!

Awesome people that really care about their customers and it shows in all their efforts. Great food. Good prices. Nice place with interesting insights to local history. - G.R.

The food was extraordinary and the service superior.  I would recommend that when in the area stop in. - L.F.

GR8 PLACE 2B, FRIENDLY STAFF AND VERY CLEAN WITH GR8 FOOD, I'LL B BAC. CU ALL SOON ENJOY THE CRUZ. - OG.R.

Love this late lunch stop!  ...  Great tasty street tacos, angus burgers and service. - K.D.

On the home stretch from a long and sweltering hot (over 100°) weekend motorcycle ride, the Cafe was truly an oasis!  The food looked greats, the drinks were cold, and the service was top-notch. Just what I needed! - C.D.

Awesome breakfast burritos! Nice little market for all your road trip needs. - T.B.

The Best food and service!! Have to stop every time!! - S.

The friendlist,and the best cheese burger and fries i ever had. - A.J.

Awesome burgers. - A.D.

The burger was excellent,  a chubby patty cooked like home.  Leaf lettuce generous tomato and onion slices. Grilled bun. The fries are really good,  they are kind of gourmet without being pretentious.  Lol. - K.S.

Excellent espresso, great place. - B.V.

Love to stop in for a visit when I'm in the area! The food is fresh, artistically arranged and tastes amazing! Always friendly and if the song is right, you might just have a sing a long!!!! - J.S.

I haven't had good Mexican food in a long time, and this was the best. One of my favorite restaurants I have been to on the West Coast. - J.T.

Oh and the food!!! Seriously the best asada tacos I have had in such a long time. No gristle, perfect texture and the flavor...lets just say it's a good thing we live 2 hours away. - K.B.

I LOVE this place!!!! We stopped on our way to San Jose and had the best experience. - C.C.

Just an over all great place to stop in the middle of nowhere. - B.T.

The Al pastor burrito was tasty. The pig breakfast burrito is huge and full of meat and is perfect for two or one hungry hiker. - P.J.

Love coming here for their awesome food and atmosphere. Staff is always friendly and the cafe has the best grub in town! Their asada fries, burritos, and burgers are amazing and the kitchen is so accommodating. - A.B.

Amazing friendly staff, WONDERFUL food and such a clean and cool cafe!  Highly recommend :) - M.M.

Great oasis in the desert. Had the giant burrito and it was indeed giant. Fresh ingredients. Cool atmosphere with some great music. Would definitely recommend for a quick stop or a couple hour stay. Hiking the PCT and it was a great place to escape the heat and re charge the batteries with great food and service. - E.S.

I came in for gas on the way down 138 and discovered the best thing ever "nacho fries" ! They have spicy salsa to go with too. Delicious food and a fun staff thanks y'all. - T.P.

It's basically a market/cafe at a gas station but so worth it once you're there. Get the tacos and some coffee (sourced locally) and you won't regret it. The staff is really friendly too. - D.S.

He said the mexican food is the best ever, so i tried the green chile burrito.  OMG!  it was fabulous.  My friends had burgers, and kept coveting my dish.  Very friendly folks. - S.F.

Great service and super friendly. Food is excellent! - B.A.

Best carne asada burrito outside the greater Los Angeles area!!!! Hands down and I am SUPER picky when it comes to my burritos. Even the beans were amazing. - H.M.

I stop at this store/ Cafe maybe 2 or 3 times a month, people are so nice and friendly, the restaurant is clean. I love the small town hospitality at that cafe..... - R.S.

Just enjoyed some delicious street tacos de pollo.  What a delightful surprise to discover this little treasure in the desert. - T.B.

Great food, great customer service, many choices to pick from the menu, happy they have a gas station with a store and it even got beer, cant beat that. - G.B.

Great bacon burger, they have a crazy double super burger, it's absurdly big. The bacon burger is bitchin, nice quiet area to look out at while you eat. A good midway meal tween the 5 and the 14. Plus, chances are, no one you know has ever been to Neenach. - W.B.

The cooks make killer meals for a very underrated and under appreciated cafe. Definitely a place to stop and enjoy the surroundings and the food. - D.L.

I had the breakfast burrito here and it was the best I've had. - C.H.

The best street food around! If you're traveling you gotta go here even if it's out of the way! They got this new outlaw ice tea that's fantastic guy even shakes it up right in front of yah crazy good food - S.B.

 

Challenges

There are two challenges facing this project:
1) Configuring the food truck for extended wilderness operation.
2) Obtaining necessary permits from relevant agencies.

The first challenge actually sounds like fun, so it's more a matter of finding the right truck and modifying it than anything else.
The second challenge depends on the agencies in question.  Generally, the farther away from major population centers (which is all of the PCT) the easier and more personal the application process.  But, it's still a process and can take time.  After the first year this should become routine.

 

Who We Are

 

Thanks for visiting!

story:
RIGWA LIFE 

www.rigwalife.com

 

***BREAKING NEWS***

 

RIGWA is transforming fresh food at home and on the go!  Through our patented and innovative design, RIGWA is your most VERSATILE bowl - HOT or COLD, AT HOME or ON-THE-GO, SOLO or SHARING - RIGWA is the ECO FRIENDLY, REUSABLE container CHANGING THE GAME!  And now... your RIGWA purchase comes with an even greater impact:

RIGWA has partnered with Feed the Children where every RIGWA sold before December 31st will supplement 6 meals for children and families in need!  Additionally - RIGWA is going to retro our contributions and donate for all RIGWAs sold to date!  We are currently over 2000 meals supplemented for children and families in need... NOW THAT IS IMPACT!!!  

 

THE WORD ON THE STREET...

“The perfect size!”

”My favorite bowl in the kitchen!”

“Keeps everything perfectly fresh.”

“The lid an absolute GAME CHANGER!”

”Amazed by the versatility of this bowl!”

”Essential camping and hiking gear.”

”The GIFT no one has, but EVERYONE needs!”

 

OUR STORY... OUR JOURNEY

Hi! My name is Jericha Jordan and along with my husband Zac, we created RIGWA LIFE.  We live in Charleston, SC with our 4 amazing kids, living a fun, but super active lifestyle.  Whether it’s soccer practice, gymnastics, beach days, or a get-together with friends, we are often on-the-go!  When we’re not running all over town, we’re relaxing at home usually making home-cooked meals as a family. Whether we’re on-the-go or relaxing around the house, we’re always looking to enjoy fresh food... yet I’m ALWAYS searching for the perfect container to keep our FOOD FRESH!  A container to serve fruit at breakfast, but then store in the fridge for soccer practice later.  Or something to keep snacks fresh and cold at the beach... and durable enough for the kids to throw in their backpack.  Or maybe even something stylish enough to take to a party with friends and have our food fresh when we arrive!  I shuffle through plastic, glass, and metal containers - but never find one bowl that will do it all!  UNTIL NOW... 

It was on a random night making dinner at home when the RIGWA Bowl 1.5 was born.  It was taco night and I kept running back and forth to heat up the queso.  Frustrated, I looked at Zac and asked, “why haven’t we seen a vacuum insulated bowl - for food?”.   It was this question that sparked so many thoughts around all the uses we would have for a bowl like this.  Something versatile, functional, durable... and yes - still beautiful!  Ultimately, we couldn’t find anything out there... definitely nothing versatile enough for our family and active lifestyle!  So... We decided to GO FOR IT!!!  Take some risk... Create a product... and start our company, RIGWA LIFE.

We started this journey over two years ago, when we created our first concept drawings at home.  It was soon after those drawings that we became obsessed with creating a world class product that would forever change the way we view & use a “bowl”!  We obsessed over every detail - whether it was the angles of the bowl, the materials used, or the lid design, every single element has been examined, tested, and redesigned to insure our customer’s satisfaction! 

It is with incredible excitement, that we’re ready to launch the RIGWA Bowl 1.5 - YOUR MOST VERSATILE BOWL!  The container that will TRANSFORM FRESH FOOD ON-THE-GO!

PRODUCT

**THE BOWL**

We set out to create a bowl that would not only keep up with our active lifestyle, but enhance it.  The bowl itself holds 1.5 QTs (hence the name) and is high quality & durable 18/8 food-grade stainless steel.  It is vacuum insulated, which allows you to keep food hot or cold for HOURS.  *Up to 4 hours hot & up to 12 hours cold*.  The double walls prevent transfer of temperature... so fill it with HOT ramen or COLD ice cream and hold the bowl worry-free... and SWEAT-FREE!  The bowl offers a beautiful silhouette and has no visible weld seams or screw threads.  You won’t even see any visible logos (just a subtle one on the bottom).  Additionally, we designed the bowl itself with thoughtful angles and details.  We spent countless hours looking at the size of the bowl to increase versatility - large enough to share with others, while the perfect size for your own salad, soup, or açaí bowl.  This bowl is as stylish & versatile as it is durable... and ready to take on ANY OCCASION.

*In a recent comparison test, the RIGWA Bowl (without lid) held ice for 13 hours before melting!!!  This was 4-8 hours longer than the competitors in plastic, glass, and other metal bowls.  

**THE GAME-CHANGER**

Our LID is the main reason this product has taken two years from concept to launch, however it’s also the game-changer for what will be your most versatile bowl.  The lid is BPA-free and insulated with a dynamic, yet simple design that increases the functionality, durability, and versatility of the bowl.  When you close the lid, you’ll hear the internal air release through the pressure cap, giving you the confidence your lid is secure and air-tight.  Once you close the pressure cap, you simply cannot remove the lid - well, most of us can’t... :).  When you’re ready to eat (or share), release the pressure cap and use the SIMPLE two-finger opening system to remove your lid with ease.  This dynamic feature (secure lock, yet easy to open) was not easily accomplished, but the code has been cracked!  Air-tight & secure closure, yet easy to remove with 2-fingers... SIMPLE INNOVATION!

Together, the sleek and durable bowl meets an innovative and stylish lid to create YOUR MOST VERSATILE BOWL, ready for any adventure!

US PATENT NO. D842047

Additional Patents pending.

Trademarks: “RIGWA LIFE” & “Keep Life Fresh”

THE CAMPAIGN

We are incredibly excited for this campaign on IndieGoGo and even more excited to offer the RIGWA Bowl 1.5 to you - our supporters and our customers!  We have spent over two years perfecting the RIGWA and a successful launch will enable us to put the wheels in motion for a larger production run and expansion of the RIGWA LIFE brand (New sizes, designs, and products).

We are confident you will love your RIGWA Bowl 1.5 and can’t wait for you to get your hands on it!  We hope you’ll help us SHARE OUR STORY with your friends and family!  To help spread the word, we’re offering a number of discounts during our IndieGoGo launch and expect to have your RIGWA Bowl 1.5 shipped to you in October / November!   

The simple click of a button to share RIGWA LIFE with your network is more helpful than you can possibly imagine.  THANK YOU IN ADVANCE TO ALL SUPPORTERS!!!

 

NEXT LEVEL

To help us meet our goal, we’re offering some incredible IndieGoGo PERKS:

- NEW IndieGoGo Launch PROMO (1 RIGWA) for $35 (27% off)

- The Perfect Pair (2 RIGWAs) for $70 (27% off)

- Three Amigos (3 RIGWAs) for $105 (27% off)

- The PERFECT Gift! (5 RIGWAs) for $175 (27% off)

***Retail price of $48 per unit will go into effect right after the IndieGoGo launch campaign.  Get your RIGWA NOW!***

 

WHAT ARE PEOPLE SAYING???

“I decided to buy a RIGWA because I was tired of my Tupperware not keeping our food fresh when on-the-go. Between park dates, long car rides, and just being a Mom wanting healthy snacks while out with the kids, I am happy to say RIGWA has proven to be the perfect container! Fruit, chicken salad, Mac-n-cheese, guacamole - it literally keeps everything to the temperature you want and perfectly fresh. Loving my RIGWA and highly recommend!

~ J. Quinn, North Carolina

 

 “Amazed by the versatility of this bowl!  We use it every day in some capacity.  If anything, we could use more than one.  This is a MUST HAVE for anyone that has a healthy, active lifestyle!” 

~ K. Rosmarian, South Carolina

 

“We enjoy hosting & entertaining, and our RIGWA is our go-to bowl!  Without fail, our guests are always amazed at how the dip is still hot, desserts are still cold, and fruit is still fresh hours later.  The RIGWA is also great for when we’re on-the-go during busy weeks with practices, games, and everything in between.  We can easily pack healthy snacks that stay fresh and our kids enjoy!”

~ S. Lonnen, North Carolina 

 

“My RIGWA is part of my essential camping and hiking gear.  I never have to worry about keeping my food fresh on the trail.  From the mountains to the beach, my RIGWA goes with me everywhere!”

~ T. Sayler, Colorado

 

“It is my favorite bowl in the kitchen!  The perfect size for mixing and storing left overs.”  My RIGWA Bowl is the perfect size to fit in my work bag and keep my dinner leftovers fresh for lunch the next day at the office!  

~ J. Carter, Arizona 

 

“Our family spends a lot of time outdoors and loves having picnic dinners at the beach or park after a busy work and school day.  The RIGWA is the perfect container to transport our food and keeps it hot or cold until we’re ready to eat... AND eliminates the need for a cooler!”

~ L. Pangretic, South Carolina

 

“RIGWA is a versatile product that has provided a new and better way for us to serve and store food.  We use it at the dinner table, for tailgates, and while entertaining friends and family.  When we hear the lid create that airtight seal, we are certain our food will stay fresh!”

~ W. Jacoby, California

 

IMPACT

As part of our company mission, we have committed to creating IMPACT on a large scale - from the start!  Although we are a start up, it is critical that we set the stage for how our company will operate and align to our company mission and values!  

As a result, RIGWA has partnered with Feed the Children and for every RIGWA Bowl 1.5 that is purchased from October 21, 2019 – December 31. 2019, six meals will be supplemented to children and families in need.  RIGWA will RETRO this donation and will donate for all RIGWAs purchased prior to October 21st!!!  We are well on our way to supplementing THOUSANDS of meals for children and families in need.  THAT IS IMPACT!

Over the last two years, and throughout this journey, we’ve come to learn so much about the negative impacts of single-use plastic on our environment.  We’ve also been pleasantly surprised by the many applications of RIGWA, each of which help eliminate single use plastic and other less reusable products.  We hope you will share in our passion to reduce single use plastic and know that with every use of your RIGWA, you’re playing a huge role to reduse plastic waste.  #SUSTAINABLE #REUSEABLE

 

FEED Disclaimer: $1 = 6 meals. Minimum donation (from RIGWA to FEED) of $1,000.

 

Your support for RIGWA LIFE is greatly appreciated.  Please see the IndieGoGo Share Tools to help spread the word!!  The simple click of a button to share RIGWA with your network could have tremendous impacts on our start up!  We THANK YOU!

Jericha & Zac
story_txt:
RIGWA LIFE 
www.rigwalife.com
 
***BREAKING NEWS***
 
RIGWA is transforming fresh food at home and on the go!  Through our patented and innovative design, RIGWA is your most VERSATILE bowl - HOT or COLD, AT HOME or ON-THE-GO, SOLO or SHARING - RIGWA is the ECO FRIENDLY, REUSABLE container CHANGING THE GAME!  And now... your RIGWA purchase comes with an even greater impact:
RIGWA has partnered with Feed the Children where every RIGWA sold before December 31st will supplement 6 meals for children and families in need!  Additionally - RIGWA is going to retro our contributions and donate for all RIGWAs sold to date!  We are currently over 2000 meals supplemented for children and families in need... NOW THAT IS IMPACT!!!  
 
THE WORD ON THE STREET...
“The perfect size!”
”My favorite bowl in the kitchen!”
“Keeps everything perfectly fresh.”
“The lid an absolute GAME CHANGER!”
”Amazed by the versatility of this bowl!”
”Essential camping and hiking gear.”
”The GIFT no one has, but EVERYONE needs!”
 
OUR STORY... OUR JOURNEY
Hi! My name is Jericha Jordan and along with my husband Zac, we created RIGWA LIFE.  We live in Charleston, SC with our 4 amazing kids, living a fun, but super active lifestyle.  Whether it’s soccer practice, gymnastics, beach days, or a get-together with friends, we are often on-the-go!  When we’re not running all over town, we’re relaxing at home usually making home-cooked meals as a family. Whether we’re on-the-go or relaxing around the house, we’re always looking to enjoy fresh food... yet I’m ALWAYS searching for the perfect container to keep our FOOD FRESH!  A container to serve fruit at breakfast, but then store in the fridge for soccer practice later.  Or something to keep snacks fresh and cold at the beach... and durable enough for the kids to throw in their backpack.  Or maybe even something stylish enough to take to a party with friends and have our food fresh when we arrive!  I shuffle through plastic, glass, and metal containers - but never find one bowl that will do it all!  UNTIL NOW... 
It was on a random night making dinner at home when the RIGWA Bowl 1.5 was born.  It was taco night and I kept running back and forth to heat up the queso.  Frustrated, I looked at Zac and asked, “why haven’t we seen a vacuum insulated bowl - for food?”.   It was this question that sparked so many thoughts around all the uses we would have for a bowl like this.  Something versatile, functional, durable... and yes - still beautiful!  Ultimately, we couldn’t find anything out there... definitely nothing versatile enough for our family and active lifestyle!  So... We decided to GO FOR IT!!!  Take some risk... Create a product... and start our company, RIGWA LIFE.
We started this journey over two years ago, when we created our first concept drawings at home.  It was soon after those drawings that we became obsessed with creating a world class product that would forever change the way we view & use a “bowl”!  We obsessed over every detail - whether it was the angles of the bowl, the materials used, or the lid design, every single element has been examined, tested, and redesigned to insure our customer’s satisfaction! 
It is with incredible excitement, that we’re ready to launch the RIGWA Bowl 1.5 - YOUR MOST VERSATILE BOWL!  The container that will TRANSFORM FRESH FOOD ON-THE-GO!
PRODUCT
**THE BOWL**
We set out to create a bowl that would not only keep up with our active lifestyle, but enhance it.  The bowl itself holds 1.5 QTs (hence the name) and is high quality & durable 18/8 food-grade stainless steel.  It is vacuum insulated, which allows you to keep food hot or cold for HOURS.  *Up to 4 hours hot & up to 12 hours cold*.  The double walls prevent transfer of temperature... so fill it with HOT ramen or COLD ice cream and hold the bowl worry-free... and SWEAT-FREE!  The bowl offers a beautiful silhouette and has no visible weld seams or screw threads.  You won’t even see any visible logos (just a subtle one on the bottom).  Additionally, we designed the bowl itself with thoughtful angles and details.  We spent countless hours looking at the size of the bowl to increase versatility - large enough to share with others, while the perfect size for your own salad, soup, or açaí bowl.  This bowl is as stylish & versatile as it is durable... and ready to take on ANY OCCASION.
*In a recent comparison test, the RIGWA Bowl (without lid) held ice for 13 hours before melting!!!  This was 4-8 hours longer than the competitors in plastic, glass, and other metal bowls.  
**THE GAME-CHANGER**
Our LID is the main reason this product has taken two years from concept to launch, however it’s also the game-changer for what will be your most versatile bowl.  The lid is BPA-free and insulated with a dynamic, yet simple design that increases the functionality, durability, and versatility of the bowl.  When you close the lid, you’ll hear the internal air release through the pressure cap, giving you the confidence your lid is secure and air-tight.  Once you close the pressure cap, you simply cannot remove the lid - well, most of us can’t... :).  When you’re ready to eat (or share), release the pressure cap and use the SIMPLE two-finger opening system to remove your lid with ease.  This dynamic feature (secure lock, yet easy to open) was not easily accomplished, but the code has been cracked!  Air-tight & secure closure, yet easy to remove with 2-fingers... SIMPLE INNOVATION!
Together, the sleek and durable bowl meets an innovative and stylish lid to create YOUR MOST VERSATILE BOWL, ready for any adventure!
US PATENT NO. D842047
Additional Patents pending.
Trademarks: “RIGWA LIFE” & “Keep Life Fresh”
THE CAMPAIGN
We are incredibly excited for this campaign on IndieGoGo and even more excited to offer the RIGWA Bowl 1.5 to you - our supporters and our customers!  We have spent over two years perfecting the RIGWA and a successful launch will enable us to put the wheels in motion for a larger production run and expansion of the RIGWA LIFE brand (New sizes, designs, and products).
We are confident you will love your RIGWA Bowl 1.5 and can’t wait for you to get your hands on it!  We hope you’ll help us SHARE OUR STORY with your friends and family!  To help spread the word, we’re offering a number of discounts during our IndieGoGo launch and expect to have your RIGWA Bowl 1.5 shipped to you in October / November!   
The simple click of a button to share RIGWA LIFE with your network is more helpful than you can possibly imagine.  THANK YOU IN ADVANCE TO ALL SUPPORTERS!!!
 

NEXT LEVEL
To help us meet our goal, we’re offering some incredible IndieGoGo PERKS:
- NEW IndieGoGo Launch PROMO (1 RIGWA) for $35 (27% off)
- The Perfect Pair (2 RIGWAs) for $70 (27% off)
- Three Amigos (3 RIGWAs) for $105 (27% off)
- The PERFECT Gift! (5 RIGWAs) for $175 (27% off)
***Retail price of $48 per unit will go into effect right after the IndieGoGo launch campaign.  Get your RIGWA NOW!***
 

WHAT ARE PEOPLE SAYING???
“I decided to buy a RIGWA because I was tired of my Tupperware not keeping our food fresh when on-the-go. Between park dates, long car rides, and just being a Mom wanting healthy snacks while out with the kids, I am happy to say RIGWA has proven to be the perfect container! Fruit, chicken salad, Mac-n-cheese, guacamole - it literally keeps everything to the temperature you want and perfectly fresh. Loving my RIGWA and highly recommend!
~ J. Quinn, North Carolina
 
 “Amazed by the versatility of this bowl!  We use it every day in some capacity.  If anything, we could use more than one.  This is a MUST HAVE for anyone that has a healthy, active lifestyle!” 
~ K. Rosmarian, South Carolina
 
“We enjoy hosting & entertaining, and our RIGWA is our go-to bowl!  Without fail, our guests are always amazed at how the dip is still hot, desserts are still cold, and fruit is still fresh hours later.  The RIGWA is also great for when we’re on-the-go during busy weeks with practices, games, and everything in between.  We can easily pack healthy snacks that stay fresh and our kids enjoy!”
~ S. Lonnen, North Carolina 
 
“My RIGWA is part of my essential camping and hiking gear.  I never have to worry about keeping my food fresh on the trail.  From the mountains to the beach, my RIGWA goes with me everywhere!”
~ T. Sayler, Colorado
 
“It is my favorite bowl in the kitchen!  The perfect size for mixing and storing left overs.”  My RIGWA Bowl is the perfect size to fit in my work bag and keep my dinner leftovers fresh for lunch the next day at the office!  
~ J. Carter, Arizona

As a result, RIGWA has partnered with Feed the Children and for every RIGWA Bowl 1.5 that is purchased from October 21, 2019 – December 31. 2019, six meals will be supplemented to children and families in need.  RIGWA will RETRO this donation and will donate for all RIGWAs purchased prior to October 21st!!!  We are well on our way to supplementing THOUSANDS of meals for children and families in need.  THAT IS IMPACT!

story:
OLD MAN’S: MORE THAN JUST ANOTHER SURF REPORT

 

Old Man’s app was created for people who love and respect demanding outdoor marine sports. Using this app keeps the marine buoy guessing down and the marine sport activity up!

 

Why We Built This Marine Forecasting App?

  • I wanted a forecasting app that had everything, Swell size, Wind, Tide, Everything in one sweet user friendly area - to quickly look and go to do my sports.

  •  I wanted a design that was easy to read and felt like it was made for me and my active life.

  • I wanted a forecast that fit my style, with unique functions and reliability.

  •  I needed a forecasting app made for my life.

  • Now that it’s finally here, this is one app you or I will ever need

 

WHY INDIEGOGO?

PRE-ORDERS. The main purpose of this campaign is for promotional and pre-order activities. We are offering the project backers a unique opportunity to get our marine forecasting app at an incredibly attractive price ‘FREE! for LIFE” (including all future updates) immediately during and at the end of the product campaign, before the app is put up for subscription. All pre-orders will also get a lifetime of new features and functions.

 

Building a Better Forecasting App

Together with my partner Boris, we developed a predictive algorithm (smart computer program) we call TWIGGE, or the “The Weather Information Global Gathering Environment.” This intelligent computer program forecasts and predicts surf at your local break. TWIGGE is very accurate, forecasting swells thousands of miles away then predicting those same swells at the local surf spot.

  • Boris and I spent months just designing and working on the user interface or how the screen works with the user. We researched our customers - found out what they liked and designed our surf forecasting app around that focus.

  • We have Exceptional Current Resources - we use over 7 global weather data resources and work personally with them to suggest what we need, and they in turn research their data driven computer models to improve spatial resolution (or precision of a measurement on the current weather model or weather map) for us.

  • Our Innovation Never Stops - We are in contact with “Big Wave Riders” who are testing our long range models helping us improve our developed forecasts. 

 

Our Funding Needs and What You Will Receive

Your contributions will go towards funding the marketing of our fully functional app called the "Old Man’s Surf Report" (Old Man’s) for IOS mobile devices.

  • The Old Man IOS app is already fully functional including several features and functionalities like favorite marine breaks and secret spots.

  • We are asking for $6,500. With your help we will use the money to alert people who are unhappy with the existing big swell forecasting companies, and that they have a better choice.

  • Our funding goal of $6,500 is our budget to accomplish the marketing of our app, targeting surfer oriented print and social media products.

  • The Android version, we would love to include as our stretch-goals, with extra funding, development for the Android mobile operating system will be accomplished.

  • Old Man’s unique intelligent programming is focused on how the swell breaks at the local level, it’s bathymetry (or measurement of the depth of the water), how the tide, swell height, swell period, wind, and the local coastline locations affect your local break. 

  • For the past few months the Old Man’s app was tested by hundreds of people. It has received rave reviews by testimonies and all 5 star reviews from the Apple Store

 

 

Have Fun and Enjoy Life

One of Old Man’s goal is to create an open minded and inclusive community for people who love marine sports regardless of how far they live from the beach or water seashores.

  • Making Accurate Marine Sports Forecasting Available Is Important To Us!

 

Old Man’s App is for

  • The Fun Addicted

  • The Brave Beginners

  • The Fearless

  • The Adrenaline Junkies

 

Our Smart, Intuitive, User Defined Interface

The only marine forecasting app you'll ever need. Our smart, intuitive, user defined marine weather app is loaded with features like favorite breaks and secret spots, and ready to take on the world.

Some of Old Man's Features and Functions

  • Actual Surf Breaks, 

  • All Marine Buoy Data Needed

  • Easy To Read And Understand

  • Over 7 World-Wide Resources Like NOAA, Storm Glass, Buoys From Europe, Africa and Asia And More

  • 7-Day Forecast And a 7-Day Forecast Summary 

  • Adding Your own Favorites and Secret Spots, and

  • TWIGGE, Our Expert Algorithm Which Forecasts This At Any local Surf Break Around The World

 

 

 

Our Design and Feedback

  • In designing the Old Man’s Marine app, we considered the full range of feedback from marine app users requirements: what needed to be accessed quickly, what needed to be simply and accurately reviewed, and what needed to be quickly summarized.

  • We attempted to strike a balance between the model of the phone size and operating system as well as the actual information on the smallest screen size without making information too difficult to see.

  • We used focus groups for their feedback. Most users needed certain requirements and services so we built that into our apps environment. We wanted to capture the needs of most user’s therefore helping them to engage more within the app.

  • We're thrilled with the result; Old Man’s app provided users a fast and accurate way to look up of marine forecasting information on our smallest supported iPhone, the apple iPhone 5. And an accurate friendly mobile screen, free from ads, encouraging forecast engagement.

  • Just like wetsuit pioneer Jack O’Neill, Old Man’s app founders William P. Messier & Boris Gundertlach wanted to create something that would allow people to do their water sports more wisely and focused on technology for inspiration. We wanted to push the limits of forecasting marine sports resulting in finding better days to Surf, SUP, Waveski and Foil because that is our ultimate love!

  • Old Man’s app was created for people who love and respect demanding outdoor marine sports. Using the app gets them to their location sooner, 7-day forecast and 7-day summary lets them plan out their week more efficiently, and TWIGGE, our expert algorithm allows them to do this with accurate information.

 

What Our Customers Think of Old Man's

 

 

 

Using Old Man's For a Typical Surf Session

This Feature Shows How to Get a “7 DAY SUMMARY FORECAST ”

  • This Winter, because of this feature mentioned above, I was able to plan in advance to be able to ride more waves than ever before!

 

 

Our Stretch Goals

Main Goal

$6,500 for marketing targeted resources

  • If We Reach $10,000 - We will develop a complete working Apple Watch version.

  • If We Reach $15,000 - We will be able to develop a complete working version for the Android mobile operating system including a Metic System to measure in meters.

  • If We Reach $20,000 - We will add more advanced components to TWIGGY’s intelligence for marine forecasting.

  • If We Reach $25,000+ - We will develop a complete working Old Man’s OSX (Mac) Desktop version.

 

Our Team - People Behind the Old Man’s Surf Report

  • It is just the two of us
  • Co-partner and CTO Boris Gundelach with over 20 years application development in the USA and Europe is the lead in all things Old Man's.
  • Co-partner and CEO, Dr. William P. Messier has over 15 years experience in user interface development and over 40ty years experience surfing and forecasting swells all over the world.

 

 

More About Us

I'm William P. Messier, the co-founder of Old Man’s.

For as long as I can remember I've had a taste for marine adventure and big challenges. I worked in the computer industry most of my life when programming was done on on computer punch cards and computers filled up rooms in order to operate.

  • Surfing the early years, I developed a passion for forecasting marine sports and the only way to get a good forecast was to call life guards, read the newspaper, listen to the radio or step on the sand.

  • My dream was to create a mobile device that will help you understand marine weather and see forecasting trends 7 days out with just a motion of your hand. The technology was not available.

  • As the technology improved to what I felt was needed to initiate user defined designs, I vowed to finally pursue my dream and began working on the marine forecasting app of all apps.

  • My recent LinkedIn profile is available here ( check out some of the marine sport videos): 

https://www.linkedin.com/in/wpmessier/

 

In comes Boris Gundelach, with over 22 years application and web development within the USA and Europe. Boris Gundelach resume is impressive 

https://www.linkedin.com/in/couchworx/

Boris brings to the table, platform architecture, app UI/UX & development using Xcode/Swift, Android Studio/Kotlin and Xamarin/C#. And backend development using AWS and Google Firebase as a basis, ERP solutions, product development experience customizing applications for small and medium enterprises in all industries

  • I was lucky to find him. With his technology skill set, he made my dreams come true. It was a fusion of my vision and his technological artistry, creating an ultimate marine forecasting app allowing users to keep in touch with mother ocean and bring empowerment to marine weather prediction. 

  • We are committed to the the crowdfunding community, and look forward to delivering more advanced functions, providing supporters high quality features time after time.

 

Timeline: What We've Achieved and Aim to Achieve

  • April 2019: Surveyed multiple user groups (surfers’) to find out what they liked within a working app. Then designed a swell forecasting app around that focus - understanding their issues, workflow processes, goals and preferences we can up with a user interface.

  • May 2019 - July 2019: completed and polished the user interface design based on the the user groups then we hosted a focus group for feedback. We received positive feedback and made minor adjustments. Most users needed certain requirements and services so we built that into our apps environment capturing needs of the user therefore helping customers to engage more within the app. 

  • July 2019: officially released app on the Apple Store for world wide prototype feedback - We received personal positive feedback and Great! 5 star reviews.

  • August 2019: Continued working on interface features and polishing from world wide focus groups feedback

  • September 2019: Full working app - testing, quality control and refined from focus groups feedback. We received rave reviews

  • September 2019 - 2020: Adding new features and functions and refinement from user feedback

  • January 2020: We launch our Indiegoggo campaign

  • February 2020: We develop a complete working Apple watch version

  • April 2020: We will develop a complete working version for the Android mobile operating system and Metic System on the Android.

  • June 2020: We will develop a complete working Old Man’s OSX (Mac) Desktop version.

 

 

Why Crowdfunding  on INDIEGOGO?

  • PRE-ORDERS. The main purpose of this campaign is for promotional and pre-order activities. We are offering the project backers a unique opportunity to get our marine forecasting app at an incredibly attractive price ‘FREE! for LIFE” immediately during and at the end of the product campaign, before the app is put up for subscription. All pre-orders will also get a lifetime of new features and functions.

  • OUR GOALS - Your contributions will go towards funding the marketing of our existing fully functional app called the Old Man’s Surf Report (Old Man’s) for IOS mobile devices. 

  • With your help we will use the money to alert people who are unhappy with the existing big marine forecasting companies, and that they have a better choice

  • Our funding goal of $6,500 is our budget to accomplish the marketing of our app, targeting marine oriented print and social media products. 

GETTING THE WORD OUT. Indiegogo is a great way of facing and supporting our patrons.

  • Old Man’s have surveyed hundreds of user groups to find out what they liked within a working marine forecasting app.

  • Then we designed it around that focus - creating the highest performing product we can, but we can always improve.

  • We need more feedback from marine forecasters from all over the world to help us improve and make the greatest marine forecasting app in the world.

  • And you can help us accomplish this either by becoming a backer or giving feedback on our Instagram Page:

https://www.instagram.com/williampmessier/?hl=en

 

Creating Your Favorite Spot:

 

 

Why You Can Trust We’ll Deliver Updates Regularly:

All supporters, we are going to provide you this app for life!, which include future functions and features

We're going to keep on delivering you a better marine app. Here's why:

  • First, look at my passion for developing this marine forecasting app

  • The design of Old Man’s speaks to me, which means, I understand what users need and take my obligation to backers seriously.

  • Second, with a fully functional working app, and hundreds of happy backers, you can trust we are committed to delivering new versions and features as designed. Only better!

  • This isn't a prototype. This is a fully functional working version! We will actually produce better future versions

  • We have requests from existing users and will act on them.

We are a small company so it is easy to make decisions and turn our technology on a dime to change and move in that direction and to put that change into the next new version

  • This insures the latest technology is infused into our marine app. 

  • We take pride in personal service - it does not happen very often when users request help, but it is important for us to respond within an hour. We even provide a phone number. Who does that?

We have user defined designs by surfers for surfers. We researched our users, find out what they liked and designed a marine forecasting app around that focus and continue to do so

  • When you back us, you can trust this project will come to life. Don't hesitate to send us a message if you have any questions or concerns.

All we need is your support...

 

The Tech Guy Interviews Old Man's

 

Risks & Challenges

They are always there... but since we have a fully working functional program this risk is reduced. And no one within a crowdfunding campaign has ever said "these risks could end us!" Sorry, we are positive. We don't think the project is going to fail, for the reasons we outline below. But, there are a few important things you should know:

  • Life Happens - Life gets in the way and could slow down programming. As of today, we haven't detected it yet. We have made unbelievable strides overcoming huge obstacles with design and technology. We have a fully loaded functional working app with an unbelievable user interface.

  • Technology Issues - We are always looking to incorporate the latest technology into mobile devices. Can the new devices handle this new technology? One thing we understand, innovation never stops and adapting newer technology to existing mobile devices is a matter of working out the kinks on our end.

  • Getting Your Phone Model To Work - This is a risk. We design everything according to Apples’s recommendations. An iOS developer generally needs to have their apps work with the most recent models of iPhones. Developers need to support the most recent and last major release of iOS. The rule of thumb is that phones have a three-year life. With that in mind, “Old Man’s” will support IOS devices as low as iPhone 5.

  • Updating The App - To get the latest update with the latest cool features make sure your iPhone model is set to automatically updated by default. The iPhone 5 and above will allow you to do this in your settings. We are producing updates regularly with super cool features and function.

  • You Don't Like the App - There isn't a lot we can do about this one. But really, the app is awesome. We don’t know anyone who hasn’t loved it yet!

Those are the risks as we see them.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • You can contribute by getting the word out and make some sounds about "Old Man's" send them to this campaign or at our website for a download (oldmanwaves.com).
  • There are some great Indiegogo share tools a click away!

It is as easy as that.

 

Or, Support This Project

  • Support a project without expecting a reward because it speaks to you
