Our aim is to sell the Gibbon Child Carrier all over the world. By ensuring we meet the strictest guidelines for quality and safety, we have an opportunity to do this.
Throughout the campaign, we’ll be pushing for some stretch goals.




When you back this campaign, you’re helping build a foundation on which we can build a company that can do more to benefit the world. The Gibbon Child Carrier is only the beginning. Now that we have the expertise, the access to top-notch materials and construction methods, we can begin to explore other industries that can benefit from the technology. When you fund us, you're not just making life easier for parents. You're part of an impact that will be felt in other markets.


You can also support us by helping us spread the work on Facebook and Twitter. Please make good use of the social sharing buttons on this campaign. We’ll love you for it!

Like us on Facebook!

Follow us on Twitter!
What’s in it for you?
What would IndieGoGo be without some amazing rewards? We’ve put together some good ones, including premier access to a Gibbon Child Carrier (or two) of your own! The target retail price of a Gibbon Child Carrier is $150, but the first 25 backers will be able to get theirs for $125! So act fast, when they're gone, they're gone. 





We have some other great rewards, though, so don't worry. For the duration of this campaign, this will be THE EXCLUSIVE PLACE for pre-ordering your very own Gibbon Carrier! 














Be sure to keep your eyes peeled for some new exciting rewards that will be announced by March 3 as well as a survey for custom colors, etc! We have a few other tricks up our sleeve, too, so get ready.



What's the next step?
Trusted manufacturing partners with vast experience are ready and standing by to help us bring the Gibbon Child Carrier to your doorstep.

February/March: Finalize design and engineering through more product testing by parents, and fund our dream!
April: Complete testing and international quality control certifications, including certification to sell to children.
May/June: Pilot production, quality assurance and product validation.
July: Begin order fulfillment!


When we first began designing the carrier, we realized that it was quickly starting to resemble a gibbon monkey, swinging through the trees. It is also a reference to how gibbons carry their young. They are in a perpetual embrace. 

This is also telling of our long term mission, which is to bring families closer together by allowing them to focus on all of life's precious moments and less on the woes of child mobility.
Our Journey
When my wife and I had our son, Magnus, we wanted do all of the things we love to do, but we wanted him to be able to enjoy them, too. We wanted to take him with us wherever we might go, and have him be part of our adventures and experiences.  
By time he was about two years old, he was starting to get bigger and heavier which made traveling with him more difficult. We were carrying him a lot, which was uncomfortable and tiring for everyone. We tried to solve it by purchasing several different makes and models of strollers and child carriers, but we quickly noticed that a lot of the solutions out there weren’t working for us and were cutting into the time we were supposed to be enjoying together.
Strollers, car seats and bulky backpacks can be difficult to travel with and take up a lot of space in vehicles, overhead compartments and in crowded trains, trams and buses.
In some instances, just having a stroller can have a negative impact on your travel plans. One time when boarding a plane to Paris, we were asked to pay an additional $5 just to check our stroller. Running through the airport with our infant son asleep in a stroller in addition to our check baggage was already taking it’s toll, and suddenly we were hit with this extra inconvenience.
On the ground in Paris, the stroller struggle continued. Many of the streets are cobblestone and are difficult to navigate with a stroller. On several occasions, our son nearly fell out from all the vibration. Needless to say he wasn’t able to nap much while we explored on foot, which bore its own challenges.
The final straw

Some time later when we were back home in Seattle, my wife called me one day after having accompanied some friends to the airport. She had taken our son along with her but he had become exhausted and inconsolable. She was so tired of having carried him around that she was almost in tears as she spoke to me. They had boarded the train a while ago and she decided to ride it around for nearly an hour to let him sleep and so that she didn’t have to carry him.
We were getting fed up. We began to ask “Why isn’t there something better?” Our son was already too big for many other carriers, and a stroller wasn’t always the best option. We decided to take matters into our own hands and design a solution for ourselves.
The Journey from concept to prototype
We teamed up with Physical, an industrial design company with an eye for the future in Oslo, Norway. They listened to our needs and designed the first Gibbon Carrier, which resembled a Gibbon with its arms outstretched.

In addition to helping us to conceptualize a sleek and stylish carrier, they built and tested the first prototypes with parents, teachers and children at Ruselokka Kindergarten. Through multiple rounds of testing they were able to figure out what works with real people in real situations.
Our next challenge was figuring out how to have it manufactured. We were specifically looking for a company who would pay incredible attention to detail and perform highest possible quality work, down to every stitch. We eventually partnered with B.A.G. Accessories Group in Portland, Oregon. 

The product evolved again and is now the Gibbon Carrier you see today!
It’s truly been a labor of love! But now, with your help, we can take it to the next level and put this awesome carrier into the hands of parents everywhere.
With your support, the Gibbon Carrier can become the ultimate next-generation child carrier!

Risks and Challenges
We have been working for more than 2 years developing The Gibbon Child Carrier and getting it ready for production. We know what the next steps are for manufacturing and fulfillment and have great partners ready to start.
We will undoubtedly have surprises on our journey, but we trust that we have the team to overcome all challenges, as we’ve done so far. Our goal is to make the best possible product and deliver it right on time. 
Manufacturing
This process is complex and requires time and money. Complications could potentially emerge and delay the manufacturing schedule. To tackle this risk, we've selected partners that can work closely with us through the whole process.
Certification
Selling products to children requires the highest commitment to quality and safety. In every step of the design and production process we have focused on working with only the best people and advisors and using only the best materials and manufacturers. Still, challenges could arise when the product is tested in a laboratory that could delay our certification, and thus production and launch.

story:
Explore a Planet

The goal of this campaign is to create a planetary exploration vehicle and to send it around planet earth by a relay tour crossing preferably all continents and as many countries as possible.

Get involved

Leave comments on the project page with your ideas regarding the hardware design or special features of the rover, the paintwork or give the vehicle a name.


Get in touch

This rover gives all people a hand on technology. You can control the robot easily by using a web browser. Try the robots in my RoboSpatium to see how it works.

Rent this robot

Just driving my robots isn't enough? There is something exciting you'd like to show all earthlings? Become part of the world tour and provide a landing area for this rover. Use this robot to introduce your country or the project(s) you are working on! The rover is for indoor and outdoor terrain, thus your target area can be a stone pit, your garden, a museum, a gallery or exhibition room, your school or university or...
Sending the rover to your landing area will be free of charge and of course there is no rental rate to pay. A gift (e.g. Raspberry Pi or Arduino) will be sent to all landing areas, saying thank you for your participation.
Get the word out and share this campaign with your friends, teachers or your boss or whoever might be interested in providing a mission target for the rover's world tour. Don't forget about the Indiegogo share tools, Facebook Twitter, Google+ and so on.


Broadcast personal messages to earthlings

Some perks include a text and audio message to all earthlings, which will be broadcast during rover operation. See how it works and note the rules for creating your personal message  on the supporter wall of the project page.

Give many people physical access to the robot

You can make an application for a landing area as a single person, but what about inviting some people to assist you in making the landing area more exciting? Through an infrared interface, the rover can interact with objects close to it. You will get instructions in how to connect the rover to your network infrastructure and how to establish communication between remote modules. Prepare your area several days before the rover goes live. In this period you can teach many people how the robot works or simply give them a hand on the tiny explorer.

After your mission is before the next mission - get connected.

The world tour will be a relay race. The group that sent the robot to you will get an extra hour (or two) of operation in your target area prior to the public. Establish a communication with the group of scientists that handed the robot to you and use this time to introduce your special area to all citizens of this planet and tell something about you and your team.
After your mission is over, you will be the ones that drive the rover for the first time in the next target area and so assist in introducing this location to the world. What about adding a special gift from your project as rover payload for the next group of scientists?

Telepresence

These days, news are spread quicker than ever in history, nonetheless you rarely get information at first hand. As a rover operator you can decide, where the camera points to. You get remote access to a piece of this planet that would otherwise be out of range. I am curious how this will change the way we see foreign countries!

It's all about "Physical Computing"...

As soon as people get excited about technology, the next step is to turn them into makers, creating own projects. That's why this is an open source project, handing all schematics and software to the community.

Deutsche Version

The robot computes with a Raspberry Pi and an Arduino Uno. An essential part of this project is to teach how to switch motors and LEDs, how to control servos or how to read sensor data using General Purpose Input Output pins (GPIOs).

...and "big data"

The sensor data of the rover will be transmitted to your browser and it will be recorded on a special project page for later examination. With this world tour I'd like to demonstrate, how to process large amounts of sensor data and how to display results using web technologies.

Schedule

The tour is planned to last for one earth year. An average time of 14 days will be needed to send the robot to it's next destination and to prepare that landing area, thus the number of missions is around 26. There will be a voting about candidates for landing areas if more applications are submitted. Since all continents should be visited by the robot, not only the number of votes counts.
The start of the tour is scheduled for September 2016.

What the money is needed for

  • Even if no rocket is needed to send the robot around planet earth, parcel services aren't for free (or does your shipping company want to participate?).
  • An Internet server running Perl scripts and forwarding video streams is needed to transmit data from the rover to your browser (another company out there, ready to help me?).
  • Creating the robot shown in the video was a relative cheap task, but it has some drawbacks, thus more expensive components are needed to create a robust vehicle.
  • Sensors and more cameras have to be added to make the exploration of this planet more exciting.
  • Solar cells with a better efficiency would be nice.
  • At least two robots have to be built to have a spare vehicle in case the original explorer fails completely. With the second rover in hand it will become more easy to fix hard- or software errors at it's distant counterpart. .
  • Many hours of coding will pass by to redesign the user interface, to establish some kind of chat software and to implement new features and sensors.
  • Education, thus documentation is an essential part of this project and also eats a lot of time, but students and makers need schematics as well as open sourced software to improve this project or to start a new one.
  • As you might have noticed, I am no native English speaking person. Spending some money for a professional translator might help to improve the grammar of the documentation concerning the world tour (or is there another company that would like to get involved?).

What happens if the campaign doesn't reach the goal?

Well, this project isn't just a campaign, it's my passion! If I fail to raise enough money to create a new robot and send it around the world, I will continue to invite the world to my home as I am doing for more than 4 year now. At least R5, the nameless prototype shown in the video will continue living in my garden or will be sent to several destination areas in Germany and you will have free access to this and all of my other robots. Each Euro will help to improve my RoboSpatium that is already inspiring people all over the world. Be sure, your donation won't be a waste of money!
Furthermore: A failure of this campaign doesn't mean I will give up my dream of exploring a planet with an open access roving vehicle...

Risks & Challenges

I am running remote controlled robots for more than 4 years, thus the base technology exists and I have lots of experience in running it. Even with no enhancement to the existing technologies, the mission will be exciting - won't it? With this campaign I will add several features to a new robot and to the software used to control the vehicle. New hard- and software features usually means creating new bugs, which might delay the mission but not stop it.
Running out of time isn't a problem - the tour can last for more than one earth year, but running out of money (e.g. too many broken rovers) might end the trip before all target areas can be visited.
If you are still in doubt whether the world tour will start or not, feel free to ask your questions.

Chief mechanist

In 2009 I started an open source educational project
www.HomoFaciens.de
which grew over the years. A YouTube Channel became part of it
My Youtube Channel
and robots entered my home
www.RoboSpatium.de
This is my first crowdfunding campaign, trying to raise some money for the next upgrade of my project(s) instead of spending what's left from mine ;-)

Thanks for supporting my campaign!



------------------------------------------------------------------------


Deutsche Version


Erkundet einen Planeten

Ziel dieser Kampagne ist es, einen Forschungsroboter ins Leben zu rufen und diesen in einem Staffellauf über alle Kontinente des Planeten und so viele Länder wie möglich zu senden.

Werdet Teil des Projekts

Hinterlasst einen Kommentar auf der Projektseite und teilt mir eure Ideen bezüglich des Hardware-Designs oder besonderer Fähigkeiten für den Kundschafter mit oder beteiligt euch an der Namensgebung und macht Vorschläge zur Lackierung.


Legt Hand an

Dieser Roboter ist frei zugänglich. Ihr könnt das Fahrzeug einfach mit einem Browser steuern. Probiert die Roboter in meinem RoboSpatium einfach mal aus, um zu sehen wie das funktioniert.

Mietet diesen Roboter

Nur fahren ist nicht genug? Ihr habt da etwas besonderes in eurer Nähe, das ihr allen Erdlingen zeigen möchtet? Werdet Teil der Welttournee und stellt einen Landeplatz für die Sonde zur Verfügung. Mit Hilfe des Roboters könnt ihr euer Land oder die Projekte an denen ihr zur Zeit arbeitet vorstellen! Der Rover ist für Innen- und Außeneinsätze konzipiert; Als Zielgebiet eignet sich somit unter anderem ein Steinbruch, euer Garten, ein Museum, eine Burg, eine Gallerie, eure Schule oder Universität oder...
Der Roboter wird euch kostenlos zugesendet und ihr müsst selbstverständlich keine Leihgebühr zahlen. Als Dankeschön für eure Zusammenarbeit gibt es ein kleines Geschenk (z.B. ein Raspberry Pi oder Arduino).
Verbreitetet diese Kampagne und erzählt euren Freunden, Lehrern, eurem Chef oder allen Menschen aus eurem Umfeld, die Interesse an der Bereitstellung eines Landeplatzes für die Mission haben könnten, von dem Roboter. Nutzt auch die neuen Medien wie die Indiegogo share tools, Facebook Twitter, Google+ und so weiter.


Verbreitet eure persönliche Botschaft an alle Erdlinge

Einige Angebote auf dieser Seite umfassen Text- und Audionachrichten an alle Erdlinge, die während der Missionen verbreitet werden. Auf der Ehrentafel der Projektseite findet ihr die Anleitung wie das vonstatten geht. Beachtet die Regeln zum Inhalt.

Gewährt möglichst vielen Menschen Zugang zu dem Roboter

Auch Einzelpersonen können eine Bewerbung um einen Landeplatz abgeben, aber wie wäre es damit, ein paar Menschen aus deinem Umfeld in die Mission einzubinden, um das Landegebiet auszustatten oder die Mission vorzubereiten? Mit Hilfe von Infrarot-Modulen kann der Rover mit Objekten im Zielgebiet interagieren. Instruktionen zu diesen Modulen und wie der Rover ans Internet anzubinden ist, werde ich zur Verfügung stellen und bei Problemen jederzeit helfen. Präpariert das Zielgebiet einige Tage vor Missionsbeginn. In diesem Zeitraum könnt ihr vielen Menschen aus eurer Umgebung den Roboter vorstellen.

Nach der Mission ist vor der nächsten Mission

Die Welttournee ist als Staffellauf ausgelegt. Die Gruppe, welche den Roboter zu euch gesendet hat, erhält eine extra Stunde (oder zwei), in denen diese den Roboter exklusiv steuert. Tretet in Verbindung mit euren Vorgängern und nutzt die Zeit, um euer Team und euer Missionsgebiet der Weltöffentlichkeit vorzustellen.
Nach Ablauf eurer Mission seit ihr diejenigen, welche das nächste Zielgebiet als erste Forscher erkunden. Wie wär's mit einem kleinen Geschenk für eure Nachfolger als Nutzlast?

Telepräsenz

Heutzutage verbreiten sich Neuigkeiten schneller als je zuvor in der Menschheitsgeschichte, dennoch erhält man Berichte selten aus erster Hand. Als Roverfahrer könnt ihr entscheiden, wohin die Kamera zeigt und wohin gefahren werden soll. Ihr erhaltet Zugang zu einem entfernt liegenden Teil des Planeten, der ansonsten außer Reichweite wäre. Ich bin neugierig, in welcher Form das die Sichtweise auf fremde Länder ändert!

Alles dreht sich um "Physical Computing"...

Sobald Menschen für die hinter dem Projekt stehende Technik begeistert worden sind, gilt es diese zum Nachbau anzuregen. Daher handelt es sich hier um ein Open Source Projekt. Alle Schaltpläne und die verwendete Software wird veröffentlicht und der Gemeinschaft zur Verfügung gestellt.

Der Roboter rechnet mit einem Raspberry Pi und einem Arduino Uno. Ein grundlegender Teil des Projekts dreht sich um das Schalten von LEDs, Motoren und Servos mit Hilfe von General Purpose Input Output Pins (GPIOs).

...und "big data"

Die von dem Rover erfassten Sensorendaten werden zu eurem Browser übertragen und werden auf einer gesonderten Projektseite veröffentlicht. Mit dieser Welttournee möchte ich zeigen, wie derartige Daten mit Hilfe moderner Webtechnologien aufbereitet und angezeigt werden können.

Zeitplan

Die Tour ist für eine Zeitdauer von einem Jahr geplant. Dabei sind durchschnittlich 14 Tage für den Versand von einem zum nächsten Zielort und für die Vorbereitung des Landegebietes vorgesehen, womit die Zahl der Landegebiete etwa 26 ergibt. Werden mehr Bewerbungen um Missionsziele eingereicht, so wird eine Abstimmung über die Vergabe entscheiden. Da möglichst alle Kontinente Teil der Tour werden sollten, entscheidet nicht nur die Anzahl der erhaltenen Stimmen über die Vergabe.
Der Startzeitpunkt ist für September 2016 geplant.

Wofür das Geld benötigt wird

  • Auch wenn keine Rakete benötigt wird, um den Rover zum Zielgebiet zu transportieren, so werden dennoch Portogebühren fällig (oder möchte Ihre Paketfirma an dem Projekt teilnehmen?).
  • Ein Internetserver, konfiguriert zum Ausführen von Scripts und zur Weiterleitung der Videobilder und sonstiger Daten vom Rover zu eurem Browser ist nicht kostenlos zu betreiben (ein Betätigungsfeld für ein weiteres Unternehmen, das an dem Projekt teilnehmen möchte?).
  • Den Roboter in dem Video zu bauen war einfach und relativ günstig. Der Nachfolger muss aber deutlich zuverlässiger werden und auch bessere Akkus machen das Fahrzeug wesentlich teurer.
  • Sensoren und mehr Kameras machen die Fahrt mit dem Erkundungsfahrzeug interessanter.
  • Solarzellen mit einem besseren Wirkungsgrad wären nicht schlecht.
  • Mindestens zwei identische Fahrzeuge müssen gebaut werden, um eine Reserve lossenden zu können, falls etwas völlig schief läuft. Ein zweiter, identischer Rover ermöglicht außerdem eine einfachere Fehleranalyse über Kontinente hinweg .
  • Viele Stunden an Programmierarbeit werden benötigt, um die Benutzeroberfläche neu zu gestalten und zusätzliche Funktionen wie z.B. eine Chat-Software zu implementieren.
  • Bildung, also eine fundierte Dokumentation des Projekts ist essentieller Bestandteil des Vorhabens, damit Studenten und sonstige Bastler Gelegenheit erhalten, mit dem Roboter die Handhabung neuer Technolgien zu erlernen.
  • Ein professioneller Übersetzer würde mir viel Arbeit für die Englischsprachige Version der Dokumentation abnehmen können (oder liest eine Übersetzungsagentur diese Zeilen und möchte sich an dem Projekt beteiligen?).

Was passiert, wenn die Kampagne ihr Ziel nicht erreicht?

Nun, dieses Projekt ist nicht nur eine Kampagne, es ist ein Lebenstraum von mir! Sollte ich nicht genügend Geld erhalten, um den Roboter auf seine Weltreise schicken zu können, so werde ich weiterhin die Welt in meine Roboterräume einladen, so wie ich es bereits seit mehr als 4 Jahren mache. Zumindest R5, der im Video gezeigte,  namenlose Prototyp, wird weiterhin seine Kreise in meinem Garten oder an einigen Stellen in Deutschland ziehen. Jeder Euro hilft dabei, mein RoboSpatium zu verbessern, das bereits in seiner jetzigen Prägung viele Menschen überall auf diesem Planeten inspiriert. Ihr könnt also sicher sein, dass eure Spende keine Vergeudung von Moneten ist!
Außerdem bedeutet ein Verfehlen des Kampagnenzieles nicht, dass ich meinen Traum von der Erkundung eines Planeten mit Hilfe eines ferngesteuerten Roboters aufgeben werde...

Risiken & Herausforderungen

Ich betreibe ferngesteuerte Roboter seit mehr als 4 Jahren. Die Basistechnologie existiert also bereits und ich habe einige Erfahrung im Umgang mit diesen Robotern gesammelt. Auch ohne Erweiterungen kann die Mission beginnen. Ich werde aber viele Erweiterungen in den neuen Roboter sowie die Software zur Ansteuerung desselben einbauen. Neue Hard- und Software bedeutet auch imme neue Fehler zu entwickeln, was die Mission höchstens verschieben, aber nicht scheitern lassen wird.
Zeit ist nicht das entscheidende Problem - die Tour kann durchaus länger als ein Jahr dauern, aber wenn das Geld ausgeht (z.B. weil zu viele Roboter komplett versagen), kann die Mission früher enden als veranschlagt.
Sollten nach wie vor Zweifel bestehen, dann immer her mit euren Fragen.

Chefmechaniker

2009 habe ich ein Open Source Bildungsprojekt initiiert,
www.HomoFaciens.de
das über die Jahre beständig gewachsen ist. Ein YouTube-Kanal ist mittlerweile fester Bestandteil
Mein Youtube Channel
und Roboter haben mein trautes Heim erobert
www.RoboSpatium.de
Dieses ist meine erste Crowdfunding-Kampagne mit der ich für das "nächste große Ding" etwas Geld einsammeln möchte, anstatt ständig meine eigenen Reserven dafür aufzuwenden ;-)

Danke für jede Form der Unterstützung!

Chief mechanist

In 2009 I started an open source educational projectwww.HomoFaciens.dewhich grew over the years. A YouTube Channel became part of itMy Youtube Channeland robots entered my homewww.RoboSpatium.deThis is my first crowdfunding campaign, trying to raise some money for the next upgrade of my project(s) instead of spending what's left from mine ;-)
Thanks for supporting my campaign!


------------------------------------------------------------------------

Deutsche Version


Erkundet einen Planeten Ziel dieser Kampagne ist es, einen Forschungsroboter ins Leben zu rufen und diesen in einem Staffellauf über alle Kontinente des Planeten und so viele Länder wie möglich zu senden.
Werdet Teil des Projekts
Hinterlasst einen Kommentar auf der Projektseite und teilt mir eure Ideen bezüglich des Hardware-Designs oder besonderer Fähigkeiten für den Kundschafter mit oder beteiligt euch an der Namensgebung und macht Vorschläge zur Lackierung.



Legt Hand an
Dieser Roboter ist frei zugänglich. Ihr könnt das Fahrzeug einfach mit einem Browser steuern. Probiert die Roboter in meinem RoboSpatium einfach mal aus, um zu sehen wie das funktioniert.
Mietet diesen Roboter

Nur fahren ist nicht genug? Ihr habt da etwas besonderes in eurer Nähe, das ihr allen Erdlingen zeigen möchtet? Werdet Teil der Welttournee und stellt einen Landeplatz für die Sonde zur Verfügung. Mit Hilfe des Roboters könnt ihr euer Land oder die Projekte an denen ihr zur Zeit arbeitet vorstellen! Der Rover ist für Innen- und Außeneinsätze konzipiert; Als Zielgebiet eignet sich somit unter anderem ein Steinbruch, euer Garten, ein Museum, eine Burg, eine Gallerie, eure Schule oder Universität oder...Der Roboter wird euch kostenlos zugesendet und ihr müsst selbstverständlich keine Leihgebühr zahlen. Als Dankeschön für eure Zusammenarbeit gibt es ein kleines Geschenk (z.B. ein Raspberry Pi oder Arduino).Verbreitetet diese Kampagne und erzählt euren Freunden, Lehrern, eurem Chef oder allen Menschen aus eurem Umfeld, die Interesse an der Bereitstellung eines Landeplatzes für die Mission haben könnten, von dem Roboter. Nutzt auch die neuen Medien wie die Indiegogo share tools, Facebook Twitter, Google+ und so weiter.



Verbreitet eure persönliche Botschaft an alle Erdlinge

Einige Angebote auf dieser Seite umfassen Text- und Audionachrichten an alle Erdlinge, die während der Missionen verbreitet werden. Auf der Ehrentafel der Projektseite findet ihr die Anleitung wie das vonstatten geht. Beachtet die Regeln zum Inhalt.
Gewährt möglichst vielen Menschen Zugang zu dem Roboter
Auch Einzelpersonen können eine Bewerbung um einen Landeplatz abgeben, aber wie wäre es damit, ein paar Menschen aus deinem Umfeld in die Mission einzubinden, um das Landegebiet auszustatten oder die Mission vorzubereiten? Mit Hilfe von Infrarot-Modulen kann der Rover mit Objekten im Zielgebiet interagieren. Instruktionen zu diesen Modulen und wie der Rover ans Internet anzubinden ist, werde ich zur Verfügung stellen und bei Problemen jederzeit helfen. Präpariert das Zielgebiet einige Tage vor Missionsbeginn. In diesem Zeitraum könnt ihr vielen Menschen aus eurer Umgebung den Roboter vorstellen.
Nach der Mission ist vor der nächsten Mission

Die Welttournee ist als Staffellauf ausgelegt. Die Gruppe, welche den Roboter zu euch gesendet hat, erhält eine extra Stunde (oder zwei), in denen diese den Roboter exklusiv steuert. Tretet in Verbindung mit euren Vorgängern und nutzt die Zeit, um euer Team und euer Missionsgebiet der Weltöffentlichkeit vorzustellen.Nach Ablauf eurer Mission seit ihr diejenigen, welche das nächste Zielgebiet als erste Forscher erkunden. Wie wär's mit einem kleinen Geschenk für eure Nachfolger als Nutzlast?
Telepräsenz
Heutzutage verbreiten sich Neuigkeiten schneller als je zuvor in der Menschheitsgeschichte, dennoch erhält man Berichte selten aus erster Hand. Als Roverfahrer könnt ihr entscheiden, wohin die Kamera zeigt und wohin gefahren werden soll. Ihr erhaltet Zugang zu einem entfernt liegenden Teil des Planeten, der ansonsten außer Reichweite wäre. Ich bin neugierig, in welcher Form das die Sichtweise auf fremde Länder ändert!

Alles dreht sich um "Physical Computing"...
Sobald Menschen für die hinter dem Projekt stehende Technik begeistert worden sind, gilt es diese zum Nachbau anzuregen. Daher handelt es sich hier um ein Open Source Projekt. Alle Schaltpläne und die verwendete Software wird veröffentlicht und der Gemeinschaft zur Verfügung gestellt.
Der Roboter rechnet mit einem Raspberry Pi und einem Arduino Uno. Ein grundlegender Teil des Projekts dreht sich um das Schalten von LEDs, Motoren und Servos mit Hilfe von General Purpose Input Output Pins (GPIOs)....und "big data"
Die von dem Rover erfassten Sensorendaten werden zu eurem Browser übertragen und werden auf einer gesonderten Projektseite veröffentlicht. Mit dieser Welttournee möchte ich zeigen, wie derartige Daten mit Hilfe moderner Webtechnologien aufbereitet und angezeigt werden können.
Zeitplan
Die Tour ist für eine Zeitdauer von einem Jahr geplant. Dabei sind durchschnittlich 14 Tage für den Versand von einem zum nächsten Zielort und für die Vorbereitung des Landegebietes vorgesehen, womit die Zahl der Landegebiete etwa 26 ergibt. Werden mehr Bewerbungen um Missionsziele eingereicht, so wird eine Abstimmung über die Vergabe entscheiden. Da möglichst alle Kontinente Teil der Tour werden sollten, entscheidet nicht nur die Anzahl der erhaltenen Stimmen über die Vergabe.Der Startzeitpunkt ist für September 2016 geplant.
Wofür das Geld benötigt wird


Auch wenn keine Rakete benötigt wird, um den Rover zum Zielgebiet zu transportieren, so werden dennoch Portogebühren fällig (oder möchte Ihre Paketfirma an dem Projekt teilnehmen?).


Ein Internetserver, konfiguriert zum Ausführen von Scripts und zur Weiterleitung der Videobilder und sonstiger Daten vom Rover zu eurem Browser ist nicht kostenlos zu betreiben (ein Betätigungsfeld für ein weiteres Unternehmen, das an dem Projekt teilnehmen möchte?).


Den Roboter in dem Video zu bauen war einfach und relativ günstig. Der Nachfolger muss aber deutlich zuverlässiger werden und auch bessere Akkus machen das Fahrzeug wesentlich teurer.
Sensoren und mehr Kameras machen die Fahrt mit dem Erkundungsfahrzeug interessanter.
Solarzellen mit einem besseren Wirkungsgrad wären nicht schlecht.
Mindestens zwei identische Fahrzeuge müssen gebaut werden, um eine Reserve lossenden zu können, falls etwas völlig schief läuft. Ein zweiter, identischer Rover ermöglicht außerdem eine einfachere Fehleranalyse über Kontinente hinweg .

Viele Stunden an Programmierarbeit werden benötigt, um die Benutzeroberfläche neu zu gestalten und zusätzliche Funktionen wie z.B. eine Chat-Software zu implementieren.
Bildung, also eine fundierte Dokumentation des Projekts ist essentieller Bestandteil des Vorhabens, damit Studenten und sonstige Bastler Gelegenheit erhalten, mit dem Roboter die Handhabung neuer Technolgien zu erlernen.
Ein professioneller Übersetzer würde mir viel Arbeit für die Englischsprachige Version der Dokumentation abnehmen können (oder liest eine Übersetzungsagentur diese Zeilen und möchte sich an dem Projekt beteiligen?).

Was passiert, wenn die Kampagne ihr Ziel nicht erreicht?
Nun, dieses Projekt ist nicht nur eine Kampagne, es ist ein Lebenstraum von mir! Sollte ich nicht genügend Geld erhalten, um den Roboter auf seine Weltreise schicken zu können, so werde ich weiterhin die Welt in meine Roboterräume einladen, so wie ich es bereits seit mehr als 4 Jahren mache. Zumindest R5, der im Video gezeigte,  namenlose Prototyp, wird weiterhin seine Kreise in meinem Garten oder an einigen Stellen in Deutschland ziehen. Jeder Euro hilft dabei, mein RoboSpatium zu verbessern, das bereits in seiner jetzigen Prägung viele Menschen überall auf diesem Planeten inspiriert. Ihr könnt also sicher sein, dass eure Spende keine Vergeudung von Moneten ist!Außerdem bedeutet ein Verfehlen des Kampagnenzieles nicht, dass ich meinen Traum von der Erkundung eines Planeten mit Hilfe eines ferngesteuerten Roboters aufgeben werde...
Risiken & Herausforderungen

Ich betreibe ferngesteuerte Roboter seit mehr als 4 Jahren. Die Basistechnologie existiert also bereits und ich habe einige Erfahrung im Umgang mit diesen Robotern gesammelt. Auch ohne Erweiterungen kann die Mission beginnen. Ich werde aber viele Erweiterungen in den neuen Roboter sowie die Software zur Ansteuerung desselben einbauen. Neue Hard- und Software bedeutet auch imme neue Fehler zu entwickeln, was die Mission höchstens verschieben, aber nicht scheitern lassen wird.Zeit ist nicht das entscheidende Problem - die Tour kann durchaus länger als ein Jahr dauern, aber wenn das Geld ausgeht (z.B. weil zu viele Roboter komplett versagen), kann die Mission früher enden als veranschlagt.Sollten nach wie vor Zweifel bestehen, dann immer her mit euren Fragen.
Chefmechaniker


 2009 habe ich ein Open Source Bildungsprojekt initiiert,www.HomoFaciens.dedas über die Jahre beständig gewachsen ist. Ein YouTube-Kanal ist mittlerweile fester BestandteilMein Youtube Channelund Roboter haben mein trautes Heim erobertwww.RoboSpatium.deDieses ist meine erste Crowdfunding-Kampagne mit der ich für das "nächste große Ding" etwas Geld einsammeln möchte, anstatt ständig meine eigenen Reserven dafür aufzuwenden ;-)
Danke für jede Form der Unterstützung!

story:
Solar Flask For Camping In Comfort .

http://www.solarflask.com

A Portable Solar Renewable Hot Water System For Your Camping Adventure Allows You to Boil Water Using only The Suns Energy !

  • I have close to 13 years in machine tooling,
    35 Years in construction.
    I have almost always had a project going of some sort always building something interesting and am now able build even more complex ideas into reality using Fusion 360 software .
    I know where and how to find manufactures and how to get things built .
    I have had in the past a import export license so am familiar with the process  of acquiring needed parts and pieces from overseas.  

    I have built at least 50 websites and have built a site for solar flask that will better explain what and how solar Flask will work and it's overall flexibility.

  • Please visit my site for more info on product .

  • http://www.solarflask.com

  • It's main use is for boiling water using integrated Fresnel lenses  in cylinder walls to super heat flask contents - not just limited to water but also to make stews , soups any recipe you wish to cook up   .The Solar Flask is a multi-use product that has many interchangeable parts .The upper cap can be changed out for a solar powered night light so that main cylinder can be changed into a lamp for night use.The cap can also hold a candelabra to hang hotdogs to solar cook them and also be used as Shish Ka Bob. There will also be a stainless steel cage to hold vegetables for cooking  .

  •  
  • This product will grow as more and more new parts are added .

  • I will be adding a auxiliary top cap with solar panel and led lighting so that at night the flask can be used for camp lighting while not being used to heat water .

    Status ++ = completed !

    --------------------------------------

    A secondary main cylinder that can be screwed on to main cylinder for additional heating area and a taller stainless steel flask to go along with it for additional volume .

    --------------------------------------

    I will also be adding a stainless steel cage / Candelabra style  to hold vegetables for cooking .

    ---------------------------------------

    A stainless steel cage /Candelabra style to hold lots of  hot dogs and also to be used as Shish Ka Bob.

    Status ++ = completed !

    -----------------------------------------

    A stainless steel hook rack  to hold several golf ball sized or larger stainless steel balls that can be super heated to be then dropped into your coffee or tea  or dropped into a bowl of soup , 

    -------------------------------------------

    Longer set of legs to elevate solar flask higher into suns rays .

    ------------------------------------------

    A secondary lower base with manual spring power ( Called Main Spring ) to rotate flask to keep it evenly heating .

    ------------------------------------------

    A cylinder shaped solar panel that will fit inside main cylinder to harvest solar energy=

    Status ++ = Changed to exterior - separate mirrored refractive lens

    ========================

    My projects as close to complete now as far as conceptual design goes and I now need to actually begin build out and I need your help

 

 

The Impact

This product will cover a variety of situations whether while  camping , emergency situations , developing nations :

  • With one product you will be able to -
  •  
  • Boil Water.
  • Sterilize Water .
  • Cook food .
  • Use as a solar Night Light Lamp .
  • Use as a Thermo Electric generator to produce energy

  •  

  •  

  • I have included my resume to show I am very computer literate so will have no problems marketing  product once it is finished .

story:
Idea

I love cycling.

Not trained to be a professional, I just want a simple decent bike, that is suitable for all terrains in a city, to enjoy the breeze and differentiate myself from others.

Neither the fastest, nor the cheapest, but the most outstanding. The core idea when we start to develop MC² transforming bike is having fun.  

 

Vision

Inspired by the transformer movies, we brainstorm how to create a fun bike that is simple yet sophisticated within aesthetic yet functional,  lightweight yet reliable, and suitable for all terrains in a city, indoors or outdoors, on road or off road. We want MC² transforming bike to be not just a cool bicycle, but also a positive attitude and joyful lifestyle. 

 

Features

Transformability

MC² bike riders are able to self-configure the bicycle freely into Sport modes (driving wheel behind) and Cruiser mode (driving wheel in front), in which people will have unique riding experience and a lot of fun.

The Mobility mode allows long distance travel within a city by public transports.

Tools are not required during the folding process.

Now we are having a very exciting feature of recumbent saddle. It is foldable and user-configurable by adding extra joints (to different heights) and adjusting the suspension rubber length (to fine tune the each joint's angle to fit your spine).

After 200,000 times of 120kg-force impacts, MC² bike had passed ISO 4210 safety tests and now in production.

We are showing at Eurobike 2016. You may visit our booth at Hall 3 #701 to see and try out the real products.​

Since Ebikes are gaining in popularity, MC² bike is able to upgrade by replacing the driven wheel with a Ewheel addon. It's under developing and going to launch in 2017.

 

MC² Chainless driving system

MC² bike has no chain. Our patented chainless driving system simplifies the bicycle design by eliminate the indirect driving system, which has been using in vintage bicycles since 1880’s.

It also saves the trouble of maintenance. Since our gear box is directly attached onto the hub, there won’t be any headaches about chain dropping off and dirty your pants.

It outputs two gear ratios (1:1 & 1:3) for different speed requirements. 1:1 for climbing uphill, and 1:3 for normal riding, which are sufficient for daily use in a city.

Lastly, the driving wheel is a free wheel regardless of gear ratios. You can always do reverse pedaling anytime you want to.

 

MC² Hydraulic adapter

MC² bike features both hydraulic disc brakes on driving and driven wheels. To remain consistency of brake grip and caliper (left and right) after transforming, detachable non-flow through hydraulic brakes adapters are implemented. Since there is no hydraulic oil flow through all the time, it eliminates the oil residues during attach/detach processes. The oil reservoir is also integrated inside the adapter to compensate the temperature variations.

 

MC² gym kit

With the MC² Gym Kit, users are no longer limited to riding in the outdoors only, they can now enjoy riding the MC²​ transforming bike indoors anytime, on rainy days or in winter time. ​By attaching to the driving wheel, the dynamo can generate power for electronic devices, allowing users to work on multi-tasks while pedaling.

After dismantle, the whole set of Gym Kit only requires a small storage space (25cm X 15CM X 90cm).

Phone mount

We also CNC bicycle accessories, such as phone mounts. It is designed for all type of phones, with sizes from 3.5" to 6.2". Although it's lightweight, it has a strong holding force. With this simple device, you can happily ride with your phone.

 

Perks

Now we are offering same price for 26" and 28" driving wheel. 

 

Impact

We are the winner of International Bicycle Design Competition 2014, passed ISO 4210 tests in Dec 2015, and had already featured on:

What does the cycling industry say?

 

Timeline

Team

Challenges

Although all parts in MC² bikes are precisely made by CNC process, we still need manpower for assembly due to the complexity of the mechanism. The solution is to set up more automation lines in near future.

story:
About Us

Hi, I'm Jordan and I am the creator and lead developer of Jaunt. Jaunt is a social travel app that allows you to plot your adventures around the globe and share them with the people around you. Upload images along the way to inspire others and make your mates jealous!

So we welcome you to join us on our jaunt from idea to travelling the world with our app!

 

The History Behind The App

Are you fed up of hearing sob stories about why people need your money to fund their product or service? Yes? So are we! Which is exactly why we won't bore you with one!

The concept for Jaunt was born back in May 2016 when my three best friends and I went on an epic 6500 mile road trip across America. For the previous two years I was stuck in a dead end IT Manager position in a local company with little to no job satisfaction, never mind the will to live.

All the plans had been finalised for the trip to America and it was time for me to ask for three weeks off work for this potentially once in a lifetime trip. I went in to see the boss man and asked him for the time off. This wasn’t the first time that I had asked for holidays before so I thought nothing of it.

To my amazement his reaction was like nothing else I had ever seen before. It was as if I had just told him that I was planning to murder his family!

Long story short, my resignation was on his desk by the end of the day!

There was no chance I was missing this trip!

With the America trip booked, very little money saved and no job to come home to apart from some web design work to finish off I was feeling pretty nervous. But for the first time in the last 2 years I was actually very happy with my life!

On the morning of the trip we finally left Dublin and flew to Pittsburgh via Boston. This is when I found out that my connecting flight in Boston was different from the others, leaving me stranded for 2 hours. Whilst I was left in the airport by myself I began flicking through Facebook saw that some of my mates were having the time of their lives out in India trying to find their inner self or some garbage like that!

This got me thinking, I wanted to be that guy posting those photos that made you want to tell your boss to stick their job so you could go travelling. Then I started looking for an app that would allow me to upload photos on a map that would plot our epic journey. After a search online the only people that seemed to have something close was Apple and to be honest it just didn’t have the functionality I would have wanted.

And in that instant Jaunt was born. Jaunt is a social travel app that will allow you to plot your adventures around the globe and share them with the people around you. Upload images along the way to inspire others and make your mates jealous! With the search functionality you will also be able to use Jaunt to plan your next trip using the in app planning tool.

 

Our Plans

Right, down to the business side of things. I know what I have to say may sound incredibly boring but apparently this stuff is important. The Jaunt team have all sat down and set out some targets for where we want to be by the end of the year.

I just want to make it clear that these dates are only a guideline and most of the future deadlines depend on the success of this crowdfunding campaign. Below is an infograph that shows our journey into the unknown. We have also included a few past dates to show what has been happening behind the scenes for almost a year now.

As you can see from the timeline above we are looking to have the app through most of the development and testing phases by the end of the year. As mentioned before this all depends on getting the funding we need to work on the app full time.

 

March 2017

March is going to be both exciting and scary for us as we are planning to start funding through grants and also our IndieGoGo campaign.

Before starting the app development process we had no idea how much we would actually need to build the app never mind sustain the amount of users we are expecting each month. We are currently looking at an estimated monthly running cost of around £1200 before we even take into consideration the cost of paying our team - who are currently working for free!

 

June 2017

By June 2017 we would like to be at the stage where we are able to offer the app to close friends, select travel enthusiasts and also our generous crowdfunding backers on Android! This early version of the app will allow you to plot a map on your travels, upload images and search for your maps your friends have created.

At this stage the app will have basic functionality while we work out the bugs that will inevitably occur. During this time we will hold a server crash party where we will stress test the servers in the hope that we push them to the limit! For all involved there will be a reward if we can crash them! So sign up to our newsletter to keep up to date!

 

December 2017

Our December goal is to start our public beta programme that will allow invited users to download the app and start plotting their Jaunts. By this stage we are hoping that most of the apps’ functionality will be finished, but don’t think this is the end; we have plenty more in store for the future of Jaunt!

 

What We Need & What You Get

With your help, the £10,000 will help us set up our own private servers and enable us to work full time on the app. With us working on the app full time we hope to hit our public beta release date by the end of December 2017. At the minute the team are working for free, putting in every minute of their spare time into making the app a reality. We need funding to allow us to work consistently and to fuel our caffeine filled coding sessions!

Currently we do not have a stable working version of the app, meaning we can't offer it for download, but we are working on getting a sustainable version out as quickly as we can! When the campaign has ended we will ship out all our merchandise that you have selected through the perks. For everyone that backs our app you will also get a "Friend of Jaunt" badge beside your name that all future members will be able to see! All perks will gain you access to the Beta version of our app with some of the perks offering exclusive access to our Alpha release! You will be amongst the first to ever use the Jaunt app!

-IndieGoGo exclusive hand printed hoodie design

You may have seen the "Jaunt of Fame" on our perks. This will be a page on our website and app where everyone will be able to see your name in all it's glory as well as paragraph from all of us at Jaunt thanking you for your generosity and making our dream a reality. Lets face it, without you wonderful people we would be looking years before we could see our app out in the real world! 

 

The Impact

If we are able to hit our target of £10,000  we reckon it will take at least one year until the full release of the app. Helping us reach this milestone will not only mean a lot to us, but also ensure that you get the highest quality social travel app EVER, sooner! Currently the app is only being working on for release on the Google Play Store but your funding will also speed up the development and release on the App store.

The app will not only let you track and record your once in a lifetime journey, it will also allow you to plan it in advance with the handy planning tool that shows you similar Jaunts. These Jaunts will include blog posts, images and notes to help you decide where to visit while you are travelling.

If we are able to surpass the £10,000 target we are planning to add in extra features to the app sooner than expected as we will have the resources in place. These features could include integration with Airbnb, suggesting cheap places to stay while you're travelling along your Jaunt!

 

Risks & Challenges

With any project there are risks and challenges we will need to overcome with the app. These include bugs in the code, missed deadlines and server crashes.

All the mentioned risks and challenges above can and will be overcome with your help from being part of the exclusive Alpha and Beta programmes outlined in the perks. But don't let this put you off as we will do absolutely everything within our control to keep our app bug and crash free while hitting the deadlines we have put in place!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Unless you are a "Genius Billionaire Playboy Philanthropist" or a top class computer programmer at Google the only other way you can help us apart from funding the app is to share us on your social media pages.

Essentially the more people that share and like the project, the more funding we get, and the sooner we are going to be able to finish the app release it for everyone to use!

 

Special Thanks

I would just like to take this chance to thank you wonderful people around me for helping so much to get Jaunt to where it is right now:

Sam Orr - Video (Amber Tree Filmhouse)

Bryan Greig

Heather Greig - VPA-NI

Dawn Orr

My Mum & Dad

Johnny & Rachel McBride - Haptik

Holly Greig - Actress & Voice Over

The wonder actors in the video

And of course, YOU!

story:
Fire in the Hole Stoves

Fire in the Hole Stoves are the most rugged, dependable outdoor cooking solution available.

Dissatisfied with flimsy, cheaply made alternatives, I set out a few years ago to create a rocket stove that would enable me to reliably generate intense, sustained heat while cooking over wood.

After years of experimentation, I perfected a design that allows me to enjoy two of my greatest passions: Being outdoors and cooking great food. I'm confident that you will love our stoves and that they will bring you years of enjoyment.

 

Quality to Last a Lifetime

Many companies value quantity over quality. They produce high-volume, poorly-made products overseas—products that wear out quickly and break with the slightest rough treatment. Profit is the bottom line, not excellence.

At Fire in the Hole Stoves, we are committed to quality, and all of our stoves are designed to last a lifetime. Our stoves are made of heavy, high-gauge steel and are nearly indestructible (they're even bulletproof up to .223, we checked!). Whether you're cooking out off-grid or in your back yard, these stoves will provide you with decades of intensive use. These stoves are proudly designed and manufactured in Oklahoma, USA and come with a lifetime warranty.

Unique Design 

After years of experimentation, I perfected a stove design that offers an excellent cooking experience. It's heavy duty but portable, and efficient but much higher capacity than any other rocket stove available. You won't find another rocket stove quite like it.

The angled chamber provides optimum airflow and auto feeds the fuel, while the built-in cleaning tool makes maintaining a blaze and emptying ashes easy. The large cooking surface allows you to use a variety of skillets, dutch ovens, and griddles based on your cooking needs. The carry handle makes  transportation simple and convenient. 

 

 

Cook Delicious Food Anywhere

Our stoves are rugged enough to keep you cooking during a natural disaster or an economic collapse (keeping our fingers crossed that doesn't happen!). They're portable enough to use as a camp stove in the middle of nowhere. And yes, they're also perfect for cooking on your back patio with friends on a summer evening. 

Wherever. Whenever. Fire in the Hole Rocket Stoves are ready to get you cooking. 

 

Simple and Efficient

Fire in the Hole Stoves are perfect for the experienced cook or the complete beginner. They're even easy enough for kids to use (with parental oversight, of course). If you can collect a few pieces of wood and light a match, you can use a Fire in the Hole stove.

Wherever you are, Fire in the Hole stoves will get you cooking in no time. 

 

What Your Support Provides

We have built, tested and are currently manufacturing Fire In The Hole stoves, and although we have several ready to deliver, we need your help to take our operation to the next level.

Through your support, we will be able to:

  • Source quality materials to keep the cost down
  • Invest in branded packaging
  • Keep Fire in the Hole stoves made in the USA
  • Spread the word about our products through advertisements
  • Enhance our website and buying experience

 

Spread the Word

Thank you for checking out our campaign! Any pledge is greatly appreciated and helps us continue to produce a product we hope becomes a family heirloom. Please share this campaign with your friends, family, or anyone who might enjoying cooking outdoors. You can also follow us on Facebook.

Thank you!

story:
I'm a big fan of multi tools (at 8 years I played with my original P-38 can opener) I have always loved the idea of having multiple tools at my fingertips. Most of the available tools have been designed to do a very limited number of functions well and are often compromised due to size (too small and thin) and over complexity.After many conversations with my fellow DIYers, adventures, the days by boat , jams of replicas in paintball and softair, I learned I was not alone, we were all looking for not just a multi-tool, but a survival machine, that could solve the problems at that time and in that situation! It was then I set out to design a multi-tool with high functionality and a wide versatility of features housed in an compact architecture.

 

Thank you for your support !

The AXEM4.0 was designed with the desire to create an object that is both beautiful and functional.Machined from a solid steel block, with satin finish, for the pleasure of having an object in your hands, a consistent object of the right size.
Because we draw with the heart!

The AXEM4.0 was developed using an iterative design process globally practiced in industrial and product design.  Designs were first sketched and then built in with advanced 3D software to create prototypes for 3D printing.  Prototypes were 3D printed in plastic, then measured, tested, and refined until every detail performed its job perfectly.

ONE product, so many functions: The AXEM4.0 is not a simple multitool, but a survival machine that everyone should own.This survivor pocket tool is an essential product that neatly and discreetly fits in your wallet, pocket, backpack, glove compartment, or purse. It's an axe, saw, wrench, spear head, bottle opener, cutter, and  other many functions. You'll be amazed that such a small product can do so much.The top side has a razor-edge blade that can be utilized as a knife to cut things like rope, kindling, meat. When attached to a pole or piece of wood and secured with string, ropes, or vines, it can function as a tomahawk. The blade can also be used as to scrape ice, carve wood, and skinning.

Most of survival tools are sized 85x54, the AXEM4.0 has 103x75 mm.

The thickness is generally 0.8-1.2, the AXEM4.0 has a thickness of 2.5 mm.

To pre-order a AXEM4.0, click the button "Get this perk". Once you have pledged, you can sit back and relax. We'll collect your shipping information when this project is complete, in October 2018. Once you pledge, you can follow all the exciting updates as we manufacture your product and bring it to life.

  • When will you ship?

Currently in the prototype phase, we plan to start shipping to our first backers in October 2018.

  • Do you ship worldwide?

We ship to all countries.All shipping can be followed by a tracking number.

  • I want to be a distributor or retailer, where do I start?

Get your preview and contact us, we are open to distributors and retailers worldwide.

  • For any questions contact:  info@axem40.com

Inspired by desire to design and create innovative, functional and elegant products , we pride ourselves on emphasizing on the importance of quality, expert craftsmanship and attention to detail.

Thank you for your support!

story:
Unique in its kind –

After months of designing, testing, and many failed versions, a portable, space-saving, and light-weighted hanger was born! 

 

 

 

 

Easy to use  ----

They don’t take much space at all.

Yet it’s indeed a hanger when unfolded!

story:
About This Project

Have you ever wished there was a product that could monitor, issue alerts, and track your vehicle, bike or child or any other moving asset,  but ONLY when they move out of range or are in your absence? We do as well!  And that's exactly why we are developing the MDP Device and Apps. But we need your support to complete its development so that we can offer the product to the general public. Please continue reading...

Imagine the peace of mind you will have if, for example, you are  visiting Disney Land with your children and one of them wanders off.  Instead of panicking, you will be able to track them and locate them immediately. Our tracking device is designed to monitor your 2 to 10-year-old child, typically the age group  that does not have a smart phone.

MDP is the first versatile tracking product that even protects user's privacy. It consists of:

  • The MDP Device - Battery Powered Hardware
  • The MDP App - for iOS and Android Phones
  • The MDP Server - the Backend Server

The MDP Device and App communicate with each other via Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE). When the MDP Device and a phone (on which the MDP App runs) are within range (15 meters) of each other, the MDP App tracks the asset and MDP Device goes into idle mode. In order to protect  user's privacy, all tracking data remains locally on the phone and is not transmitted to any Backend Serve . However, when the phone is out of range and yet the object that is carrying the MDP Device is moving, the MDP Device turns on its built-in GNSS (GPS) receiver and Cellular Modem, tracks the asset and immediately notifies the user on his/her phone via remote push notification.

The MDP App allows the user to easily change the type of the asset that is being tracked from the default Vehicle/Motorbike to Person (Child/Elderly) or Bicycle, as shown in the App screenshots below. Users may also adjust the radius of the geo-fencing circle for receiving alerts when the Person exits it.  

                       

How about our bikes? We park them outside a coffee shop and by the time we return, they're gone!

That's too bad, but no worries ! If your bike is equipped with the MDP device (placed under the seat), you would immediately receive an alert on your phone and could track it on map, no matter how far it moves away. The range is unlimited, because the MDP Device comes with built-in GNSS (GPS) and Cellular modem and will find the location of the bike with an accuracy level of meters, anywhere in the world.

Car getting too hot? MDP Device is equipped with temperature sensor and ambient sound detector. If interior temperature of the car gets too hot and it hears noise from inside (pet, child, etc.), MDP App immediately delivers warning (via remote push notification) on user's phone, if he/she is not in close proximity of the car.

How about locating our Quadcopters or Drones?

Drones - strictly speaking, ‘multicopters’ - are ubiquitous now. We see them in the news, behind the camera filming aerial footage, and more frequently in parks. There is something thrilling about zooming through the air, controlling the futuristic device from your mobile phone. If you are one of these guys, then I bet you would also love MDP. You can place (or attach) an MDP Device inside your drone to track it in real-time on your phone and obviously locate it with meters level accuracy, if you ever lose it.


Can the MDP Device track driving trips?

The simple answer is: Yes. Wouldn't it be nice if we had a product that automatically record our trips and could show where and how long ago the vehicle was parked. Additionally, if someone is foolish enough to attempt to steal it, you will receive alert immediately on your phone and be able to track it on a map. This feature will help you as well as law enforcement get your vehicle back to you in record time - and mete out justice!

It doesn't matter if you are a professional runner or a casual walker like me, the  MDP App allows you to manually record your walking, running, biking, or driving trips. It shows the route on a map and updates the  distance and duration of the trip in real-time in both US (foot, mile) and Metric (meter, kilometer) units. The Trips History page of the MDP App lists up to 20 previous trips, as shown in screenshots below. The user has the option to delete those they do not wish to keep. The App will automatically overwrite the earliest entry.

   


Size of MDP

The MDP Device comes in two models for this campaign:

  • MDP Device 1
  • MDP Device 1s

As shown in the image below, the "MDP Device 1" is slightly bigger than a credit card, but fairly thin at  10 mm (about the thickness of iPhone 4S). "MDP Device 1s" is smaller than a credit card, but a little thicker at 15 mm. The MDP Device 1s easily fits under a bike's saddle (seat).


MDP Device Colors

The MDP Device comes in five colors. If you want a color other than white, please select the relevant Perk for it:

  • White
  • Green
  • Blue
  • Yellow
  • Pink
Below are images of MDP Device 1 in its five colors:


The following are images of MDP Device 1s in its five colors:



MDP Feature Breakdown

MDP Device consists of the following major components:

  • Bluetooth Low Energy chip from CSR
  • GNSS receiver from Furuno
  • Cellular modem from Sierra Wireless
  • Atmega processor from Atmel
  • Accelerometer sensor
  • Temperature sensor
  • Sound detector
  • mini USB connector
  • 1500 mAh Li-Ion Battery
  • SIM card
  • Buzzer

Current Status

We have designed and manufactured the first version of the "MDP Device 1" and we are currently developing the firmware. We are also in the process of manufacturing the "MDP Device 1s", which is smaller in size. The MDP Server is fully developed and up and running on Amazon Cloud EC2. iOS version of the MDP App is fully developed. A Beta version of the Android App is ready as well.

We have also developed a separate iOS App called the "MDP iOS Device", that emulates our hardware. This App, together with the MDP IOS App are available for download on iTunes TestFlight. Please email us if you would like to test these iOS Apps. The Android App is not fully developed yet. You can evaluate almost all features of the MDP solution using these iOS Apps, except battery consumption and very early detection of movements. Please note that Apps must run on two separate phones. The iPhone must be 4s or newer. As for Android, it should be OS version 4.3 (API level 18) or newer. The majority of new Android phones support Bluetooth Low Energy. To check if you Android phone supports it, please check this website.

   


Use of Fund

We will use this campaign's fund to support the following tasks:
  • Hardware Development and Refinement
  • Firmware Refinement 
  • Develop Waterproof Enclosure (case) for MDP Devices
  • Power Consumption Optimization
  • Certifications - FCC, CE, PTCRB

Technical Details

The GNSS receiver of the MDP device is the GN87, made by eRide (formerly based in San Francisco, now a Furuno company). It is one of the best of its kind in the market. Shahram Rezaei, founder of MDP, worked for more than 8 years at eRide and was the main developer of eRide's long-term GNSS aiding data (known as LTCSM). This aiding data enables the receiver to determine its position within seconds, even in tough environments. Long term aiding data are good for 7 days. At MDP, we have implemented an innovative method (patent-pending) to transfer this aiding data to the receiver inside the MDP device. As shown in the diagram below, the MDP App downloads this data from our backend server, which itself receives the data from Furuno's GNSS Aiding server. When the MDP device and phone are within range of each other, the App sends the GNSS aiding data to the device via Bluetooth Low Energy.

When the BLE connection between phone and device breaks, the MDP device starts monitoring the movement of the object carrying the device. Upon observing a movement, it transmits location data of the object to MDP server. The server then sends a remote push notification to the App in order to notify the user about the event and query if he/she would like to track the movement or simply dismiss the alert.

There are some cellular based tracking devices in the market that claim to be able to determine the location within 100 meters accuracy level, but don't believe it! To prove it for yourself, use an Android phone and run a Network Location App, like Network Location Tracker,  to find out how poor the accuracy is, even when there are several cellular towers around the phone. Actual accuracy of these systems is from several hundred meters to a few kilometers. They determine a device's location by scanning nearby GSM cellular towers. The Location of cellular towers are mostly known (check Opencellid for example) and distance to each tower can be roughly estimated from  the strength of the received cellular signal. To achieve even a 500 meter accuracy, a strong signal from three or more GSM cellular towers needs to be received. This is not possible in many regions. Out of the biggest US carriers, only AT&T and T-Mobile run on GSM networks, while Verizon and Sprint use CDMA technology. So, the three cellular towers mentioned above can only be from AT&T or T-Mobile.

                      

Schedule

We are very excited to deliver the MDP Devices and Apps to our supporters by November 15th of 2015.  Our iOS Apps are already available for download on iTunes via TestFlight. The Android version of the App will be ready by July 15th of 2015.

Contact Us

Please do not hesitate to contact us should you have any questions, comments, or suggestions! You can leave your questions on the comments page or send us an email at info@mydrivingpal.com.

Please like us on Facebook: www.facebook.com/mydrivingpal and follow us on Twitter @mydrivingpal.

For inquiries regarding Distribution, Retail, and Partnerships please send emails to info@mydrivingpal.com.

FAQ

1) What countries does the MDP Device work in? 
The current version of MDP Device, which is going to be delivered through this campaign, works in at least 88 countries (including the United States, European Union, Russia, Japan, India, South Africa, Australia, and many more). We are getting out Global Cellular (Mobile) data service from Aeris. To find out if your country is covered, please check list below or this website. On the website, please go to "GSM Data Coverage Map” section and then click on “View Detailed Coverage” button. The only geographical limitation associated with MDP product is the cellular (mobile) network availability. GPS, Bluetooth Low Energy, and MDP Apps all work fine everywhere in the world.

List of countries covered by the MDP Devices:


2) Is this a one-time fee for the MDP Device or are there additional subscription fees to track an object? 
The fee is all-inclusive. All communication expenses are included in the price, so there is no additional monthly, renewal, etc. charges for MDP. 

3) Do you provide the SIM card? 
Yes, The MDP Device is shipped with a factory-installed SIM card. You DON'T need to buy your own SIM card and pay for the service. 

4) How long does the battery last on one charge? 
We are using a 1500 mAh rechargeable Lithium battery in MDP Device. Depending on the usage, the battery may last between 1 to +6 months. The later is when MDP is used mostly to monitor a vehicle (car, motor-bike, bike, etc.) with occasional (couple of times, each 2-3 hours, per month) use for monitoring a person (child, elderly, etc.). The former is when MDP is used 6-8 hours every day for monitoring a person.
MDP Device is most of the time in idle mode (only accelerometer and/or Bluetooth Low Energy being active), only when asset (car, child, bike, etc.) moves out of range, it starts tracking the object. Other times, MDP App is aware of the situation. 

5) Is MDP iOS App compatible with my iPhone? 
iPhone 4s and newer are compatible with the MDP App. 

6) Is MDP iOS App available for download now? If so, how can I access it?
Yes, we have published our iOS Apps on TestFlight site of iTunes. Please email us at info@mydrivingpal.com, if you would like to test it. We need the email address for adding you to the list of the external testers on TestFlight. You will receive an email from iTunes  that contains a link to download our iOS App. 

7) Is MDP Android App compatible with my Android phone? 
The majority of new Android phones support Bluetooth Low Energy. To check if your Android phone supports it, please check this website. 

8) Is MDP Android App available for download now? If so, how can I access it?
No, the Android version is in development right now. Please email us at info@mydrivingpal.com, if you would like us to notify you as soon as it becomes available. We are planning to release it by July 15th of 2015. 

9) How can I recharge the battery inside my MDP Device? 
The MDP Device is rechargeable via mini USB cable (similar to Android phones). 

10) Is MDP device water resistant? 
MDP Device 1 is water resistant enough to resist rain and ambient moisture. MDP Device 1s is waterproof.

11) Does MDP Device have cellular modem, GPS or Bluetooth inside? 
Yes, it has built-in GSM cellular modem, assisted GNSS (GPS) receiver, and Bluetooth Low Energy (also known as BTLE, BLE, or Bluetooth 4.0). 

12) Is it possible to turn the device off? 
Yes, you  simply press the power button on the side of the device to turn it off. 

13) How can I change type of the asset (object) that MDP monitors? 
On the MDP App, press the drop-down menu button in the upper right corner of the screen, then tap on Settings. Now you can switch the type of  asset from Vehicle/Motorcycle to Person (Child/Elderly) or Bicycle. Please note that at the time of this change, the device needs to be in range and connected with the phone via BLE. 

14) How can I manually force MDP Device to do Bluetooth advertising? 
You can turn the Device off and then back on to force Bluetooth Advertising for minimum of 60 seconds. 

15) Does the MDP App automatically record my driving trips? 
Yes, by default when the MDP Device is placed inside a car or motorbike, in combination with the MDP App, they automatically record the trips. You can disable the Automatic recording on the Setting page of the App if you don't want your trips recorded. 

16) How is my privacy protected? 
Neither the MDP App nor the MDP Device sends any location data to the backend server; the location data are all stored locally on the phone or in the device. Only when the  phone and the MDP Device are out of range and the object carrying the MDP Device is moving, does the MDP Device send the position data to the MDP Server, so that it may notify the user about the event. 

17) Can I delete one of my previous trips on the App? 
Absolutely, Trips History page of the App shows information of the previous 20 trips. Any of these trips can be easily deleted by swiping to the left on the table's row for that trip.

About This ProjectHave you ever wished there was a product that could monitor, issue alerts, and track your vehicle, bike or child or any other moving asset,  but ONLY when they move out of range or are in your absence? We do as well!  And that's exactly why we are developing the MDP Device and Apps. But we need your support to complete its development so that we can offer the product to the general public. Please continue reading...Imagine the peace of mind you will have if, for example, you are  visiting Disney Land with your children and one of them wanders off.  Instead of panicking, you will be able to track them and locate them immediately. Our tracking device is designed to monitor your 2 to 10-year-old child, typically the age group  that does not have a smart phone. MDP is the first versatile tracking product that even protects user's privacy. It consists of:
The MDP Device - Battery Powered Hardware
The MDP App - for iOS and Android Phones
The MDP Server - the Backend Server
The MDP Device and App communicate with each other via Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE). When the MDP Device and a phone (on which the MDP App runs) are within range (15 meters) of each other, the MDP App tracks the asset and MDP Device goes into idle mode. In order to protect  user's privacy, all tracking data remains locally on the phone and is not transmitted to any Backend Serve . However, when the phone is out of range and yet the object that is carrying the MDP Device is moving, the MDP Device turns on its built-in GNSS (GPS) receiver and Cellular Modem, tracks the asset and immediately notifies the user on his/her phone via remote push notification.The MDP App allows the user to easily change the type of the asset that is being tracked from the default Vehicle/Motorbike to Person (Child/Elderly) or Bicycle, as shown in the App screenshots below. story:
Our Story So Far:

BlackCraft Longboards began as an idea shared between 4 siblings over year ago and has grown into a small business that is preparing to hit the market with its first product line.

 

It all started when Dan Lierman had the idea to build a better longboard by going against the conventional longboard-making wisdom and using carbon fiber rather than maple wood plies. As avid longboarders, we could all immediately see the advantages of using carbon fiber over traditional wood. Because of its synthetic design and complete flexibility before curation, carbon fiber enables us to make a board that is not only stronger, lighter, and 100% waterproof, but also one that is completely shapeable to any curvature or concave we can imagine (a huge limitation with wooden models).

 

The idea got us really excited, and we started looking into the reality of actually producing such a board on our own. To our surprise we only found a few garage-shop direct competitors, half of which weren’t even located in the US.

 

In the winter of 2016 we took the idea and ran with it. Paul (then a senior in college) used the board as the flagship product of hypothetical company created for an entrepreneurship class at Indiana University's Kelley School of Business.

 

The company incorporated in February of 2016, and in a few months' time the siblings had drafted a rough 3D sketch of the board, conducted market research, organized a business plan with full-fledged marketing and entry-to-market strategies, secured a strategic partnership with a prominent carbon fiber manufacturer in Indianapolis, and hand-made a prototype board deck out of carbon fiber. 

 

In April, Paul delivered a pitch on behalf of the company to a panel of investors, resulting in a trip to San Diego, CA to meet with executives of some of the biggest and best companies in the industry (including Sector 9, Muir Skate, and more) as well as retailers and board shop owners on the coast.

 

Since the trip to the West Coast in June of 2016, BlackCraft has been hard at work revising, submitting, re-revising, and re-submitting our design to our manufacturing partner. Finally, in March of this year the company received the green light to begin production. 

 

So What Now?

We have spent the past year setting in place all of the factors necessary to launch and grow this company. Our last hurdle is an initial startup cost to cover the expenses of a manufacturing mold to be made for our board frames. Once we are able to purchase this mold, we will be able to manufacture boards with only manufacturing costs.
